title: Driver - Full Time (NTD)
description:
.

National Tire Distributors is Canada's leading Tire Distribution Company. A key element of our success has always been our people. As part of our team philosophy, we coach, support and help develop all of our employees to become the best they can be! If you're looking for a career that will challenge you, a job that will offer growth, and a progressive employer, then National Tire Distributors Inc. (NTD) is the right place for you!

The main responsibility for the Driver position is the timely and safe delivery of tires, wheels and other products to our NTD customers. This role is a key component of a dynamic team focused on providing our customers with everything they require to succeed. The position will introduce the employee to multiple functions within NTD Delivery and Operations. Key to success in this role is the ability to adapt to and perform various processes efficiently and safely. As a main point of contact with our customer base maintaining a courteous and professional manner is critical. This position will provide the Driver with the knowledge and experience necessary for growth within NTD.

We offer:
- $19/HR
- Excellent group Health Benefits, including Health, Dental, Paramedical, Vision, etc. with only 30 day waiting period
- Production bonus
- RRSP Company Matching
- Tire Purchase Program for family and friends
- Workperks - Discounts on over 3000 Vendors
- Employee and Family Assistance Program (EAP)
- Paid Vacation
- Vacation Purchase Program
- Personal Time Off Days
- Winning Culture
- Micro-learning platform
- and more!

Apply online or in person.
We are located at:

4770 - 68th Avenue SE
Calgary, AB
T2C 4M7
Canada

   

   

Build a challenging and rewarding career with us!

title: AZ Driver
description:
Great company. Great people. Great opportunities.

As a Class A-CDL Driver at United Rentals, your goal will be to assist in meeting Trench Safety needs of our customers by delivering equipment in a safe, timely, efficient, and courteous manner. At the same time, you will have the opportunity to advance your career and contribute to our company's tremendous success and unparalleled growth. Frequently interacting with our customers, you will serve as a company ambassador and will provide exceptional customer service. And since we're local, you'll be home every night. 

Additional duties include the following:
•    Drop off and pick up equipment for customers
•    Operate construction equipment, such as semi-trucks and trailers ("low boys") consistent with DOT classification CDL-A
•    Maintain driver's logs and complete pre-trip inspections 
•    Suggest additional equipment and supplies customers may need
•    Must also be able to operate boom trucks and cranes in accordance with manufacturer specifications
•    Adhere to all safety requirements particular to equipment including Federal Motor Carrier Safety Regulations 
•    Other duties assigned as needed

If you would enjoy the stability of working for the world's largest equipment rental provider, who provides ample opportunities for career growth, consider a future with United Rentals.  

Job Requirements:
•    Valid Class A CDL with acceptable driving record 
•    High School Diploma or GED 
•    Minimum of 2 years DOT regulated Commercial Driving Experience 
•    Superior customer service, teamwork and verbal/written communication skills
•    Ability to frequently lift items up to 45 lbs.
•    Basic knowledge of construction equipment and safe driving procedures
•    Diligent attention to safety 

At United Rentals, the largest equipment rental company, we believe that it takes great employees to build a great organization – and we’re passionate about helping our people grow professionally and embrace teamwork in everything they do. Our culture is based on our corporate values and centers on mutual respect, job satisfaction, diversity and a shared responsibility to build a better future.

What's in it for you?

U.S. Full Time roles:  Best in class benefits offering includes medical, dental, vision, flex spending and health savings accounts;  401(k) retirement with company match; life and disability insurance; and paid time off including sick, vacation, holidays, and paid parental leave.  Comprehensive training and development and career growth opportunities.

U.S. Part Time roles: Benefits offering includes 401(k) retirement with company match/RRSP; paid time off including sick, vacation and holidays; and comprehensive training and development and career growth opportunities.

Canada: Best in class benefits package which includes medical, dental & vision, RRSP/DPSP*, paid time off, comprehensive training and development, and career growth opportunities.

*Offered for full time roles, part time eligibility in select provinces

United Rentals, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer of women, minorities, protected veterans and individuals with disabilities.

title: Full-Time Driver - Brampton South center
description:
Before you apply to a job, select your language preference from the options available at the top right of this page.

Explore your next opportunity at a Fortune Global 500 organization. Envision innovative possibilities, experience our rewarding culture, and work with talented teams that help you become better every day. We know what it takes to lead UPS into tomorrow—people with a unique combination of skill + passion. If you have the qualities and drive to lead yourself or teams, there are roles ready to cultivate your skills and take you to the next level.

Job Description:

At UPS, we discover how we combine endless opportunities innovation and rewards to create a truly unique career experience. With our unique promote-from-within culture you'll always find exciting new opportunities at every level of the organization. From training and education to growth and empowerment you have the freedom to forge a career path that can take you anywhere you want to go.

POSITION SUMMARY:

A UPS Driver performs the task of delivering and picking up UPS packages in a brown UPS car.

Location: 15 West Drive, Brampton, ON L6T 3T5, Canada

Key Accountabilities:

  • Delivering and picking up UPS packages
  • Learning and properly executing UPS safe driving methods
  • Operating vehicles with standard (manual) transmission
  • Possessing a valid driver’s license
  • Complying with UPS appearance guidelines

Requirements:

  • Ability to lift up to 70 lbs
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment
  • Ability to drive standard (manual) transmission
  • Available to work 8-12 hour shifts* Monday through Friday and some Saturdays/holidays if required. *Hours are dependent on work volume and not guaranteed during probationary period (90 working days).
  • Minimum 21 years of age
  • Possession of a valid Ontario G driver’s license
  • Clean driver's abstract - No at-fault accidents within the last 3 years
  • No traffic violations within the last 12 months
  • Strong customer service skills  


Compensation:

  • Pay rate $20.00/hr; Unionized position defined progression with (top rate 32.59/h)
  • Immediate access to UPS ‘Employee Discounts’ upon hiring
  • Opportunity for advancement within a Fortune 50 Company
  • Free parking

UPS Canada is a diverse and equal opportunity employer. Please advise our HR representatives if workplace accommodation is needed. Thank you for your interest in UPS Canada.

title: Driver/Helper
description:
Company Description

                                       NEW Competitive Hourly Rates and Great Benefits!!                 

At Sleep Country Canada/Dormez-vous?, we believe that a good night’s sleep is key to living healthier and happier lives.  Driven by our purpose to transform lives by awakening Canadians to the power of sleep, we’re focused on delivering exceptional customer service and providing safe, high quality and sustainable sleep solutions as an essential component of physical, mental and emotional wellbeing for all. 

A proud Canadian brand, we are Canada’s leading omnichannel sleep retailer committed to building a company culture that empowers equitable, diverse and inclusive teams, and where differences are embraced and valued.  Working at Sleep Country Canada/Dormez-vous? is more than just a job, it is your opportunity to realize your full potential and be motivated every day to make a positive difference to your team and to the lives of our customers.

Our Delivery team plays a key role in our customers’ experience and making sure that each and every purchase ends with a smile! As a Driver/Helper, you will ensure our customers receive their order on time and with care.

Job Description

Can you?

  • Deliver our products to each and every customer's homes in a professional, friendly, and enthusiastic manner that has them screaming "WOW!"
  • Motivate yourself and others to provide a jaw dropping delivery experience
  • Work together as part of the Operations Team to achieve and exceed goals and expectations
  • Promise to leave work the way you came in!? This means following all required health and safety procedures! Safety always comes first!
Qualifications

Do you have?

  • A high school diploma?
  • A clean driver's abstract? Don't worry, we will over look a few smudges- but we need to know you can handle a wheel!
  • A Valid Driver's License
  • Experience with driving a 5-ton vehicle? ...Give or take a few pounds!
  • Experience working within a warehouse or delivery capacity? This is considered an asset, so it's not mandatory!

Are you able to?

  • Lift a minimum of 88 lbs (40 kg's)?
  • Think quickly and tackle problems on your own! 
  • Love our customers as much as we love sleep!?!
  • Work a flexible shifts includes weekends - 4 day 10 hour shifts (3 days off)


Additional Information

Why Work for Us?

  • This is not just a job but a Career with many opportunities for growth and advancement
  • We are the proud winners of:
    • Great Place to Work
    • Great Place to work for Millennials
    • Best Workplaces in Retail & Hospitality
    • Great Place to work for Giving Back
  • Robust Medical & Dental Benefits, Deferred Profit Sharing Plan
  • Performance Bonus
  • Tuition Reimbursement Program that covers professional AND personal development (yes, you can get reimbursed for your scuba diving classes!)
  • Associate Discount Program
  • Fitness Subsidy
  • Associate Referral Program
  • Day off for Charity
  • Regular social events (we work hard and play hard!!!)
  • Yearly Footwear and/or Uniform Allowance

Employment Equity
We recognize the importance of a diverse workforce and we therefore encourage applications from Aboriginal Peoples, women, members of a visible minority, and persons with a disability.

title: Specialized driver
description:
Groupe Robert is actually looking for a driver for specialized work at Varennes terminal.

Your responsibilities will be as follows:

• Drive a heavy weight vehicle from one location to another, with or without load, following a preset route and pre-determined schedule
• Be responsible for the vehicle, so to speak and of the load and the safety while driving for self and others 
• Check general vehicle condition and report any fault or damage
• Check total and axial loads in order to predict the vehicle reaction
• Perform routine activities
• Perform the pick up, meet the customers and have all documents duly signed
• Notify the workshop about any abnormality of the vehicle and the mechanical repairs required 

In order to join Groupe Robert's team, you must have:

• Minimum 2 years experience as class 1
• Excellent driver’s record 
• Functional French and English 
• Good communication skills and understanding of the safety policies
• Able to drive a truck in a safely manner, courteously and efficiently
• Excellent communication and customer service skills and able to respect and apply all the company’s politics and procedures 
• Ability to carry out handling 

Groupe Robert offers you:

• Job stability, work all year• Safe environment• Family environment• Salary and competitive rates mile• All deliveries and pickups paid• Interesting professional development opportunities• Group insurance and fringe benefits• Corporate discounts• Uniform provided• Environmental awareness• Systems and equipment on the cutting edge of technology• Company demonstrating agility, efficiency and innovation• Constant concern for safety (trainings, certifications, associations)

Schedules

Day

Experience

0-1 year

Groupe Robert is proud to support the diversity of its employees through its terminals in Quebec and Ontario. Women, visible and / or ethnic minorities or people with disabilities will always be welcome to apply, because at Groupe Robert, the diversity of our employees is the link in our logistics chain that makes us even stronger!

title: Driver
description:
At EVRAZ, our strength starts with our people! As a team we collaborate to solve problems, contribute ideas and challenge each other to ensure growth and ultimately success for the business and our employees.

We are currently seeking a Driver to work out of the Calgary EVRAZ Direct facility to load and unload ferrous and non-ferrous materials, by means of roll off containers, luger box, end dumps, and/or van trailers as required in a safe and appropriate manner. The Driver must conduct all activities according to collection schedules and all relevant duties as directed by the Purchasing Agent. The driver must have the ability to effectively work and communicate with customers/suppliers and report any discrepancies relating to damage of roll off containers while on suppliers’ site, placement of equipment that may create unsafe conditions for the driver and/or general public. The driver must have the ability to develop and establish credible relationships with external and internal customers.

Job Responsibilities

  • Have a complete understanding of the Canadian Federal and Provincial rules and regulations relating to driver hours, driver logs, weight restrictions, height restrictions, tarp requirements

  • Perform all pre-trip and post trip inspections daily – reporting all discrepancies and/or potential unsafe conditions immediately

  • Making sure all maintenance items are taken care of, i.e. greasing, tire pressure, etc.… per maintenance policy

  • Ensure equipment is kept clean and secured in a designated area

  • Monitor over weight loads/unsafe conditions – contact dispatch personnel immediately of any infractions prior to leaving supplier site

  • Have the ability to handle all requests and complaints made by the suppliers, communicating any shortfalls in service, regardless of nature to dispatch personnel and/or immediate supervisor

  • Moving material in the yard when needed

  • Must have the ability to operate required equipment in a safe and responsible manner

  • Have the ability to recognize potential hazards in and around the service area, reporting any and all unsafe conditions to dispatch personnel immediately

  • Have the ability to handle a large number of container collections, communicating delays that may impact the remaining schedule to the dispatcher

  • Other duties as required by the immediate Supervisor (Purchasing Agent)

Job Requirements

  • A High School Diploma or GED equivalency

  • A minimum of 5 -10 years of related dispatch experience

  • Class 1 Driver’s License

  • O.T. rules and regulations related to over the road carriers and local deliveries

  • Must have the ability to work long and strenuous (working) hours and endure poor weather conditions

  • Must be punctual and dependable – absences must be kept at a minimum, scheduling time off to effectively staff department

  • Must have the ability to deal with the suppliers in a positive, courteous and respectful manner

Starting wage for the Driver is $27.63/Hour. This is a full-time permanent year round position that offers a full comprehensive benefit and pension package. (Mon – Fri from 7:00am-3:30pm, OT in Summer and Times may change as needed)

The successful candidate will also be asked to undergo pre-employment checks including a Background Check (Education, Employment, and Criminal Record Verification), Fitness To Work & Alcohol & Drug Test, reference check, and provide proof of their Class 1 Driver’s License designation upon a conditional offer of employment being extended.

General Job Information

  • Wage: $27.63/Per Hour (as per the Collective Bargaining Agreement)

  • Job Status: Full-Time Permanent

  • Hours of Work: 7:00am-3:30pm may change as needed.

  • Shift Schedule: Monday to Friday with OT in the summer

  • Benefit and RRSP Plan Eligible

  • Probationary Period: 6 Months from the Date of Hire

Our total compensation package includes amazing benefits!

  • Competitive wages and bonus opportunities
  • Family medical, dental, and prescription coverage at minimal employee cost
  • Short and long term disability programs
  • Competitive retirement plans
  • Paid vacations and statutory holidays
  • Apprenticeship and career advancement within the company
  • Tuition reimbursement

All applicants must be eligible to work in Canada without sponsorship.

While we thank all those who apply, only those being actively considered for employment will be contacted.

Equal Opportunity Employer

EVRAZ North America is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

 

EVRAZ North America is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to individuals with physical and mental disabilities.

If you need special assistance or an accommodation while seeking employment, please e-mail

careers@evrazna.com

or call: (312) 533-3577. We will make a determination on your request for reasonable accommodation on a case-by-case basis.

title: Stretcher Attendant & Driver
description:
If you possess a love for people, attention to detail, outgoing attitude, and you want to make a difference please submit a resume! No experience needed! We will train the right people with the right attitude for this permanent full time position! Are you curious about what the role of Stretcher Attendant involves!?

It is a career focused on patient care, transporting those in need, and the opportunity to make a difference for those we care for. Our patients need to be transported with compassion, care, respect, and expertise. It is a privilege to be able to do what we do, and we are looking for similar minded individuals to help us provide care to our community.

Our Stretcher Attendants need to be team players as the role typically involves working in partners to move patients from destination to destination.

Being a Stretcher Attendant is a rewarding career with opportunities for advancements for individuals who commit to providing an excellent service. For many, it is also a great learning tool for those wanting to enter the healthcare field

What You Offer!
  • Enjoys working with people! Patient Transport Services puts a high priority on patient care and employee relations. Therefore, which our Stretcher Attendants must possess the following traits: compassionate, reliable, and outgoing.
  • Willing to learn! The chosen candidate is willing and able to obtain all the licenses listed below, and to complete the in-house training program. (please be aware that candidates are not required to have these qualifications before applying). At Patient Transport Services we believe it is our responsibility to provide our employees with as much support as possible. Therefore, we offer numerous tools for our employees to receive the proper training and credentials to perform their duties.
  • An affinity for safety! Our patient’s health and safety are our core objectives, and we require all employees to make patient safety their number one priority.
What We Offer!
  • Employee training! At Patient Transport Service’s we offer a comprehensive paid in-depth training program that is completed on site!
  • Advancement opportunities! Options for advancement to individuals who have exceptional work ethic & reliability.
  • Secure, long-term employment in a growing industry! We are currently offering full time permanent positions.
  • Benefits! We are offer health benefits, including life insurance, an employee assistant program, and dental that begins after probation.
  • PPE! We provide full PPE to protect our employees working in sensitive environments.
  • A Uniform! We provide a full Uniform Set (minus black belt, black ankle high boots, and black non printed T-shirt).
  • A competitive wage! We offer a starting wage of $14 an hour.
The following documents are required for employment but are NOT required for an interview. Furthermore, you are not required to have previous experience. We provide a comprehensive in-house training or assistance in acquiring all the following documents.
  • Child Abuse Registry Check (Max 60 days issued)
  • Adult Abuse Registry Check (Max 60 days issued)
  • Criminal Record Check- W/ Vulnerable Sector (Max 60 days issued)
  • Standard First Aid w/ CPR BLS
  • Class 4F Driver’s license (Must currently possess Class 5F)
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: From $14.00 per hour

COVID-19 considerations:
Please be aware that you will be required to wear personal protective equipment and follow our policies and procedures as it relates to COVID-19 throughout your shift





    About Patient Transport Services:

    Patient Transport Services is Manitoba’s premier and largest provider of non-emergency patient transport and we set the standards when it comes to non-urgent patient care. Since its founding in 2013, Patient Transport Services has been committed to providing the highest quality service for our patients. This dedication to high standards has laid the foundation for what we’ve become known for and continues to propel our success today. It’s this commitment to excellence that has earned us the distinction of being the #1 provider of choice for patient transports in Manitoba.

title: Driver
description:
Overview:

Whatâ€™s the difference between a job and a meaningful, rewarding career? The people you serve. When you work at Atria, you have a front-row seat to the amazing life stories of the wisest people on earth. Whatâ€™s more, you are part of an extraordinary company â€“ one thatâ€™s investing in the future of senior living by investing in you. Donâ€™t just do a job. Be part of an extraordinary life.

 

Atria is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing equal employment opportunities without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, age, national origin, disability, genetic information, veteran status, or any other classification protected by applicable law.  Atria will not tolerate harassment or discrimination based on any of these protected classifications.

Responsibilities:

Responsible for providing safe, courteous transportation service and serve as support staff for the Engage Life Director or Maintenance Director. Coordinates vehicle pre-maintenance, maintenance, and repair to ensure vehicle longevity.

  • Drive vehicle from community to social and other various destinations according to assigned schedule.
  • Assist residents into and out of vehicle in a safe manner.
  • Secure passengers' wheelchairs to restraining devices to stabilize wheelchairs during trip.
  • Practice safe driving techniques at all times.
  • Clean and service vehicle with fuel, lubricants, and accessories and report and coordinate vehicle maintenance repairs.
  • Establish and monitor daily and weekly trip inspection and preventative maintenance programs, as well as maintain records regarding the maintenance of all vehicles.
  • Deliver groceries and other belongings to residentâ€™s apartments.
  • Assist the Engage Life Department in activities and programs as needed.
  • Ensure charges are submitted to the business office daily for community travel expenses.
  • Maintain a safe driving record according to Company guidelines.
  • Handle emergency situations and basic First Aid.
  • Report potentially unsafe conditions to the Executive Director.
  • May perform other duties as needed and/or assigned.
Qualifications:
  • High school diploma or general education degree (GED); or one (1) to three (3) months of related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
  • Five (5) or more years of driving experience and knowledge of vehicle preventative maintenance programs.
  • Commercial driver's license required to operate commercial size vehicles.
  • Able to operate a seven (7) to sixteen (16) passenger bus, unless otherwise required by Atria or state law. Able to operate a limousine or car, tire changing equipment, First Aid Kit, wheelchair lift, and dollies/hand trucks.
  • Experienced with vehicle emergency repairs, able to change automobile tires and handle minor on-road maintenance.
  • Knowledgeable of all streets within an 8-mile radius of the community.
  • Position requires driving responsibilities (may use Company provided vehicle and/or personal vehicle).
  • Must satisfactorily meet and be in compliance with Atriaâ€™s Motor Vehicle Record Policy standards.
  • Must have or be willing to get a COVID-19 vaccine, subject to legal requirements.

Driver, Transportation, Chauffeur, Motorist, Vehicle Operator, Automobilist, Drivers, Bus

title: AZ Driver-Ottawa
description:
Position: AZ Delivery Driver
Location: Ottawa
Status: Full Time, Permanent
Shift/ Start time: - Monday to Friday (Afternoon shifts - 45 Hours/Week Approx)
Start Date: ASAP

Details of the Position:

  • Start and finish from Ottawa
  • Delivering product to various retail locations within Ontario
  • Handbombing required of items from truck on every delivery
  • Ensure customer delivery is met in a timely, safe and professional manner
  • Ensure accuracy and record all deliveries on timesheet

 

General Requirements/Qualifications:

  • Valid AZ License with a minimum of 6 months of verifiable AZ driving experience
  • Must be comfortable with both city and highway driving, regular tight turns, backup into small docks
  • Ability to lift up to 50lbs on a consistent basis
  • Clean CVOR, abstract and criminal search
  • Follow company rules and regulations with respect to safety and hours of service
  • Excellent customer service skills

Why work for Canada Cartage

  • Dedicated 24-Hour Dispatch Coverage
  • Modern, well maintained Fleet; professionally detailed, inside and out, on a regular basis
  • Industry leading benefits package including company-matching pension plan
  • Stability; Full Time, Steady Hours and consistent year round work
  • Safety-oriented company with a safety program in place
  • Opportunities for career advancements through training and development
  • Company perks such as company phone, uniform/safety boot allowance and discount programs for gym memberships, auto services, cell phone plans, etc.
  • Awarded as a Top Fleet Employer in 2017, 2018 and 2019 awarded best culture
  • Work with a company named "Canada's Best Employer 2018, 2019 & 2020" in Transportation & Logistics by Forbes

We would like to thank all those expressing an interest in this position; however only the candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Driver - Edmonton
description:
Overview:

Enterprise Holdings, operating the National, Enterprise, and Alamo car rental brands is looking for a driver to join our amazing team!  Enterprise Holdings is the largest and fastest growing privately owned automotive rental and leasing company in the  North America.    

 

The Driver delivers vehicles and in some instances, customers, employees or vendors safely and timely to the appropriate destination(s) while giving helpful, courteous and professional customer service.

 

Location: 4563 36th Street E, Edmonton International Airport

 

This position pays $15 / hour  

 

Schedule:

 

This is a 7 day operation and the shifts will be:

  • 6:30am-2:30pm
  • 8am-2:30pm
  • 2:30pm-11pm

 

Responsibilities:

The Driver is responsible for the transporting of fleet cars and vans to and from rental locations, as well as navigating written directions.

  • Drive and deliver vehicles locally or out of area as needed, following all rules of the road
  • Deliver customers and vehicles to appropriate destination in a safe and courteous manner
  • Ride with or follow another driver to drop off vehicle(s) or pick up multiple vehicles
  • Organize travel route and ensure vehicle paperwork is accurate and timely
  • May need to communicate via 2-way radio or cellular phone
  • May be asked to clean vehicle and/or keep bus clean during shift
  • May be asked to assist customer(s) with directions, car options and basic policy/procedures
  • May be asked to assist customer(s) load and unload luggage, enter and exit vehicle and miscellaneous customer needs
  • Perform miscellaneous job-related duties as assigned
Qualifications:
  • Must be at least 18 years of age
  • Must have a valid driver's license with no more than 2 moving violations and/or at-fault accidents on driving record in the past 3 years
  • No drug or alcohol related convictions on driving record (DWI/DUI) or criminal record within the last 5 years  
  • Must be able to lift 30 lb. in order to assist customers
  • Must be authorized to work in Canada and not require work authorization sponsorship by our company for this position now or in the future.
  • Airport requires employees on-site to be fully vaccinated per Airport Vaccination Requirement, subject only to limited exceptions mandated by legislation.

title: Driver
description:
Why work for Lafarge?

 

 

 

 

 

As the global leader in innovative and sustainable building materials, we’re committed to shaping a greener, smarter and healthier world. At Lafarge Canada Inc., safety comes first, collaboration matters and diversity is celebrated with people who share our desire to continually make our materials better. 

 

Do you have the drive, the skills, and the passion to join us?

 

 

Overview

Ready Mix Driver in the Arthur, Ontario region. This is a full time position hiring asap!

 

Please send your resume to Taras Saplywyj at: taras.saplywyj@lafargeholcim.com

 

Responsibilities

 

Responsibilities include:

  • Delivering concrete to customers in a safe and timely manner.
  • Up keep of truck appearance, assist with light maintenance around the Concrete plant
  • Paperwork – circle checks, delivery ticket information.

Key Competencies:

  • Valid Class AZ or DZ drivers license
  • Safety Mindset
  • Team player
  • Strong communicator

Qualifications

 

  • Educational Background : Grade 12 diploma
  • Experience : 3 - 5 years of experience in the trucking industry with a clean driving record. Training will be provided for operating the ready mix truck.

LafargeHolcim

 

As we are reinventing the way the world builds, we need world-class talent to join our Lafarge Canada team: people who are passionate, driven by curiosity and keen to grow, learn, develop and thrive in our high-performance culture.

Whatever you do, you will make a difference here. Because we know that your passion and curiosity are the natural resources the world needs. 

 

We thank you for your interest. Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.  Lafarge is committed to the principles of employment equity and encourages the applications from women, visible minorities, and persons with disabilities.

 

Lafarge Canada Inc. welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. In Ontario, our organization/business is committed to fulfilling our requirements under the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

 

Lafarge Canada is committed to providing a safe environment for employees, customers, contractors and vendors. As such, in keeping with the requirements of our industry associations, partners, and clients across Canada, Lafarge Canada has implemented a COVID-19 vaccination policy intended to reduce the spread of COVID-19. As of October 1st, 2021, all new employees joining Lafarge Canada, subject to any requirement to accommodate pursuant to applicable human rights legislation, must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19.

title: Driver - Full Time
description:
We look forward to your application! When applying, please be sure to put your Full Legal First Name and Last Name for legal and processing purposes.

   

National Tire Distributors is Canada's leading Tire Distribution Company. A key element of our success has always been our people. As part of our team philosophy, we coach, support and help develop all of our employees to become the best they can be! If you're looking for a career that will challenge you, a job that will offer growth, and a progressive employer, then National Tire Distributors Inc. (NTD) is the right place for you!

   

Position Description: 

The main responsibility for the Driver position is the timely and safe delivery of tires, wheels and other products to our NTD customers.  This role is a key component of a dynamic team focused on providing our customers with everything they require to succeed.  The position will introduce the employee to multiple functions within NTD Delivery and Operations.  Key to success in this role is the ability to adapt to and perform various processes efficiently and safely.  As a main point of contact with our customer base maintaining a courteous and professional manner is critical.  This position will provide the Driver with the knowledge and experience necessary for growth within NTD.


We offer:
- $18 /HR
- Excellent group Health Benefits, including Health, Dental, Paramedical, Vision, etc. with only 30 day waiting period
- Production bonus
- RRSP Company Matching
- Tire Purchase Program for family and friends
- Workperks - Discounts on over 3000 Vendors
- Employee and Family Assistance Program (EAP)
- Paid Vacation
- Vacation Purchase Program
- Personal Time Off Days
- Winning Culture
- Micro-learning platform
- and more!

Apply online or in person. We are located at:

3-4041 North Service Rd
Burlington, ON L7L 4X7
Canada

   

   

Build a challenging and rewarding career with us!

description:
Overview:

Whatâ€™s the difference between a job and a meaningful, rewarding career? The people you serve. When you work at Atria, you have a front-row seat to the amazing life stories of the wisest people on earth. Whatâ€™s more, you are part of an extraordinary company â€“ one thatâ€™s investing in the future of senior living by investing in you. Donâ€™t just do a job. Be part of an extraordinary life.

 

Atria is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing equal employment opportunities without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, age, national origin, disability, genetic information, veteran status, or any other classification protected by applicable law.  Atria will not tolerate harassment or discrimination based on any of these protected classifications.

Responsibilities:

Responsible for providing safe, courteous transportation service and serve as support staff for the Engage Life Director or Maintenance Director. Coordinates vehicle pre-maintenance, maintenance, and repair to ensure vehicle longevity.

  • Drive vehicle from community to social and other various destinations according to assigned schedule.
  • Assist residents into and out of vehicle in a safe manner.
  • Secure passengers' wheelchairs to restraining devices to stabilize wheelchairs during trip.
  • Practice safe driving techniques at all times.
  • Clean and service vehicle with fuel, lubricants, and accessories and report and coordinate vehicle maintenance repairs.
  • Establish and monitor daily and weekly trip inspection and preventative maintenance programs, as well as maintain records regarding the maintenance of all vehicles.
  • Deliver groceries and other belongings to residentâ€™s apartments.
  • Assist the Engage Life Department in activities and programs as needed.
  • Ensure charges are submitted to the business office daily for community travel expenses.
  • Maintain a safe driving record according to Company guidelines.
  • Handle emergency situations and basic First Aid.
  • Report potentially unsafe conditions to the Executive Director.
  • May perform other duties as needed and/or assigned.
Qualifications:
  • High school diploma or general education degree (GED); or one (1) to three (3) months of related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
  • Five (5) or more years of driving experience and knowledge of vehicle preventative maintenance programs.
  • Commercial driver's license required to operate commercial size vehicles.
  • Able to operate a seven (7) to sixteen (16) passenger bus, unless otherwise required by Atria or state law. Able to operate a limousine or car, tire changing equipment, First Aid Kit, wheelchair lift, and dollies/hand trucks.
  • Experienced with vehicle emergency repairs, able to change automobile tires and handle minor on-road maintenance.
  • Knowledgeable of all streets within an 8-mile radius of the community.
  • Position requires driving responsibilities (may use Company provided vehicle and/or personal vehicle).
  • Must satisfactorily meet and be in compliance with Atriaâ€™s Motor Vehicle Record Policy standards.
  • Must have or be willing to get a COVID-19 vaccine, subject to legal requirements.

Driver, Transportation, Chauffeur, Motorist, Vehicle Operator, Automobilist, Drivers, Bus

title: AZ Driver-St.Thomas
description:
We are looking for talented dedicated drivers with exceptional customer service to join our delivery fleet. We provide an excellent training program, dedicated equipment and opportunities for growth.
Details of the Positions:
  • Pay rate: $27/hr
  • Start and finish from St.Thomas location
  • Monday to Friday, 2:30am-5:00am ( start times)
  • Delivery of loads to assigned stores around the GTA, and other points within Ontario & America ( MI, OH, IN)
  • Delivering windows and doors; handbombing required 
  • Ensure customer delivery is met in a timely, safe and professional manner
  • Ensure accuracy and record all deliveries on timesheet 
General Requirements/Qualifications:
  • Valid AZ License with a minimum of 6 months of verifiable AZ driving experience
  • Must be comfortable with both city and highway driving, regular tight turns, backup into small docks
  • Clean CVOR, abstract and criminal search
  • FAST Card preferred, but not a requirement
  • Follow company rules and regulations with respect to safety and hours of service
  • Excellent customer service skills
Why work for Canada Cartage
  • Dedicated 24-Hour Dispatch Coverage
  • Modern, well maintained Fleet; professionally detailed, inside and out, on a regular basis
  • Industry leading benefits package including company-matching pension plan
  • Stability; Full Time, Steady Hours and consistent year round work
  • Safety-oriented company with a safety program in place
  • Opportunities for career advancements through training and development
  • Company perks such as company phone, uniform/safety boots allowance and discount programs for gym memberships, auto services, cell phone plans, etc.
  • Awarded as a Top Fleet Employer in 2017, 2018 and 2019
  • Work with a company named "Canada's Best Employer 2018 , 2019 & 2020" in Transportation & Logistics by Forbes
  • #workatcanadacartage
We would like to thank all those expressing an interest in this position; however only the candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. #workatcanadacartage

title: Driver - Fort McMurray
description:
Overview:

Enterprise Holdings, operating the National, Enterprise, and Alamo car rental brands is looking for a driver to join our amazing team!  Enterprise Holdings is the largest and fastest growing privately owned automotive rental and leasing company in the  North America.    

 

The Driver delivers vehicles and in some instances, customers, employees or vendors safely and timely to the appropriate destination(s) while giving helpful, courteous and professional customer service.

 

This position pays $15 / hour and is a casual position/on call

 

Location: 505 Mackenzie Blvd, Fort McMurray AB T9H 4X3

 

Responsibilities:

The Part Time Driver is responsible for the transporting of fleet cars and vans to and from rental locations, as well as navigating written directions.

  • Drive and deliver vehicles locally or out of area as needed, following all rules of the road
  • Deliver customers and vehicles to appropriate destination in a safe and courteous manner
  • Ride with or follow another driver to drop off vehicle(s) or pick up multiple vehicles
  • Organize travel route and ensure vehicle paperwork is accurate and timely
  • May need to communicate via 2-way radio or cellular phone
  • May be asked to clean vehicle and/or keep bus clean during shift
  • May be asked to assist customer(s) with directions, car options and basic policy/procedures
  • May be asked to assist customer(s) load and unload luggage, enter and exit vehicle and miscellaneous customer needs
  • Perform miscellaneous job-related duties as assigned
Qualifications:
  • Must be at least 18 years of age
  • Must have a valid driver's license with no more than 2 moving violations and/or at-fault accidents on driving record in the past 3 years
  • No drug or alcohol related convictions on driving record (DWI/DUI) or criminal record within the last 5 years  
  • Must be able to lift 30 lb. in order to assist customers
  • Must be authorized to work in Canada and not require work authorization sponsorship by our company for this position now or in the future.
  • Airport requires employees on-site to be fully vaccinated per Airport Vaccination Requirement, subject only to limited exceptions mandated by legislation.

title: Driver
description:
Company Description

Join a special kind of workplace. We have the experience and strength of our 100-year legacy and the desire to always do better for our team members and clients. Our 5000 colleagues proudly serve thousands of customers every day across Canada.

Get to work with great people, use the company car, have a stable schedule, and foremost help your community.

If the hat fits, we’d be proud to have you wear it! Send us your resume and join a people-centric company with a reputation of excellence.
 

Job Description

Are you a car enthusiast looking for an exciting career opportunity? Get behind the wheel and deliver vehicle parts to our customers! Take pride in wearing our uniform and driving our vehicles as you work in a dynamic and stimulating environment.  

Our drivers are courteous, efficient, safe, and organized. We insist that all our drivers be careful on the road. At NAPA , your safety is our priority! 

We offer a range of attractive benefits and corporate discounts, as well as training throughout your career to support and guide your professional development. Visit our Career website for the complete list of our benefits and perks! 

 

Qualifications

To join our team, you need: 

  • Valid driver’s license 
  • Able to lift up to 50lbs. 
  • Priority management  
  • Communication and listening skills 
  • Teamwork and excellent customer service skills 

 



Additional Information

Schedule availability will be for weekdays and Saturdays

UAP is a diverse community that promotes inclusion and respect. The sum of our individual differences, experiences, knowledge, self-expression, unique capabilities, and talents, represents the richness of our culture. During the selection process, let us know if you need any accommodations. This information will be kept entirely confidential and will only be used to ensure you have a fair and pleasant experience with us

We will contact you as soon as possible if we think we have the hat for you!

This position pays $15.70 / hour  

 

Schedule:

  • Monday, Tuesday & Friday 8am-1pm

 

Responsibilities:

The Part Time Driver is responsible for the transporting of fleet cars and vans to and from rental locations, as well as navigating written directions.

  • Drive and deliver vehicles locally or out of area as needed, following all rules of the road

  • Able to lift up to 50lbs. 
  • Priority management  
  • Communication and listening skills 
  • Teamwork and excellent customer service skills 

 



Additional Information

This position is Part-time (25 hours per week) with the potential for full-time

UAP is a diverse community that promotes inclusion and respect. The sum of our individual differences, experiences, knowledge, self-expression, unique capabilities, and talents, represents the richness of our culture. During the selection process, let us know if you need any accommodations. This information will be kept entirely confidential and will only be used to ensure you have a fair and pleasant experience with us

We will contact you as soon as possible if we think we have the hat for you!

title: Driver - Victoria
description:
Overview:

Enterprise Holdings, operating the National, Enterprise, and Alamo car rental brands is looking for a driver to join our amazing team!  Enterprise Holdings is the largest and fastest growing privately owned automotive rental and leasing company in the  North America.    

 

The Driver delivers vehicles and in some instances, customers, employees or vendors safely and timely to the appropriate destination(s) while giving helpful, courteous and professional customer service.

 

Location: 2507 Government Street, Victoria BC V8T 4P6

 

This position pays $15.70 / hour  

 

Schedule:

  • Monday-Friday 8am-2pm

 

Responsibilities:

The Part Time Driver is responsible for the transporting of fleet cars and vans to and from rental locations, as well as navigating written directions.

  • Drive and deliver vehicles locally or out of area as needed, following all rules of the road
  • Deliver customers and vehicles to appropriate destination in a safe and courteous manner
  • Ride with or follow another driver to drop off vehicle(s) or pick up multiple vehicles
  • Organize travel route and ensure vehicle paperwork is accurate and timely
  • May need to communicate via 2-way radio or cellular phone
  • May be asked to clean vehicle and/or keep bus clean during shift
  • May be asked to assist customer(s) with directions, car options and basic policy/procedures
  • May be asked to assist customer(s) load and unload luggage, enter and exit vehicle and miscellaneous customer needs
  • Perform miscellaneous job-related duties as assigned
Qualifications:
  • Must be at least 18 years of age
  • Must have a valid driver's license with no more than 2 moving violations and/or at-fault accidents on driving record in the past 3 years
  • No drug or alcohol related convictions on driving record (DWI/DUI) or criminal record within the last 5 years  
  • Must be able to lift 30 lb. in order to assist customers
  • Must be authorized to work in Canada and not require work authorization sponsorship by our company for this position now or in the future.

Lafarge Canada is committed to providing a safe environment for employees, customers, contractors and vendors. As such, in keeping with the requirements of our industry associations, partners, and clients across Canada, Lafarge Canada has implemented a COVID-19 vaccination policy intended to reduce the spread of COVID-19. As of October 1st, 2021, all new employees joining Lafarge Canada, subject to any requirement to accommodate pursuant to applicable human rights legislation, must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19.

title: title
description: description

title: Horse Ambulance Driver
description:
Our rich history is a big part of who we are. With historic roots dating back over 135 years, Woodbine is steeped in tradition. We have been the engine that drives the Ontario horse racing industry. From King’s and Queen’s trips to Canada, anniversaries and unforgettable horse races, we have been creating winning experiences for all our guests.

We are currently on an amazing 20-year journey to ‘build a city within a city’ and transform the largest privately held land in Toronto into one of Canada’s premiere entertainment destinations. This journey will unlock the value of approximately 700 acres of land, leading to job creation and the revitalization of our communities, while enhancing our ability to share the thrill of horse-racing and cementing our place as an entertainment powerhouse.

We need dedicated people to join our cause. Be part of Woodbine Entertainment and get inspired to make work awesome!

Our Values & Beliefs

| WOW EVERY GUEST | OWN IT! | LISTEN & CONNECT – PEOPLE MATTER | FUEL THE FUN & PASS IT ON | TRUST IN OUR TEAM | #WE CARE | PURSUE YOUR POTENTIAL |BE BOLD| BE ALL IN |

Woodbine Entertainment is growing, and we are currently looking for a Horse Ambulance Driver who is customer-focused and committed to providing our guests with winning experiences!

This position will be responsible for loading injured horses onto the Horse Ambulance and transporting injured horses to the backstretch or hospital, or to preferred destination, using skill and caution in driving to avoid sudden motions detrimental to horses.

Our ideal candidate is going to have a strong passion to wow our guests, great communication skills, a friendly and outgoing attitude, be able to work in a fast-paced environment and be willing to maximize their potential. At Woodbine, the opportunities are endless, so come join a company that makes work awesome!

Key Success Factors
  • Experience handling horses
  • Ability to deal with problems involving a few concrete variables in standardized situations
  • Have a minimum “G” class driver’s license
  • Possess or be able to obtain an AGCO License
  • Must be able to lift and/or move more than 100 pounds
Guided by our Values and Beliefs, Woodbine Entertainment commits to providing an authentic and empowering work experience! Please reach out if you're ready to embrace change and be part of a new breed of experience while working for one of Canada’s certified Great Places to Work!
skills: ['Experience handling horses', 'Must be able to lift and/or move more than 100 pounds', 'Have a minimum “G” class driver’s license']

title: Summer Camp Medic
description:
Are you looking to gain experience in the medical field? Get full scope training while working out doors?


canaPhem is currently hiring camp medics!


What is offered:


  1. Full Time paid position
  2. All food and accommodation provided
  3. A member of the camp medical team
  4. All camp amenities


Responsibilities:


  1. Provide emergency and non-emergency medical care to campers and staff 
  2. Maintain the Infirmary in a clean and orderly manner 
  3. Keep a detailed and accurate records of all medical care provided in Camp through the Infirmary 
  4. Forward patients to the local hospital or emergency room as needed 
  5. Assist the Physician and nurse as needed 
  6.  Review the records of all medical care provided through each week 
  7. Review accepted first aid procedures with medical staff
  8. Keep physical camper forms on file in the infirmary in an orderly manner 
  9. To make regular rounds of the camp during the shift
  10. Be the first responder for emergency calls
  11. When not on duty, assist the medical staff with serious emergencies
  12. The Camp Medic will be required to have their Walkie-Talkie on and carried at all times while on shift.  
  13. Under the delegation of canaPHEM medical director, following all delegated controlled acts as an Advanced Care and Primary Care Medic, as outlined in the Ontario Advanced Life Support Patient Care Standards (ALS PCS) published by the Ministry of Health and Long-Term Care
  14. follows all canaPHEM policy and procedures, as well as event medic policy and procedures
  15. Preparing and submitting reports (PCR, Minor Injury Report, Incident Report) in a timely fashion.


Qualifications


  • Ontario Community College (2-year program) or Ontario Private College (1-year program) Diploma in Emergency Health Care/Paramedicine (EMCA/AEMCA).  
  • Certification as Advanced Care or Primary Care Medic in the Province of Ontario or AMECA pending
  • Valid CPR level C
  • All qualifications that meet the requirements of the Ambulance Act and related Regulations including being free from communicable diseases and having a clear criminal record
  • Class G driver’s license to drive any canaPHEM vehicles with less than 6 demerit points or prohibition from driving under the criminal code
  • Ability to meet and maintain Health requirements as set by the Ambulance Act
  • Vulnerable sector check, annually
  • Ability to consistently maintain job attendance as scheduled

title: Emergency Responder, Disaster Management
description:
Title: Emergency Responder, Disaster Management

Location: Montreal, QC, Canada

Type of contract: Casual

Salary band: $13.50 /hour

An iconic brand and one of the most inspirational not-for-profit organization on this planet – The Canadian Red Cross (CRC), is seeking an Emergency Responder, Disaster Management to join our Disaster Management team.

You want to be part of the world’s largest humanitarian network? You have a passion for helping others, and want to work with other dedicated individuals? By applying, you are taking a big first step to be part of an exciting organization that makes a huge difference in the lives of Canadians here at home and abroad. What are you waiting for?

At the Canadian Red Cross, we help people and communities in Canada and around the world in times of need and support them in strengthening their resilience. We are committed to having an accessible, diverse, and inclusive work environment where people with all abilities, ethnicities, gender identities and expressions, nationalities, religions, and sexual orientations can reach their full potential. All qualified persons, particularly Indigenous peoples, persons with disabilities, ethnic minorities, visible minorities, women, veterans, and others who share our values and contribute to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace are encouraged to apply.

The successful candidate will assess and identify the resources (human and material) required to meet the needs of people affected by disasters at the response sites, as well as deliver services.

As An Emergency Responder, Disaster Management, You Will
  • Liaise with the Service de sécurité incendie de Montréal (SIM) or other local authorities, as appropriate.
  • Assess the scope of the disaster impacts.
  • Identify the resources (human and material) required to meet the needs of people affected by disasters, as per the established procedure, and communicate them to the duty officer.
  • Oversee the Red Cross response teams on site.
  • Inform the duty officer of response developments and evaluate the delivery of disaster services.
  • Ensure compliance, offer guidance, and provide continued feedback to the Red Cross response teams during a response in accordance with national disaster management standards.
  • Conduct operational briefings.
  • Drive the disaster response vehicle.
  • Be available for deployment to support local emergency response operations, including assisting with the preparedness phase.
  • Be available during emergency operations in Canada.
We’re Looking For
  • A college diploma in recreation, ambulance, or police services, social sciences and humanities, or the equivalent.
  • Experience in emergency management and response.
  • Experience leading a group.
  • Experience working in a volunteer setting (an asset).
  • Knowledge of and practical experience with software such as the Microsoft suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint).
  • Strong writing skills.
  • A valid Class 5 and/or 4A and/or 4B driver’s licence.
  • Fluency in English and French.
Working Conditions
  • This is a casual position including on-call shifts that require you to be present in the Greater Montreal area.
  • Full vaccination against COVID-19 is mandatory for this position and operation (the CRC will however adhere to its duty to accommodate those who are unable to be fully vaccinated for a reason related to a human right protected ground);
The Canadian Red Cross is an organization guided by our fundamental principles of humanity, impartiality, neutrality, independence, voluntary service, unity and universality. We are committed to providing an inclusive and barrier-free work environment, starting with the hiring process. If you require accommodation measures during any phase of the hiring process, please notify us as soon as possible. All information received in relation to accommodation requests will be kept confidential.

Share

title: Commander- Community Paramedic
description:
About Our Organization

When you join the City of Guelph, you join a team of 2000 full and part-time employees who deliver services the community relies on every day. Together, we are bringing to life Guelph’s vision of an inclusive, connected, and prosperous city where we look after each other and our environment.

As a regional top employer, the City of Guelph values its employees and offers competitive salaries, excellent benefit packages, opportunities for professional development, a healthy work-life balance, and many roles with flexible work options. Our corporate values are integrity, service, inclusion, wellness, and learning. Guelph is consistently ranked as one of the best places in Canada to live, work, and play—all good reasons to consider a career in this beautiful city.

Job Summary

The successful candidate will be responsible for the effective delivery of the community paramedic programs within the City of Guelph and County of Wellington. Reporting to the Chief/ Deputy Chief with a focus on quality customer service and continuous improvement processes, this position will provide leadership to Superintendents, Paramedics, and support staff. Guided by goals and objectives of the City of Guelph’s Corporate Strategic Plan and committed to the Corporate Values of integrity, service, inclusion, wellness and learning, the candidate will aid in the achievement of the Community Vision for an inclusive, connected, prosperous city.

Hours of work

42 hours per week typically day rotation but requirement for on a 24/7 rotational shift schedule including holidays and weekends during a contingency, On-call rotation is a requirement of this position.

Your role
  • Ensure compliance with all applicable legislative requirements, policies and procedures of the Ministry of Health, Ambulance Act, the Occupational Health and Safety Act and collective agreements while managing and overseeing the community paramedic program
  • Coordinate and manage the Health and Safety initiatives to ensure the safety of paramedic service staff and ensure compliance with the Occupational Health and Safety Act for the team.
  • Provide management oversight to the Community Paramedic Program (CPP), including paramedic supervisors and acting supervisors.
  • Develop positive relationships internally and externally, monitor compliance with Collective Agreements, participate conflict resolution process where required.
  • Advanced computer skills including familiarity with the Office 365 suite and ability to learn and use of a variety of technological hardware and software (i.e., remote monitoring, Community Paramedic software, CHRIS (Client Health and Related Information System), local hospital EMR’s, etc.)
  • Reviews, monitors, and evaluates patient care through audits and ride-outs to ensure standards of care is being met by all staff participating in CP activities.
  • Responds to routine and non-routine inquiries or requests for information from community agencies and/or residents, escalating issues where appropriate.
  • Review and report on the effectiveness of the CPP and make recommendations to the appropriate staff and ensure accurate, legible records and documentation are maintained.
  • Manage appropriate budgets and reporting requirements through Ontario Health
  • Provide analytical and short term and long term business planning.
  • Work independently while functioning effectively as part of a cohesive team of leaders.
  • Work collaboratively with other paramedic commanders, assuming their role as required as part of the paramedic service management team.
  • Perform other related duties as assigned.
Qualifications
  • Considerable experience related to the duties listed above, normally acquired through the completion of a related management/ business degree and experience working as a paramedic. Candidates with an equivalent combination of education and experience may be considered.
  • Experience supervising staff or leading work teams, preferably in a unionized environment.
  • Must be qualified to work as a paramedic and meet all requirements of the Ambulance Act of Ontario. Must be able to obtain the necessary base hospital certification within a specified period of time.
  • Must possess a valid Class F license with a good driving record. Successful candidates will be required to provide a current driver’s abstract prior to their start date to confirm their license is held in good standing and that it has not been suspended or revoked under the Highway Traffic Act (HTA) or Criminal Code of Canada in the last 5 years. The City of Guelph will take into consideration the number of demerit points and/or nature of the infractions to determine if it meets our requirements.
  • Satisfactory Police Record Check (including vulnerable sector screening) must be provided at time of hire.
  • Knowledge of all applicable acts, regulations and standards regarding Emergency Health Services in Ontario including Ambulance Act, Highway Traffic Act, Coroners Act, Personal Health Information Protection Act (PHIPA)/Health Information Protection Act.
  • Training and/or experience with Multi Casual Incidents (MCI).
  • Experience with the delivery of adult education.
  • Intermediate skills in Microsoft Office (MS Word, Excel).
  • Electronic ACR’s, Automatic Vehicle locator and scheduling software is considered an asset.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills, strong problem solving, conflict resolution and public relation skills are essential.
  • Able to manage multiple and changing demands and priorities in high pressure situations.
  • Ability to delegate responsibilities, organize objectives while managing multiple demands in high pressure situations.
  • Knowledge of Occupational Health and Safety Act and other applicable legislation as it relates to the position.
Rate

$104,640-$130,800(based on 42 hour per week)

How To Apply

Qualified applicants are invited to apply using our online application system by Wednesday, May 11, 2022 . Please note all applicants must complete the online questionnaire specific to this position at the time they submit their resume and cover letter in order to be considered. Proof of qualifications will be requested at the interview stage.

The City of Guelph is an equal opportunity employer that values diversity in the workplace. We are therefore happy to accommodate any individual needs in keeping with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. If you require an accommodation in order to participate in the hiring process, please contact us to make your needs known in advance.

Personal information collected through the recruitment process will be used solely to determine eligibility for employment. We thank all candidates in advance; however, only those being considered for an interview will be contacted.

title: Site Superintendent
description:
We are currently seeking a Site Superintendent to join our team.

The Duties Included, But Not Limited To

Superintendents will coordinate and manage all on-site activities, as well work with the project team including; project manager, project coordinators, foreman, subcontractors, suppliers and other office departments to deliver the project(s) on-time and successfully.
  • Reporting to the Construction Manager
  • Review the project plans and specifications and ensure a complete understanding of the building design, schedule, and potential construction problems
  • Coordinate scheduling of subcontractors, consultants, inspectors and vendors to complete each project on time
  • Monitor work and materials to ensure quality control standards are met at various stages of the project
  • Maintain a written daily log of visitors, job actions performed, materials expended and problems resolved on the job site
  • Oversee day-to day field activities
  • Maintain a safety job site and ensure all requirements of the Occupational Health and Safety Act and COR are enforced
  • Conduct employee orientations and safety meetings
Qualifications
  • Minimum of 10-15 years of construction experience
  • Have a post secondary education in Business, Civil Engineering or Construction Management or equivalent
  • Strong organizational and time management skills
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Requirements
  • Working at heights
  • St. John's Ambulance Safety Training
  • WHIMIS Training
  • Current Ontario driver's license
We are a construction/design firm that has been in existence for 30 years. We have built a reputation for providing high quality facilities and best class service for Design Build, General Contracting, Tenant Improvement and Construction Management Services. As a company, we are focused on leadership, encouragement, strength, passion, commitment, and team building. Our dedication to our clients and our knowledge of the industry is the reason our business continues to grow.

title: Delivery Driver- NAPA 123
description:
Company Description


Our drivers have important missions everyday

Whatever division you join, you are a crucial part of our team. When we deliver parts, we are helping a parent be on time at the daycare, an ambulance get back on the road quickly or a truck deliver produce to a Canadian community on time. That is why we say we keep Canadians moving forward.

The impact our Drivers make is undeniable!

Join a special kind of workplace. We have the experience and strength of our 100-year legacy and the desire to always do better for our team members and clients. Our 5000 colleagues proudly serve thousands of customers every day across Canada.

Get to work with great people, use the company car, have a stable schedule, and foremost help your community.

If the hat fits, we’d be proud to have you wear it! Send us your resume and join a people-centric company with a reputation of excellence.


Job Description


Are you a car enthusiast looking for an exciting career opportunity? Get behind the wheel and deliver vehicle parts to our customers! Take pride in wearing our uniform and driving our vehicles as you work in a dynamic and stimulating environment.

Our drivers are courteous, efficient, safe, and organized. We insist that all our drivers be careful on the road. At NAPA OR Traction, your safety is our priority!

We offer a range of attractive benefits and corporate discounts, as well as training throughout your career to support and guide your professional development. Visit our Career website for the complete list of our benefits and perks!


Qualifications


To join our team, you need:

  • Valid driver’s license · One year of related work experience in automotive or heavy vehicle parts
  • Able to lift up to 80lbs.
  • Priority management
  • Communication and listening skills
  • Teamwork and excellent customer service skills

Additional Information


UAP is a diverse community that promotes inclusion and respect. The sum of our individual differences, experiences, knowledge, self-expression, unique capabilities, and talents, represents the richness of our culture. During the selection process, let us know if you need any accommodations. This information will be kept entirely confidential and will only be used to ensure you have a fair and pleasant experience with us

We will contact you as soon as possible if we think we have the hat for you!

title: newPrimary Care Paramedic, Special Teams
description:
Position Title: Paramedicine Practitioner (formerly Primary Care Paramedic), Fire Ranger Emergency Medical Team

Location: Ontario-wide, deploys out of Barrie and Thunder Bay

Reports To: Superintendent

Employment Type: Temporary contract

Posting Date: 01-May-2022

Closing Date: 14-May-2022, 17:00 EDT

Schedule: Rotating weekly on-call schedule, with potential deployment to anywhere in Ontario to a maximum of 14 days, plus pick-up opportunities

Pay scale: On-call: $100-150/week; when on deployment: $475-$600/day

Qualifications

1. Required to apply:

Must meet all qualifications as outlined in O. Reg. 257/00 PART III including, but not limited to:

1.1. Possess a diploma in Paramedicine.

1.2. A-EMCA certified by the Ministry of Health.

1.3. Current BLS level CPR (formerly HCP)

2. Achieve by start date:

2.1. Incident Management System – IMS 100 certificate of completion (https://training.emergencymanagementontario.ca/TPOnline/TPOnline.dll/EMO_Public_Course/COURSENO=COUR2011070415145004500149)

2.2. Possess Ornge Aeromedical Theory certificate, or anticipated certification (https://www.ornge.ca/about-us/programs/aeromedical-theory)

2.3. Possess Aeromedical Theory certificate from Ministry of health, or proof of registration for examination within 210 days of start of employment.

3. Ability to achieve certification under FRO’s controlled medical acts delegation program.

4. Possess physical abilities certificate from OPPAT, Ability Work, Sibley’s, or equivalent issued within last six months.

5. Ability to exert heavy physical effort required to treat and move patients, sometimes over rugged terrain, deliver medical equipment or sort inventory at health centre, station, and in a vehicle.

6. Good knowledge and application of BLS/ALS Patient Care Standards, related Acts and Regulations, policies and procedures.

7. Ability to effectively communicate with team members, allied agencies, and make justifiable decisions in an emergency.

8. Ability to work independently under stressful situations and exercise sound judgement in an emergency environment.

9. Ability to identify patient treatment needs through adequate assessment and provide appropriate care in accordance with the Basic Life Support Standards and medical delegation policies.

10. Demonstrate competency when using basic computer software such as reporting systems, inventory, email, and word processing.

11. Excellent use of verbal and written English.

12. Satisfactory health, attendance, and former employment history.

13. Criminal Record check free of crimes of moral turpitude.

14. Must possess fully functional smartphone with active data plan.

15. May require the use of a personal or company vehicle while FRO business. Must be physically capable of operating a vehicle safely for long periods of time, must hold and maintain a driver's licence that authorizes the person to drive an ambulance, have an acceptable driving record, and personal insurance coverage. Prior commercial driving experience an asset.

Duties

1. While on-call, be ready to respond in FRO Emergency Response Vehicle to any area of the province of Ontario within 48 hours and remain deployed in potentially remote camp environment for up to 14 days. Travel, accommodation, and meals provided.

2. Provide emergency medical care to ill/injured people while ensuring the safe, timely, and appropriate extrication of ill/injured persons via emergency response vehicle or rotor-wing aircraft to land/air ambulance rendezvous sites or medical treatment facilities where circumstances dictate.

3. Perform emergency medical care and controlled acts under the direction of the Medical Director, and in accordance with the patient care standards and procedures set out by FRO, Ministry of Health, Ministry of Natural Resources and Forestry, legislation, and regulations.

4. Respond to emergencies in all weather conditions, in a safe and secure manner, in accordance with the Highway Traffic Act and the applicable policies and procedures.

5. Maintain contact and comply with direction from Superintendent and/or Incident Command at all times regarding vehicle movements, status of equipment, call assignments and the transportation of patients to medical facilities or required destination.

6. Complete, in a timely manner, all required patient and administrative documentation specified in the Ambulance Act, Regulations, standards, company and client policies and practices, including Paramedic Call Report forms. Ensure safekeeping of patient records.

7. Liaise with CACC, families, client staff, police, fire and other health professionals/agencies to ensure relevant patient information is collected.

8. Inspect all equipment at the start and throughout the shift to ensure they are in proper working order, and in a clean and sanitary condition. Carry out housekeeping duties within the medical centre and paramedic vehicles, ensuring the areas are maintained in a clean, sanitary condition.

9. Participate in mandatory training programs, continuing medical education programs, quality assurance programs and company training programs, as required.

10. Perform other related duties as may be required.

Recruitment Process

Candidates selected to proceed will be contacted by email.

Recruitment phase two,

· Selected candidates will be invited to book a video interview on a date to be determined. Successful candidates will be invited to phase three.

Recruitment phase three,

· Selected candidates will be invited to participate in practical skills assessments conducted on a date to be determined in western GTA.

· A $60.00 skills assessment fee payable to an independent third party will apply.

Recruitment phase four,

· Selected candidates to attend on-boarding on a date to be determined.

Qualified candidates should submit their résumé and covering letter with their email address prominently displayed on the letterhead by the indicated closing date by applying online at www.indeed.com/

Any application received after the deadline will not be considered for this competition.

Accessibility accommodations are available for all parts of the recruitment process and applicants must make their needs known in advance. First Response Ontario values a diverse workforce and the unique differences that each individual brings. We are dedicated to maintaining a fair and equitable work environment and welcome submissions from all qualified applicants.

Personal information submitted will be used for the purpose of determining suitability for this competition only. All applicants are thanked for their interest in this position, only those selected to advance will be contacted. If contacted, and you require a disability related accommodation to participate in the recruitment process you must notify the Recruiting Officer.

Job Types: Full-time, Fixed term contract
Contract length: 5 months

Salary: $475.00-$600.00 per day

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay

Benefits:

  • Discounted or free food

Schedule:

  • 12 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Holidays
  • On call

COVID-19 considerations:
The Ontario Government requires all Paramedics to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19, meaning minimum two doses of an approved vaccine.

Experience:

  • Paramedic employment or completed preceptorship: 1 year (required)

Licence/Certification:

  • Advanced Emergency Medical Care Attendant certificate (preferred)
  • Ontario F class Driver's Licence (preferred)
  • Ornge Aeromedical Theory certificate (preferred)

Application deadline: 2022-05-14

title: taxi driver
description:
Credentials (certificates, licences, memberships, courses, etc.)

  • Provincial or Territorial Commercial Vehicle licence (Class 4 or E)
  • First Aid Certificate
  • Driver's License
  • CPR Certificate
  • Class 4/4F/F/4A-B-C Licence (ambulances, emergency vehicles and buses with fewer than 24 passengers)

Security and Safety

  • Bondable
  • Child abuse registry check
  • Driver's validity licence check
  • Driving record check (abstract)
  • Drug test
  • Criminal record check
  • Adult Abuse Registry
