title: EMT / Site Administrator
description:
The Nuna Group of Companies is now accepting resumes for an Emergency Medical Professional to work at our fly-in, fly-out, site based in Nunavut. This role will also be responsible with assisting with site administrative duties. At a minimum EMT designation is required, but a PCP (Primary Care Paramedic) designation or higher is preferred. Nuna is the largest Inuit-owned heavy civil construction, earthworks, and mine construction contractor in Canada.
Requirements:
  • Current EMT-A or PCP registration,
  • Minimum of 3 years of previous camp experience in a remote mining/construction setting,
  • Physical ability to lift > 50lbs for short durations,
  • Capable of working independently in a fast-paced environment with good safety awareness,
  • Strong team player, with experience in cross cultural work environments,
  • Ability to effectively communicate through speech,
  • Good organization and problem-solving skills,
  • Experience with trucking dispatch an asset,
  • Experience with radio communications and protocols,
  • Advanced computer skills,
  • Accurate data entry skills.
Medical Responsibilities include, but not limited to:
  • Administering first-aid treatment and life-support care to sick or injured persons in a remote camp setting,
  • Operating equipment such as external defibrillators and bag-valve mask resuscitators in advanced life-support environments,
  • Assessing the nature and extent of illness or injury to establish and prioritize medical procedures,
  • Observing, recording, and reporting to the physician the patient's condition or injury, the treatment provided, and reactions to drugs and treatment,
  • Administering drugs, orally or by injection, and performing intravenous procedures under a physician's direction,
  • Immobilizing patient for transportation on stretcher for ambulance/aircraft/marine transport, using backboard or other spinal immobilization device,
  • Coordinating with local treatment centers and providing patients' vital statistics and medical history, to determine the circumstances of the emergency, and to administer emergency treatment,
  • Comforting and reassuring patients,
  • Maintaining medical vehicle and medical and communication equipment, and replenishing first-aid equipment and supplies.
Site Administrative Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
  • Compiling accurate and timely daily/weekly reports,
  • Collecting and reviewing employee timesheets on a daily basis ensuring all fields are completed correctly,
  • Informing the Project Manager/Superintendent of any discrepancies found upon daily review of employee timesheets,
  • Accurately entering data from employee timesheets,
  • Monitoring and entering material chargebacks into the database from invoices,
  • Compiling reports produced from entries into the database for signed approval from the Superintendent and designated client representative,
  • Maintaining any required filing to support the database,
  • Maintaining cross shift notes to keep cross shift informed and up to date of work activities that have transpired with the cross shift has been on days off,
  • Reviewing on a timely basis with Operations Office – any work activities transpiring on site affecting invoicing/billing (ex. change to client work codes, labour and equipment rates, equipment movement, new subcontractors onsite,
  • Managing confidential employee information and keep information locked in a secure area,
  • Providing administrative assistance with regards to employee forms, documents, and benefits,
  • Assisting with travel arrangements for personal from point of hire to work location and return,
  • Management of rotation schedules and assessment of personal requirements,
  • Other administrative duties as required.



Work will be primarily outdoors in various weather conditions.
Pre-access clearances are required
All successful candidates must:
  • Be proficient in English, both verbally and written
  • Have a valid Class 5 Driver's License
  • Have experience as requested in the job description above.
Nuna is committed to the principle of employment equity. We welcome diversity and encourage all who are qualified to express their interest.
Interested applicants are asked to apply online at: http://nunalogistics.com/jobs.html
Or by email: hr@nunalogistics.com
We thank all who apply but only those selected for interviews will be contacted.
Nuna is a highly regarded civil construction company with hundreds of employees working across the Arctic and Northern Canada. Working often in remote locations, Nuna offers unique on-the-job experience and opportunity to build an exciting career. Our multi-disciplined teams provide a comprehensive array of services and innovative solutions to the most challenging and remote sites in northern Canada. Nuna's core values of: Safety - Integrity - Teamwork - Respect for Cultural Diversity and for Community & Environment ; reflect our reputation as a safe, cost-effective, and innovative operator in the north.

title: Patient Transfer Driver
description:
Patient Transfer Driver


We are seeking Drivers for our Patient Transfer Service to assist members of our communities transfer between medical facilities.


If you are looking for a career that you feel you could make a difference in, please read below!


Compensation Package:

A basic job, attracts basic pay – we believe that our crews should have the ability to increase their earnings if they wish - unlike many other employers, who ban / avoid higher paid overtime. Our compensation package includes hourly wage, an annual Bonus, the opportunity for overtime, and a Group Benefits and RRSP Program eligibility. There is a CPI pay review each year in January.

We are happy to show you the amounts our current crews ACTUALLY receive [ T4 Amount ] and the hours they spend on the job [anonymously of course].


Required:

  • Class 4 BC's Driver's License, with 5 years total driving experience
  • A Driver's Abstract with no more than 3 points
  • A current valid WSBC recognized First Aid qualification - Preferably OFA-III
  • Pass a Criminal Record Check to work with children and vulnerable adults
  • Vaccinations in accordance with the Immunization Policy for Health Care Workers
  • Both doses of the Covid vaccination

About Us:

We are the leading provider of non-emergency, patient transfers for medically stable patients throughout the Lower Mainland. Using our specially equipped fleet of Ambulances and Accessible vehicles, and ensuring they are transferred in a safe, compassionate and efficient manner.


Skills and Abilities:

  • Physically fit, ability to lift, push or pull 250+ lbs using a wheelchair, stretcher or stair chair with a partner.
  • Ability to effectively communicate - in English - verbally, non-verbally and in writing
  • A positive, can-do attitude, strong work ethic, and participation in what we do.
  • Demonstrated and relevant customer service experience, or experience working with patients.

What our patients / customers say about our crews :

  • Professional, courteous and really genuine people is all I have met during the 15 trips with this company over the last 2-1/2 months. ……. From the very first encounter with with Rob driving, and taking exceptional care of me & my wife......... I am so very impressed with the number of staff – Robin, Janet and so many others, who have been with you for many years. What shines through is that they really love what they are doing each day.”

All applicants will be required to complete a job application and participate in pre-employment testing.


We thank all those who apply, but only those selected for a prescreen interview will be contacted.

title: newEmergency Medical Responder
description:
Your Opportunity:

As an Emergency Medical Responder (EMR), you will be a patient advocate who will effectively communicate and interact with community partners and allied healthcare professionals to ensure safe and proficient patient care and transportation. To fulfill your responsibilities, you will safely operate emergency vehicles, respond to medical and traumatic emergencies and inter-facility transport requests while adhering to professional standards, medical control protocols, standard operating procedures, polices and directives. This position is expected to work in all Edmonton Zone assignments which includes core flex work. This requisition will be used to fill multiple vacancies.

Description:

As an Emergency Medical Responder (EMR), you will transport ill or injured patients from scenes of emergency and/or between facilities. This includes operating ambulances or other modes of transportation; assessing emergency scenes and patients; providing simple treatments and completing required documentation including patient care reports. Alberta Health Services EMS requires the proof of the successful completion of the Functional Abilities Recruitment Evaluation (F.A.R.E.) test via the certificate provided by the Lifemark organization for all applicants external to AHS or internal to AHS, who do not already hold a clinical position within AHS EMS (VESST, Clinical Educator, EMR, PCP, ACP and Community Paramedic). Your F.A.R.E. test must be completed six (6) prior to the date of your application. Alberta Health Services EMS may verify results with Lifemark to ensure the candidate has successfully completed the test. Please contact Lifemark at www.lifemark.ca/alberta-health-services to find more information on the F.A.R.E. test and how to book your evaluation. You will assist with ensuring that ambulances or other Emergency Medical Services (EMS) vehicles, such as transfer vans, are properly stocked and equipped.

  • Classification: Emergency Medical Respond 2088
  • Union: HSAA Facility PROF/TECH
  • Department: Interfacility Srv Recipient Tr
  • Primary Location: InterFacility Transport EMS ED
  • Multi-Site: Not Applicable
  • FTE: 1.00
  • Posting End Date: 09-MAY-2022
  • Employee Class: Regular Full Time
  • Date Available: 23-MAY-2022
  • Hours per Shift: 8
  • Length of Shift in weeks: 8
  • Shifts per cycle: 40
  • Shift Pattern: Days, Evenings, Nights, Weekends
  • Days Off: As Per Rotation
  • Minimum Salary: $20.25
  • Maximum Salary: $23.67
  • Vehicle Requirement: Driver's License, Vehicle Provided
Required Qualifications:

Completion of an accredited Emergency Medical Responder or Primary Care Paramedic program. Active registration with Alberta College of Paramedics (ACP) as an Emergency Medical Responder. Current Basic Cardiac Life Support - Healthcare Provider (BCLS-HCP). Must hold a valid Class 4 Alberta Operator's Licence with no more than six (6) demerits. Completion of the Functional Abilities Recruitment Evaluation (F.A.R.E.) test taken no more than six (6) months prior to the application date.

Additional Required Qualifications:

Applications may be shared with AHS EMS recruitment teams from communities other than the one listed on this posting. Successful candidate must work collaboratively with a patient, their family and members of the patient’s healthcare team, consulting with other healthcare providers when necessary. Must act respectfully in a manner that upholds the patient, coworker and employers dignity, safety, privacy, confidentiality and decision-making; taking into account the patient, coworker and employers rights, needs, culture and environmental context. Must be available for orientation and mentorship. Must be available for short notice work opportunities.

Preferred Qualifications:

High school diploma or equivalent.

Must hold a valid Class 4 Alberta Operator's Licence with no more than six (6) demerits. Completion of the Functional Abilities Recruitment Evaluation (F.A.R.E.) test taken no more than six (6) months prior to the application date.", 'High school diploma or equivalent.']

title: Horse Ambulance Driver
description:
Our rich history is a big part of who we are. With historic roots dating back over 135 years, Woodbine is steeped in tradition. We have been the engine that drives the Ontario horse racing industry. From King’s and Queen’s trips to Canada, anniversaries and unforgettable horse races, we have been creating winning experiences for all our guests.

We are currently on an amazing 20-year journey to ‘build a city within a city’ and transform the largest privately held land in Toronto into one of Canada’s premiere entertainment destinations. This journey will unlock the value of approximately 700 acres of land, leading to job creation and the revitalization of our communities, while enhancing our ability to share the thrill of horse-racing and cementing our place as an entertainment powerhouse.
We need dedicated people to join our cause. Be part of Woodbine Entertainment and get inspired to make work awesome!

Our Values & Beliefs
| WOW EVERY GUEST | OWN IT! | LISTEN & CONNECT – PEOPLE MATTER | FUEL THE FUN & PASS IT ON | TRUST IN OUR TEAM | #WE CARE | PURSUE YOUR POTENTIAL |BE BOLD| BE ALL IN |

Woodbine Entertainment is growing, and we are currently looking for a Horse Ambulance Driver who is customer-focused and committed to providing our guests with winning experiences!
This position will be responsible for loading injured horses onto the Horse Ambulance and transporting injured horses to the backstretch or hospital, or to preferred destination, using skill and caution in driving to avoid sudden motions detrimental to horses.

Our ideal candidate is going to have a strong passion to wow our guests, great communication skills, a friendly and outgoing attitude, be able to work in a fast-paced environment and be willing to maximize their potential. At Woodbine, the opportunities are endless, so come join a company that makes work awesome!


Key Success Factors

  • Experience handling horses
  • Ability to deal with problems involving a few concrete variables in standardized situations
  • Have a minimum “G” class driver’s license
  • Possess or be able to obtain an AGCO License
  • Must be able to lift and/or move more than 100 pounds
Guided by our Values and Beliefs, Woodbine Entertainment commits to providing an authentic and empowering work experience! Please reach out if you're ready to embrace change and be part of a new breed of experience while working for one of Canada’s certified Great Places to Work!

title: Delivery Driver - AAG 9223
description:
Company Description


Our drivers have important missions everyday

Whatever division you join, you are a crucial part of our team. When we deliver parts, we are helping a parent be on time at the daycare, an ambulance get back on the road quickly or a truck deliver produce to a Canadian community on time. That is why we say we keep Canadians moving forward.

The impact our Drivers make is undeniable!

Join a special kind of workplace. We have the experience and strength of our 100-year legacy and the desire to always do better for our team members and clients. Our 5000 colleagues proudly serve thousands of customers every day across Canada.

Get to work with great people, use the company car, have a stable schedule, and foremost help your community.

If the hat fits, we’d be proud to have you wear it! Send us your resume and join a people-centric company with a reputation of excellence.


Job Description


Are you a car enthusiast looking for an exciting career opportunity? Get behind the wheel and deliver vehicle parts to our customers! Take pride in wearing our uniform and driving our vehicles as you work in a dynamic and stimulating environment.

Our drivers are courteous, efficient, safe, and organized. We insist that all our drivers be careful on the road. At AAG, your safety is our priority!

We offer a range of attractive benefits and corporate discounts, as well as training throughout your career to support and guide your professional development. Visit our Career website for the complete list of our benefits and perks!


Qualifications


To join our team, you need:

  • Valid driver’s license · One year of related work experience in automotive or heavy vehicle parts
  • Able to lift up to 50lbs.
  • Priority management
  • Communication and listening skills
  • Teamwork and excellent customer service skills

We are open to full-time and part-time applicants.


Additional Information


UAP is a diverse community that promotes inclusion and respect. The sum of our individual differences, experiences, knowledge, self-expression, unique capabilities, and talents, represents the richness of our culture. During the selection process, let us know if you need any accommodations. This information will be kept entirely confidential and will only be used to ensure you have a fair and pleasant experience with us

We will contact you as soon as possible if we think we have the hat for you!

title: Chair-A-Van Driver
description:
Part-Time Casual (Weekdays/Evening/Weekend Shifts)

PURPOSE OF THE JOB:

To operate a Para-Transit Chair-A-Van vehicle and provide transportation to clients.

CHAIR-A-VAN DRIVER DUTIES:

  • Drives vehicle following a scheduled route, picking up and dropping off passengers in a curb-to-curb Para-Transit service.
  • Operate wheelchair lift and belting procedures to ensure the safe loading and unloading of clients.
  • Follow policies and procedures in securing clients with wheelchairs, seats and floor restraints
  • Collect fares for tickets as directed by dispatcher.
  • Control the bus through a range of weather and traffic conditions including frequent unexpected occurrences in order to provide safe and efficient transportation service to clients.
  • Carry out a visual inspection and circle check at start of run, tests brakes and steering, check lift, make adjustments to bus for personal and passenger comfort.
  • Monitor payments and proof of payments for correctness.
  • Greet passengers, caution passengers when their behavior might interfere with safe operation of the bus, continually monitor passenger and traffic movements both inside and outside bus.
  • Communicate to dispatcher using communication system in case of road, bus, and passengers emergencies or when information is needed
  • Draw on knowledge of Highway Traffic Act, general transit and company information, routes, schedules, company information sources, location of landmarks and city events, and of driving characteristics of bus as they manifest under different traffic and weather conditions.
  • Rely on defensive driving and observational skills, interpersonal skills when dealing with supervisors, co-workers and the public in order to drive the bus correctly safety and efficiently.
  • Remove snow and ice buildup from the steps and lifts of the vehicle to ensure public safety.
  • Respond appropriately to radio notices of changes or alterations to schedule.
  • Maintain bus in clean and organized manner throughout shift with cleaning done as required.
  • Complete all maintenance logs, and vehicle checks as required.
  • Complete all necessary paper work and turn into office in a timely manner as requested.
  • When scheduling permits, assist with deliveries, pickups, or other functions when requested.

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE:

  • Minimum Grade 12 education
  • Minimum Class “F” License in good standing with a clean driving record (must advise office of any conviction under the Highway Traffic Act in a timely manner)
  • Operators must have a pleasant personality and be able to handle stressful situations·
  • Operators must have a neat and tidy appearance and in keeping with uniform requirements·
  • Operators must have current knowledge of the Highway Traffic Act
  • Operators must be able to pass company medicals i.e. MTO requirements
  • Operators must have a current St. John Ambulance Standard First Aid Certificate with CPR
  • Operators must provide satisfactory police check prior to beginning employment and thereafter
  • Operators will provide a satisfactory drivers abstract prior to beginning employment
  • Excellent communication and customer service skills
  • Ability to handle stressful situations, including emergencies, in a calm and professional manner

Job Types: Part-time, Casual

Salary: $17.20 per hour

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Holidays
  • Monday to Friday
  • Night shift
  • Weekend availability

title: Primary Care Paramedic
description:
Advanced Medical Solutions Inc. (AMS) has an opportunity for a Primary Care Paramedic to relocate to Inuvik, NT and join our Ground Ambulance Service. This is a 6-month contract, ideal for an individual that is looking for growth opportunities as a PCP. Come and experience the North, do not miss your chance for adventure, apply now!!!!
Highlights:

  • Rotational work-4 days on and 4 days off
  • Competitive salary
  • Accommodations provided
  • Education & Training provided

PCP Qualifications:

  • EMT/PCP License – valid & in good standing
  • HCP CPR Provider or BLS
  • WHMIS
  • Class 4 Driver’s License
  • Drivers Abstract – in good standing
  • Vulnerable Sector Check (at least within 90 days)
  • Current Medical & Immunization Record
  • Emergency Vehicle Operator certification or equivalent preferred

PCP Job Responsibilities:

  • Working as part of a team to provide the highest and most effective patient care possible during all phases of the ground transport process and practices.
  • Assess extent of injuries or illness of patients to determine emergency medical treatment required.
  • Responsible for the safe ambulance operations and transport of patients from remote areas to the Inuvik Regional Hospital.
  • Document and record nature of injuries and treatment provided.
  • Cleaning and maintenance of medical equipment, ambulance, base, and resupply of consumable equipment.

title: Patient Transfer Technician - Ambulance Driver
description:
Welcome to NUPT- Non-Urgent Patient Transport. A company like no other, where you are treated with respect, appreciated by our customers and truly make a difference in someone's life. As a medical attendant, you will be assisting our guests from their home to hospital, hospital to hospital, or perhaps to an appointment. Please visit our webpage and YouTube channel to learn more about us. www.nupt.ca

NUPT is looking at hiring motivated team players that are willing to go above and beyond to help others. In this industry, compassion and respect for others is paramount.

--*WE ARE CURRENTLY OFFERING A 300 DOLLAR SIGN ON BONUS TO ANY APPLICANT THAT PASSES PROBATION*--

We are looking for candidates that possess the following skills:

Basic Patient care skills

Defensive driving

Strong communication skills

CPR certified

Physically fit and able to lift 100lbs

Clean Criminal record

Clean Driving record

For all new hires, pay starts at $16.00 with the opportunity to move up in pay from there within weeks. We watch for teamwork, communication and punctuality.

All steps are being taken to ensure your safety in the workplace. Occupational health and safety is a huge priority for us

title: Company Driver (Class 1) Evening
description:
We currently have an opportunity for a Class 1 Company Driver to join our growing team in the Okanagan region. Shift starts in Kelowna at 4pm, our drivers pickup and deliver LTL and palletized shipments in a safe, friendly and efficient manner. If you are hard-working, reliable, “can do” attitude and have excellent driving skills, you can enjoy a rewarding career with Diamond Delivery.

Requirements:

. You must own your own safety PPE

· 2-year Mountain driving experience

· Decent driver's abstract and Class 1 CDL is a requirement

· Responsible for inspecting your equipment to ensure it is in proper operating condition, fueled and ready for dispatch

· Connect, stage and secure all vehicles on a daily basis, to route load schedule

· Completion of required paperwork / Perform daily inspections of the equipment

· Work in a safe manner and complying with the Health and Safety rules as set by the Company / Reporting any injuries or incidents in a timely manner

· Ensure that a high level of security is maintained with our equipment and the staging area

· Ensures compliance with DOT rules and regulations and company policies and procedures

Diamond Delivery is a leader in providing transportation solutions - we have been transporting freight and packages since 1977. Our industry experience, fleet capabilities, professional drivers, and modern tracking system ensure quality service to our clients throughout the Lower Mainland, Vancouver Island, the Okanagan and Northern BC.

Join the Diamond Delivery team and create a great future! We believe in service excellence and giving back to the communities where we live and work. Diamond Deliver proudly supports a wide range of charitable organizations, youth sports and other worthy causes. From BC Children’s Hospital and the Make-A-Wish Foundation to delivering Liberia’s first ambulance, we walk the talk every day

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $27.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • Extended health care

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Experience:

  • Heavy & Tractor-Trailer Truck Drivers: 2 years (preferred)

Expected start date: 2022-04-25

title: Primary Care Paramedic
description:
The Primary Care Paramedic is the first responder in a construction site. They ensure first care in case of accidents until emergency services arrive on site.

TASKS AND DUTIES

  • Ensure first care to employees injured while working;
  • Advise if the injured employee needs to be referred to a doctor for additional care;
  • Depending on the evaluation, decide if the employee can perform light duties;
  • Manage all the paperwork related to the event;
  • Maintain the supplies inventory;
  • If required, assist the injured employee when transported by ambulance to the hospital;
  • If needed, give administrative assistance to the construction project.

QUALIFICATIONS

  • Active registration with Alberta College of Paramedics (ACP)
  • Must hold a valid drivers license with a clean driving record
  • Minimum of 1 year in emergency care
  • Experience with customer service
  • Training in Health and Safety in construction sites (asset)
  • Good proficiency in Microsoft Office software
  • Experience in construction is an asset
  • Ability to deal with high pressured situations with strong critical thinking skills
  • Recognized for discretion and listening skills

Thank you for your interest in a career at Borea.

Due to the volume of applications we receive, not all applicants will be contacted. Please note that we may consider your CV for other positions as they become available.

Borea is committed to fostering a diverse and representative workforce and an inclusive working environment where all employees are treated fairly.

Responsibilities, duties and requirements can vary according to the needs of the project.

Job Types: Full-time, Fixed term contract
Contract length: 12 months

Additional pay:

  • Overtime pay

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance

Schedule:

  • 10 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • Overtime
  • Weekend availability

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Oyen, AB: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Experience:

  • PCP: 1 year (required)

Licence/Certification:

  • Registration for Alberta College of Paramedics license (required)

title: Emergency Medical Responder - Special Events Division - Comp...
description:
The Emergency Medical Responder (EMR) will report directly to their Supervisor. EMRs
will be primarily responsible for providing patient care to attendees of special events at a
basic life support (BLS) level.
Responsibilities:
Working within the scope of practice and under Medical Direction, the PCP will be
responsible to:

  • Assess the extent of injuries or illness to determine medical treatment
  • Perform and interpret diagnostic procedures such as taking vital signs and testing

glucose levels

  • Administer pre-hospital emergency care including cardiopulmonary resuscitation

(CPR), oxygen, bandaging, splinting, assisting in childbirth, and the treatment of
trauma patients

  • Maintain airways with basic airway control via NPA/OPA
  • Use an automatic external defibrillator
  • Use spinal immobilization devices and traction splints
  • Document and record the nature of injuries and treatment provided
  • Maintain records of work assignment, vehicle mileage, repairs, fuel, and other

vehicle expenses

  • Ensure ambulances/MTCs are properly equipped and are fully supplied
  • Maintain immunizations/vaccines
  • Ensure 100% compliancy on DATS
  • Compliant in usage of uniforms
  • Be punctual
  • Communicate; Stay connected on Whatsapp groups, notify supervisors of any

important issues that arise, answering phones as quickly as possible and calling
back when required, checking/responding to emails regularly

  • Display and promote APL’s Core Values: Professionalism, Community,

Compassion, Integrity, Innovation

  • Other duties as required to ensure operational status.

Skills and Knowledge

  • Able to effectively communicate both verbally and in writing
  • Strong understanding of Emergency Medical Responder protocols
  • Able to use good judgment and work collaboratively
  • Ability to familiarize and engage with the communities being serviced
  • Strong understanding and application of APL’s core values
  • Valid class 5 driver license
  • Clean drivers abstract
  • ACP practice permit
  • CPR
  • Criminal record check

Physical Demands/Working Conditions
Work is physically demanding with the following requirements;

  • Lifting loads weighing over 20kg
  • Walking on uneven ground
  • Standing/kneeling
  • Sitting for extended periods of time
  • Reaching above shoulder height
  • Lifting stretcher/stair chair/scoop/spine board with a partner up to 250lbs
  • Lifting while pulling/rolling/pushing patients on/off beds/stretchers/spine boards

up to 250lbs with a partner

  • Working in stressful circumstances
  • Working shifts that include evenings, weekends, holidays, and on-call shifts

Job Type: Casual

Salary: From $20.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • On call

Application deadline: 2022-04-20

title: Primary Care Paramedic Competition #1-0422-01
description:
Employment Opportunity
Full-Time Primary Care Paramedic
Posted April 26, 2022
Closing date May 3, 2022 at 16:00 hrs

The Bonnyville Regional Fire Authority EMS Division is looking for ambitious and enthusiastic team members to provide a high-level of patient care in a vast and diverse region of Northeast Alberta.

BRFA has implemented an extensive fatigue management program for Coreflex rotations and offers accommodations onsite at no cost to scheduled staff. Full-time staff receive a comprehensive extended health, dental and vision benefits package, healthcare spending account, pension program and reimbursement for Alberta College of Paramedic annual fees.

Our EMS Division offers a supporting team environment that values a collaborative, respectful and enjoyable workplace. The BRFA has an established robust mental health support program focused on developing and fostering sustainable mental health practices for long and healthy careers for first responders. Access to our Employee Assistance Program is available to all members.

Qualified applicants have a desire to provide the best level of care to the community, are team oriented and willing to learn, grow and evolve professionally. Those awaiting registration exam results are welcome to apply. Apply now for a rewarding experience in EMS!

Core Duties and Responsibilities:

· Provide ground ambulance services.

· Participate in learning and education opportunities.

· Maintain equipment and vehicle readiness.

· Comply with BRFA’s policies and procedures.

Certifications, Licenses and/or Designations:

· Unrestricted Primary Care Paramedic (PCP) currently registered in good standing with the Alberta College of Paramedics (ACOP) in the Province of Alberta.

· Unrestricted valid Class 4 operators license with clean drivers abstract.

· CPR certificate for Health Care Provider.

Assets

· Minimum 1-year experience working as a Primary Care Paramedic.

· F.A.R.E test or equivalent.

· ITLS and PEARS certifications.

· Professional Driver’s Improvement Course or equivalent.

Hours of work: Original assignment in a Coreflex shift on a compressed work week consisting of 4 days on then 4 days off; a shift shall consist of 12 hours at the basic rate of pay plus 12 hours on-call pay; annual hours are 2190.

Wages: Range from $25.45 to $31.56 based on experience. Accommodations available on site.

BRFA EMS Division staff are currently represented by Health Sciences Association of Alberta. Please review the Collective Agreement on their website. Interested applicants are invited to submit their résumé and cover letter to:

Mail:
Bonnyville Regional Fire Authority
Box 6827
Bonnyville, Alberta T9N 2H3
ATTN: PCP Coreflex Competition #1-0422-01

Email:
Subject: PCP Coreflex Competition #1-0422-01

PLEASE NOTE: All applicants must be legally entitled to live and work in Canada, and only those selected for interview will be contacted.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $25.45-$31.56 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Overtime pay

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • Paid time off
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 12 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Night shift

Application deadline: 2022-05-03

title: newParamedic (Six Months Fixed Term)
description:
POSITION OVERVIEW:

The Paramedic is the sites healthcare professional responsible for providing pre-hospital assessment and medical care to people with acute illness or injures. This position also plays a critical role in the site emergency preparedness and response plan and will work very closely with the mine site emergency response coordinator and mine rescue members. This position is a six months fixed term contract.


RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Develop and maintain the first aid services plan on site for Mount
  • Maintain the onsite medical facility, its equipment, and inventories to industry standards.
  • This includes cleaning, decontaminating, and inspecting emergency vehicles and equipment to maintain a constant state of emergency preparedness
  • Provide routine medical care and advanced life support services to the mine site
  • Respond to emergency calls for medical assistance at accidents and emergencies
  • On call during the night for emergencies
  • Assure compliance with company policies and procedures
  • Administer drug and alcohol screening as per company policy
  • Provide monthly reports and statistics concerning site injuries and incidents
  • Perform industrial hygiene sampling program including medical surveillance testing
  • Participate with Emergency Response Team and emergency response drills
  • Liaising with members of emergency services, such as the police, coroner, Mine Rescue personnel, and other ambulance services to ensure the appropriate level of response
  • Manning an ambulance or other rapid response vehicle
  • Preparing and reporting the patient's history, condition, and treatment to relevant hospital staff
  • Other Health and Safety duties as required

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Primary Care Paramedic licenced in British Columbia plus a minimum of 4 years experience in heavy industry
  • Occupational First Aid level III or equivalent.
  • Class 4 Drivers License in British Columbia
  • CPR-C Certificate
  • Drug and alcohol collection training would be an asset
  • Strong written and oral communications skills
  • Friendly and outgoing with strong interpersonal skills
  • Project and organization skills
  • Conflict Management skills
  • Leadership skills that enlist others to keep working towards the vision of “Zero Incidents & Accidents”
  • Ability & willingness to learn new skills & concepts

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION:

  • The role is located at the Mount Milligan Mine, which is approximately 155 kilometers northwest of Prince George, British Columbia
  • Bus transportation to and from site is provided free of charge from several locations within the region. Employees accessing the site from outside the region are eligible to receive a tax-free travel allowance commensurate with the distance they are required to travel
  • Candidates must be able to maintain high levels of performance for extended shifts
  • Mount Milligan promotes a drug and alcohol-free workplace and has adopted a zero-tolerance policy with respect to alcohol or unauthorized drugs on site
  • An industry competitive salary that is commensurate with experiences, qualifications, and skills
  • Tax-free travel allowance for those living outside the region
  • Comfortable camp accommodations, each room having a private washroom, TV and wifi. The camp is complete with a gymnasium and other recreational activities
  • Extended health, dental and travel benefits, including life insurance
  • Employee and family assistance program

WORK SCHEDULE:


This is a camp-based position with a schedule of 7 days' working with 7 days’ rest, 12 hours per day.

title: Technician Paramedic - EMT2
description:
Requisition ID: 311637

Position Number: 20091382

Posting End Date: Open Until Filled

City: Churchill

Site: Shared Health

Work Location: Churchill

Department / Unit: Emergency Medical Services

Job Stream: Clinical

Union: SHMGEUChurch134

Anticipated Start Date: ASAP

FTE: 1.00

Anticipated Shift: Days;Nights;Weekends;Standby coverage as required, On Call

Daily Hours Worked: 12.00

Annual Base Hours: 2080

Salary: $23.943, $25.560, $27.386, $29.251, $31.132, $32.954

ACCOMIDATIONS PROVIDED YEAR ROUND


Shared Health leads the planning and coordinates the integration of patient-centred clinical and preventive health services across Manitoba. The organization also delivers some province-wide health services and supports centralized administrative and business functions for Manitoba health organizations.

Position Overview

Under the direction of the Emergency Medical Services Manager, Workplace Health & Safety Officer, the Technician/Technician-Paramedic will assist in the daily operation of the Emergency Medical Services department. They are responsible for the overall care of patients within the Churchill area. Primary responsibilities relate to patient care, professional standards, treatment of the ill and injured, maintenance of equipment and vehicles as outlined in the ambulance act and all applicable regulations/policies within Shared Health Manitoba. The Technician-Paramedic will also be responsible for various CRHA communications initiatives as well as staff training.

Experience

  • Previous experience in an Emergency Medical Services setting an asset.
  • Previous experience in training staff and community members an asset.

Education (Degree/Diploma/Certificate)

  • Successful completion of a recognized Primary Care Paramedic program.

Certification/Licensure/Registration

  • Maintains Class 4 Manitoba Drivers License.
  • Ability to license and maintain license under Manitoba Health.

Qualifications and Skills

  • Strong computer skills required.
  • Demonstrates a calm and confident manner during emergency / difficult situations.
  • Maintains confidentiality with all information entrusted to the position.
  • Represents the CRHA in a professional and positive manner.

Physical Requirements

  • Possible heavy lifting at times.
  • Possible eye strain.
  • Possible posture and muscle injury/problem.
  • Possible contact with violent/aggressive clients.
  • Possible fatigue due to call backs.

The Collective Agreement this position is covered under, is identified by the Union noted above. As a result of The Health Sector Bargaining Unit Review Act, the bargaining agent for this position may differ from the Union identified. In the event you have any questions, please contact your site Human Resources Department.


We have a unique ability to work together to make health care better. If you want to make a difference and contribute to supporting the health of your family, friends and neighbours, please apply today.


Interested candidates should select the "Apply" icon below to upload their cover letter, resume and copy of licenses/certification.


This position requires a current satisfactory Criminal Records Check (including Vulnerable Sector Search), Child Abuse Registry Check and Adult Abuse Registry Check as conditions of employment. The successful candidate will be responsible for any service charges incurred. A security check is considered current if it was obtained no more than six (6) months prior to the start of employment.


Please note that an employee is not permitted to hold two or more positions in Shared Health that combine to equal more than 1.0 FTE.


Shared Health values and supports employment equity and workplace diversity and encourages all qualified individuals to apply. We thank all applicants but only those selected for an interview will be contacted.


We welcome applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request during the assessment and selection process.

title: Event Medic - Algoma Region
description:
Event Medics – Algoma Region (Casual)

Superior EMS is currently seeking motivated individuals in our event EMS division for the anticipated upcoming 2022 event season for entry level medic and primary care medic positions. Our event medics respond to and manage emergency incidents at community events. The event EMS division provides services at many different events and provides a range of services to ensure that spectators and participants receive prompt medical care in the event of an emergency.

Our event EMS service provides more than “first aid”. Our services are provided under medical direction to deliver a wide range of medications in the field, and our medics are trained to manage a range of medical emergencies from basic first aid to complex clinical interventions. Medics will provide care on-site which reduces the number of people being transported to hospital for medical attention, and when necessary, will arrange for transportation through the municipal paramedic service.

Superior EMS provides services at a wide variety of events including sporting, fairs and festivals, concerts, government events, motorsports and races, charity events, film sets and mass casualty emergencies.

Our event medics also support our patient transfer services. Our transfer service provides non-emergent stretcher-based transport services in the Algoma region, including hospital transfers, and private air-ambulance ground transport.

Duties and Responsibilities:

· Attend events and undertake responsibilities to the level of your certification in the pre-hospital environment

· Maintain professional competencies and proficiencies to the scope of practice of your certification

· Respond to and provide patient care with the appropriate equipment based on the company’s current patient care standards (BLS & ALS standards).

· Operate various vehicle including ambulance type vehicles, Utility off-road stretcher equipped vehicles, and field clinic environments

· Ensure that equipment is always ready for use, and champion responsibility for cleanliness of equipment and vehicles to ensure professional level service

· Maintain accurate vehicle and patient documentation including confidential details while remaining sensitive to the nature of the information being collected

· Conduct dynamic risk assessments when responding to incidents for the protection of yourself and others, and respond to the risks accordingly

· Ensure appropriate and timely referrals are made to other agencies (i.e. arranging transport through municipal paramedic services for definitive care).

Application Criteria

· General Criteria

o Decision making capability, both when working alone or working as part of a team

o Ability to work alone of as part of a multidisciplinary team

o Commitment to giving high quality care

o Able to effectively communicate with others, while respecting confidentiality

o Able to produce timely, accurate, and legible records relating to patient care

o Ability and willingness to be flexible to meet the needs of the role

o Experience working with iPads, and computer technology an asset

o Drivers Abstract with a minimum class “G” license and less than 3 demerit points

o Criminal Records Check satisfactory to the Private Security and Investigative Services Act (2005).

o Successful completion of the physical demands testing

· Medic

o Emergency Medical Responder certification

o Current Basic Life Support CPR & AED

o Current volunteer or educational experience in the health field (i.e. Nursing Student, Paramedic Student) with willingness obtain EMR certification

o Willingness to obtain additional certifications to be provided by the company to ensure competency

· Primary Care Medic

o A-EMCA (or pending)

o Obtained base hospital certification in the past

o Current Basic Life Support CPR & AED

o Willingness to obtain additional certifications to be provided by the company to ensure competency

Superior EMS offers a competitive wage, provides extensive training and development including IV therapy, advanced cardiovascular life support, advanced trauma life support, and more to ensure our hires are the best qualified in the field.

Note: All positions are casual based on event and patient transfer shift availability. Hours and dates of shifts are varied and are flexible based on candidate availability.

Hiring Process

Step 1: Submitting your application

Applications are only accepted through our website at http://www.superiorems.ca/employment

· You will require a google account to submit your application, and will be required to upload your resume, certifications, and other documents.

Step 2: Application Screening

· Applications will be screened by our human resources department and hiring committee

· Candidates will be contacted by email if any other additional information is required at this stage

· Only candidates being considered will be contacted and will be invited to interviews and assessment through email (check your junk/spam mail folder frequently)

Step 3: Assessments

· A first interview will be conducted by a member of the command team, and will consist of general employment questions

· Those selected to continue with the assessment process will be required to then complete required testing which may include written and practical testing, and physical demands analysis

· Those who are successful in the testing phase will then complete a second interview which will be conducted by members of the command team and our human resources department

Step 4: Selection

· Our hiring committee will review all the applicant’s information and assessment data, as well as complete a further background check including reference checks to select the best candidates for the position

Stage 5: Job Offer

· A conditional offer of employment will be made to the successful candidate(s)

· Offers of employment are conditional upon:

o Maintaining proper drivers’ licensure

o Satisfactory Criminal Records Check

Superior EMS is an equal opportunity employer. All communications with candidates are via e-mail. We thank all those who apply. Only those selected for further consideration will be contacted.

Job Type: Casual

Application deadline: 2022-05-15

description:

FTE: 1.00

Anticipated Shift: Days;Nights;Weekends

Daily Hours Worked: 12.00

Annual Base Hours: 2184

Salary: $23.943, $25.560, $27.386, $29.251, $31.132, $32.954


Shared Health leads the planning and coordinates the integration of patient-centred clinical and preventive health services across Manitoba. The organization also delivers some province-wide health services and supports centralized administrative and business functions for Manitoba health organizations.

Position Overview

The Technician - Paramedic is a member of Prairie Mountain Health Emergency Medical Services and is responsible for the overall care of patients within Prairie Mountain Health primary service area. Primary responsibilities relate to patient care, professional standards, treatment of the ill and injured, maintenance of equipment and vehicles as outlined in the ambulance act.


Functions are conducted in accordance with the Mission and Values of Shared Health, current policies and procedures and applicable legislation.

Education (Degree/Diploma/Certificate)

  • Eligible for and maintains licensure to practice as a Technician Paramedic in the Province of Manitoba acquired within three (3) months of appointment

Certification/Licensure/Registration


  • Physical Fitness Assessment provided by the University of Manitoba or an Emergency Services Physical Fitness Assessment approved by a Kinesiology Education Program
  • Current certification in Health Provider Level CPR
  • Province of Manitoba Class 4 Drivers License, including clean drivers abstract, and access to a personal vehicle to provide service within Prairie Mountain Health

Qualifications and Skills

  • Demonstrated leadership
  • Demonstrated written and oral communication skills
  • Ability to prioritize in a changing environment
  • Strong organizational, decision making and problem solving skills
  • Ability to display independent judgment
  • Ability to respect and promote a culturally diverse population
  • Ability to respect and promote confidentiality
  • Ability to perform the duties of the position on a regular basis

We have a unique ability to work together to make health care better. If you want to make a difference and contribute to supporting the health of your family, friends and neighbours, please apply today.


Interested candidates should select the "Apply" icon below to upload their cover letter, resume and copy of licenses/certification.


This position requires a current satisfactory Criminal Records Check (including Vulnerable Sector Search), Child Abuse Registry Check and Adult Abuse Registry Check as conditions of employment. The successful candidate will be responsible for any service charges incurred. A security check is considered current if it was obtained no more than six (6) months prior to the start of employment.


Please note that an employee is not permitted to hold two or more positions in Shared Health that combine to equal more than 1.0 FTE.


Shared Health values and supports employment equity and workplace diversity and encourages all qualified individuals to apply. We thank all applicants but only those selected for an interview will be contacted.


We welcome applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request during the assessment and selection process.

title: newRegistered PCP - Paramedic
description:
Your Opportunity:

Description:

As an Emergency Medical Technician, you will transport ill or injured patients from scenes of emergency and/or between facilities. This includes operating ambulances or other modes of transportation, assessing emergency scenes and patients. You may treat patients by administering minor medications, basic life support (BLS) airway adjuncts, and semi-automated defibrillation. You may also lead the BLS crew in delivering clinical care during patient transport or at emergency scenes. You will assist with ensuring that ambulances or other Emergency Medical Services (EMS) vehicles, such as transfer vans, are properly stocked and equipped. Alberta Health Services EMS requires the proof of the successful completion of the Functional Abilities Recruitment Evaluation (F.A.R.E.) test via the certificate provided by the Lifemark organization for all applicants external to AHS or internal to AHS, who do not already hold a clinical position within AHS EMS (VESST, Clinical Educator, EMR, PCP, ACP and Community Paramedic). Your F.A.R.E. test must be completed six (6) prior to the date of your application. Alberta Health Services EMS may verify results with Lifemark to ensure the candidate has successfully completed the test. Please contact Lifemark at www.lifemark.ca/alberta-health-services to find more information on the F.A.R.E. test and how to book your evaluation.

  • Days Off: As Per Rotation
  • Minimum Salary: $27.25
  • Maximum Salary: $34.40
  • Vehicle Requirement: Driver's License, Vehicle Provided
Required Qualifications:

Completion of an accredited Primary Care Paramedic program. Active registration with Alberta College of Paramedics (ACP) as Primary Care Paramedic. Current Basic Cardiac Life Support - Healthcare Provider (BCLS-HCP). Must hold a valid Class 4 Alberta Operator's Licence with no more than six (6) demerits. Completion of the Functional Abilities Recruitment Evaluation (F.A.R.E.) test taken no more than six (6) months prior to the application date.

Additional Required Qualifications:

As required.

Preferred Qualifications:

As required.

We have a unique ability to work together to make health care better. If you want to make a difference and contribute to supporting the health of your family, friends and neighbours, please apply today.


Interested candidates should select the "Apply" icon below to upload their cover letter, resume and copy of licenses/certification.


This position requires a current satisfactory Criminal Records Check (including Vulnerable Sector Search), Child Abuse Registry Check and Adult Abuse Registry Check as conditions of employment. The successful candidate will be responsible for any service charges incurred. A security check is considered current if it was obtained no more than six (6) months prior to the start of employment.


Please note that an employee is not permitted to hold two or more positions in Shared Health that combine to equal more than 1.0 FTE.


Shared Health values and supports employment equity and workplace diversity and encourages all qualified individuals to apply. We thank all applicants but only those selected for an interview will be contacted.


We welcome applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request during the assessment and selection process.


Direct care workers are required to either be vaccinated for Covid-19 or to participate in on-going regular Covid-19 testing pursuant to Orders made under The Public Health Act C.C.S.M. c.P210. Successful applicants will be notified at the time of offer of the applicability of this requirement for this position.

title: Primary Care Paramedic
description:
We are seeking Primary Care Paramedics (EMT/PCP) to join our team as occupational paramedics for upcoming camp based positions in the Northwest Territories.

As an EMT/PCP your main role on site will be to provide emergency response to crews in the event of injury, illness, or emergency situation.

General Responsibilities:

Determine the nature and extent of illness or injury to establish care procedures

Administer pre-hospital first-aid treatment and emergency care at site of emergency, or in specially equipped vehicle.

Establish and maintain IV treatment, apply adjunctive equipment for ventilation and circulation complications, administer medications.

Collect and maintain pertinent and confidential patient medical information and maintain detailed records of the nature of injuries/illnesses and treatment provided.

Communicate with medical personnel at emergency treatment facilities and assist medevac personnel with provision of medical treatment as necessary.

Maintain ambulances and emergency care equipment and supplies

Perform nasopharyngeal swabs for covid-19 testing

Qualifications:

Valid, unrestricted EMT/PCP certificate with current CPR certificate

Previous experience as an EMT/PCP (industrial experience an asset but not required)

Effective communication, problem-solving, and decision-making skills

Ability to stay calm and collected in stressful and emergency situations

Ability to maintain positive, professional relations with a wide range of individuals

Be comfortable working long hours for many consecutive days

Be extremely safety conscious

Possess a reasonable level of fitness Valid Class 4 or 5 driver's license.

62 Degrees North is an equal opportunity employer. We provide competitive salaries and a supportive work environment. Depending on the work location transportation to and from site, meals, and accommodations could be provided.

Are you an experienced medical professional seeking rewarding work? Apply today.

Job Type: Contract

Job Types: Full-time, Fly-In/Fly-Out

Additional pay:

  • Overtime pay

Schedule:

  • 12 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Night shift

Application question(s):

  • Are you legally entitled to work in Canada?

Work remotely:

  • No

title: Primary Care Paramedic, Special Teams
description:
Position Title: Paramedicine Practitioner (formerly Primary Care Paramedic), Fire Ranger Emergency Medical Team

Location: Ontario-wide, deploys out of Barrie and Thunder Bay

Reports To: Superintendent

Employment Type: Temporary contract

Posting Date: 01-May-2022

Closing Date: 14-May-2022, 17:00 EDT

Schedule: Rotating weekly on-call schedule, with potential deployment to anywhere in Ontario to a maximum of 14 days, plus pick-up opportunities

Pay scale: On-call: $100-150/week; when on deployment: $475-$600/day

Qualifications

1. Required to apply:

Must meet all qualifications as outlined in O. Reg. 257/00 PART III including, but not limited to:

1.1. Possess a diploma in Paramedicine.

1.2. A-EMCA certified by the Ministry of Health.

1.3. Current BLS level CPR (formerly HCP)

2. Achieve by start date:

2.1. Incident Management System – IMS 100 certificate of completion (https://training.emergencymanagementontario.ca/TPOnline/TPOnline.dll/EMO_Public_Course/COURSENO=COUR2011070415145004500149)

2.2. Possess Ornge Aeromedical Theory certificate, or anticipated certification (https://www.ornge.ca/about-us/programs/aeromedical-theory)

2.3. Possess Aeromedical Theory certificate from Ministry of health, or proof of registration for examination within 210 days of start of employment.

3. Ability to achieve certification under FRO’s controlled medical acts delegation program.

4. Possess physical abilities certificate from OPPAT, Ability Work, Sibley’s, or equivalent issued within last six months.

5. Ability to exert heavy physical effort required to treat and move patients, sometimes over rugged terrain, deliver medical equipment or sort inventory at health centre, station, and in a vehicle.

6. Good knowledge and application of BLS/ALS Patient Care Standards, related Acts and Regulations, policies and procedures.

7. Ability to effectively communicate with team members, allied agencies, and make justifiable decisions in an emergency.

8. Ability to work independently under stressful situations and exercise sound judgement in an emergency environment.

9. Ability to identify patient treatment needs through adequate assessment and provide appropriate care in accordance with the Basic Life Support Standards and medical delegation policies.

10. Demonstrate competency when using basic computer software such as reporting systems, inventory, email, and word processing.

11. Excellent use of verbal and written English.

12. Satisfactory health, attendance, and former employment history.

13. Criminal Record check free of crimes of moral turpitude.

14. Must possess fully functional smartphone with active data plan.

15. May require the use of a personal or company vehicle while FRO business. Must be physically capable of operating a vehicle safely for long periods of time, must hold and maintain a driver's licence that authorizes the person to drive an ambulance, have an acceptable driving record, and personal insurance coverage. Prior commercial driving experience an asset.

Duties

1. While on-call, be ready to respond in FRO Emergency Response Vehicle to any area of the province of Ontario within 48 hours and remain deployed in potentially remote camp environment for up to 14 days. Travel, accommodation, and meals provided.

2. Provide emergency medical care to ill/injured people while ensuring the safe, timely, and appropriate extrication of ill/injured persons via emergency response vehicle or rotor-wing aircraft to land/air ambulance rendezvous sites or medical treatment facilities where circumstances dictate.

3. Perform emergency medical care and controlled acts under the direction of the Medical Director, and in accordance with the patient care standards and procedures set out by FRO, Ministry of Health, Ministry of Natural Resources and Forestry, legislation, and regulations.

4. Respond to emergencies in all weather conditions, in a safe and secure manner, in accordance with the Highway Traffic Act and the applicable policies and procedures.

5. Maintain contact and comply with direction from Superintendent and/or Incident Command at all times regarding vehicle movements, status of equipment, call assignments and the transportation of patients to medical facilities or required destination.

6. Complete, in a timely manner, all required patient and administrative documentation specified in the Ambulance Act, Regulations, standards, company and client policies and practices, including Paramedic Call Report forms. Ensure safekeeping of patient records.

7. Liaise with CACC, families, client staff, police, fire and other health professionals/agencies to ensure relevant patient information is collected.

8. Inspect all equipment at the start and throughout the shift to ensure they are in proper working order, and in a clean and sanitary condition. Carry out housekeeping duties within the medical centre and paramedic vehicles, ensuring the areas are maintained in a clean, sanitary condition.

9. Participate in mandatory training programs, continuing medical education programs, quality assurance programs and company training programs, as required.

10. Perform other related duties as may be required.

Recruitment Process

Candidates selected to proceed will be contacted by email.

Recruitment phase two,

· Selected candidates will be invited to book a video interview on a date to be determined. Successful candidates will be invited to phase three.

Recruitment phase three,

· Selected candidates will be invited to participate in practical skills assessments conducted on a date to be determined in western GTA.

· A $60.00 skills assessment fee payable to an independent third party will apply.

Recruitment phase four,

· Selected candidates to attend on-boarding on a date to be determined.

Qualified candidates should submit their résumé and covering letter with their email address prominently displayed on the letterhead by the indicated closing date by applying online at www.indeed.com/

Any application received after the deadline will not be considered for this competition.

Accessibility accommodations are available for all parts of the recruitment process and applicants must make their needs known in advance. First Response Ontario values a diverse workforce and the unique differences that each individual brings. We are dedicated to maintaining a fair and equitable work environment and welcome submissions from all qualified applicants.

Personal information submitted will be used for the purpose of determining suitability for this competition only. All applicants are thanked for their interest in this position, only those selected to advance will be contacted. If contacted, and you require a disability related accommodation to participate in the recruitment process you must notify the Recruiting Officer.

Job Types: Full-time, Fixed term contract
Contract length: 5 months

Salary: $475.00-$600.00 per day

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay

Benefits:

  • Discounted or free food

Schedule:

  • 12 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Holidays
  • On call

COVID-19 considerations:
The Ontario Government requires all Paramedics to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19, meaning minimum two doses of an approved vaccine.

Experience:

  • Paramedic employment or completed preceptorship: 1 year (required)

Licence/Certification:

  • Advanced Emergency Medical Care Attendant certificate (preferred)
  • Ontario F class Driver's Licence (preferred)
  • Ornge Aeromedical Theory certificate (preferred)

Application deadline: 2022-05-14

Show more

title: Driver
description:
Company Description


Our drivers have important missions everyday

Whatever division you join, you are a crucial part of our team. When we deliver parts, we are helping a parent be on time at the daycare, an ambulance get back on the road quickly or a truck deliver produce to a Canadian community on time. That is why we say we keep Canadians moving forward.

The impact our Drivers make is undeniable!

Join a special kind of workplace. We have the experience and strength of our 100-year legacy and the desire to always do better for our team members and clients. Our 5000 colleagues proudly serve thousands of customers every day across Canada.

Get to work with great people, use the company car, have a stable schedule, and foremost help your community.

If the hat fits, we’d be proud to have you wear it! Send us your resume and join a people-centric company with a reputation of excellence.


Job Description


NAPA/CMAX is looking for a full time Driver for its Ottawa East location.

Are you a car enthusiast looking for an exciting career opportunity? Get behind the wheel and deliver vehicle parts to our customers! Take pride in wearing our uniform and driving our vehicles as you work in a dynamic and stimulating environment.

Our drivers are courteous, efficient, safe, and organized. We insist that all our drivers be careful on the road. At NAPA your safety is our priority!

We offer a range of attractive benefits and corporate discounts, as well as training throughout your career to support and guide your professional development. Visit our Career website for the complete list of our benefits and perks!


#UAPOPERATIONS


Qualifications


To join our team, you need:

  • Valid driver’s license · One year of related work experience in automotive or heavy vehicle parts
  • Able to lift up to 50lbs.
  • Priority management
  • Communication and listening skills
  • Teamwork and excellent customer service skills

Additional Information


Your benefits along the way:

  • Flexible group insurance program: health, drug, dental and life
  • Pension plan
  • Corporate discounts at fitness centers, car dealerships, and on the purchase of parts
  • Tuition reimbursement under certain conditions
  • Payroll savings program
  • Access to the online training center
  • Work with great teammates who have the same passion as you

UAP is a diverse community that promotes inclusion and respect. The sum of our individual differences, experiences, knowledge, self-expression, unique capabilities, and talents, represents the richness of our culture. During the selection process, let us know if you need any accommodations. This information will be kept entirely confidential and will only be used to ensure you have a fair and pleasant experience with us

We will contact you as soon as possible if we think we have the hat for you!

Show more

Take pride in wearing our uniform and driving our vehicles as you work in a dynamic and stimulating environment.', 'Valid driver’s license · One year of related work experience in automotive or heavy vehicle parts', 'We offer a range of attractive benefits and corporate discounts, as well as training throughout your career to support and guide your professional development. Security and Safety

  • Bondable
  • Child abuse registry check
  • Driver's validity licence check
  • Driving record check (abstract)
  • Drug test
  • Criminal record check
  • Adult Abuse Registry

Own Tools/Equipment

  • Cellular phone

Transportation/Travel Information

  • Driver's abstract
  • Vehicle supplied by employer
  • Valid driver's licence

Work Conditions and Physical Capabilities

  • Fast-paced environment
  • Work under pressure
  • Sitting

Taxicab, Limousine Drivers and Chauffeurs' Skills

  • Record transactions
  • Provide basic tourist information
  • Operate two-way radios
  • Operate dispatch systems
  • Drive business or government personnel to and from destinations
  • Drive employers (including family members) to and from destination
  • Collect fare

  • Pick up passengers and drive them to destinations

Long term benefits

title: Ambulance Operator/Attendant
description:
Temporary Call-in (Relief)
Ambulance Operator
Rufus Guinchard Health Centre, Port Saunders, NL

Required Qualifications:
Completion high school, successful completion of Emergency Medical Responder certification with a Class 4 Driver's License, driver's abstract and current registration with the Newfoundland and Labrador Paramedicine Registrar and medical certification with the Office of the Provincial Medical Director are required.

Hours of Work: All shifts including days, evenings and nights; 3, 4, 5, 8 and 12 Hour shifts; Monday to Sunday
Salary Scale: $22.40 to $24.69 per Hour
Competition Number: WH-2022000023
Competition Closing Date: Until Filled
Recruiter Name: Martina Fequet

Western Health values diversity and is an equal opportunity employer.

A resume, proof of qualifications, and the names of two employment references are required. Applicants who do not provide the necessary documentation as outlined on this job posting will not be considered.

To apply, go to https://employment.westernhealth.nl.ca. If you are having issues when using eRecruit, please email erecruit@westernhealth.nl.ca.

Thank you for your interest with Western Health, however, only those applicants selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Patient Transfer Driver
description:
Patient Transfer Driver


We are seeking Drivers for our Patient Transfer Service to assist members of our communities transfer between medical facilities.


If you are looking for a career that you feel you could make a difference in, please read below!


Compensation Package:

A basic job, attracts basic pay – we believe that our crews should have the ability to increase their earnings if they wish - unlike many other employers, who ban / avoid higher paid overtime. Our compensation package includes hourly wage, an annual Bonus, the opportunity for overtime, and a Group Benefits and RRSP Program eligibility. There is a CPI pay review each year in January.

We are happy to show you the amounts our current crews ACTUALLY receive [ T4 Amount ] and the hours they spend on the job [anonymously of course].


Required:

  • Class 4 BC's Driver's License, with 5 years total driving experience
  • A Driver's Abstract with no more than 3 points
  • A current valid WSBC recognized First Aid qualification - Preferably OFA-III
  • Pass a Criminal Record Check to work with children and vulnerable adults
  • Vaccinations in accordance with the Immunization Policy for Health Care Workers
  • Both doses of the Covid vaccination

About Us:

We are the leading provider of non-emergency, patient transfers for medically stable patients throughout the Lower Mainland. Using our specially equipped fleet of Ambulances and Accessible vehicles, and ensuring they are transferred in a safe, compassionate and efficient manner.


Skills and Abilities:

  • Physically fit, ability to lift, push or pull 250+ lbs using a wheelchair, stretcher or stair chair with a partner.
  • Ability to effectively communicate - in English - verbally, non-verbally and in writing
  • A positive, can-do attitude, strong work ethic, and participation in what we do.
  • Demonstrated and relevant customer service experience, or experience working with patients.

What our patients / customers say about our crews :


  • Professional, courteous and really genuine people is all I have met during the 15 trips with this company over the last 2-1/2 months. ……. From the very first encounter with with Rob driving, and taking exceptional care of me & my wife......... I am so very impressed with the number of staff – Robin, Janet and so many others, who have been with you for many years. What shines through is that they really love what they are doing each day.”

All applicants will be required to complete a job application and participate in pre-employment testing.


We thank all those who apply, but only those selected for a prescreen interview will be contacted.

title: Emergency Medical Responder
description:
Your Opportunity:

As an Emergency Medical Responder (EMR), you will be a patient advocate who will effectively communicate and interact with community partners and allied healthcare professionals to ensure safe and proficient patient care and transportation. To fulfill your responsibilities, you will safely operate emergency vehicles, respond to medical and traumatic emergencies and inter-facility transport requests while adhering to professional standards, medical control protocols, standard operating procedures, polices and directives. This position is expected to work in all Edmonton Zone assignments which includes core flex work. This requisition will be used to fill multiple vacancies.

Description:

As an Emergency Medical Responder (EMR), you will transport ill or injured patients from scenes of emergency and/or between facilities. This includes operating ambulances or other modes of transportation; assessing emergency scenes and patients; providing simple treatments and completing required documentation including patient care reports. Alberta Health Services EMS requires the proof of the successful completion of the Functional Abilities Recruitment Evaluation (F.A.R.E.) test via the certificate provided by the Lifemark organization for all applicants external to AHS or internal to AHS, who do not already hold a clinical position within AHS EMS (VESST, Clinical Educator, EMR, PCP, ACP and Community Paramedic). Your F.A.R.E. test must be completed six (6) prior to the date of your application. Alberta Health Services EMS may verify results with Lifemark to ensure the candidate has successfully completed the test. Please contact Lifemark at www.lifemark.ca/alberta-health-services to find more information on the F.A.R.E. test and how to book your evaluation. You will assist with ensuring that ambulances or other Emergency Medical Services (EMS) vehicles, such as transfer vans, are properly stocked and equipped.

  • Classification: Emergency Medical Respond 2088
  • Union: HSAA Facility PROF/TECH
  • Department: Interfacility Srv Recipient Tr
  • Primary Location: InterFacility Transport EMS ED
  • Multi-Site: Not Applicable
  • FTE: 1.00
  • Posting End Date: 09-MAY-2022
  • Employee Class: Regular Full Time
  • Date Available: 23-MAY-2022
  • Hours per Shift: 8
  • Length of Shift in weeks: 8
  • Shifts per cycle: 40
  • Shift Pattern: Days, Evenings, Nights, Weekends
  • Days Off: As Per Rotation
  • Minimum Salary: $20.25
  • Maximum Salary: $23.67
  • Vehicle Requirement: Driver's License, Vehicle Provided
Required Qualifications:

Completion of an accredited Emergency Medical Responder or Primary Care Paramedic program. Active registration with Alberta College of Paramedics (ACP) as an Emergency Medical Responder. Current Basic Cardiac Life Support - Healthcare Provider (BCLS-HCP). Must hold a valid Class 4 Alberta Operator's Licence with no more than six (6) demerits. Completion of the Functional Abilities Recruitment Evaluation (F.A.R.E.) test taken no more than six (6) months prior to the application date.

Additional Required Qualifications:

Applications may be shared with AHS EMS recruitment teams from communities other than the one listed on this posting. Successful candidate must work collaboratively with a patient, their family and members of the patient’s healthcare team, consulting with other healthcare providers when necessary. Must act respectfully in a manner that upholds the patient, coworker and employers dignity, safety, privacy, confidentiality and decision-making; taking into account the patient, coworker and employers rights, needs, culture and environmental context. Must be available for orientation and mentorship. Must be available for short notice work opportunities.

Preferred Qualifications:

High school diploma or equivalent.

title: Horse Ambulance Driver
description:
Our rich history is a big part of who we are. With historic roots dating back over 135 years, Woodbine is steeped in tradition. We have been the engine that drives the Ontario horse racing industry. From King’s and Queen’s trips to Canada, anniversaries and unforgettable horse races, we have been creating winning experiences for all our guests.

We are currently on an amazing 20-year journey to ‘build a city within a city’ and transform the largest privately held land in Toronto into one of Canada’s premiere entertainment destinations. This journey will unlock the value of approximately 700 acres of land, leading to job creation and the revitalization of our communities, while enhancing our ability to share the thrill of horse-racing and cementing our place as an entertainment powerhouse.
We need dedicated people to join our cause. Be part of Woodbine Entertainment and get inspired to make work awesome!

Our Values & Beliefs
| WOW EVERY GUEST | OWN IT! | LISTEN & CONNECT – PEOPLE MATTER | FUEL THE FUN & PASS IT ON | TRUST IN OUR TEAM | #WE CARE | PURSUE YOUR POTENTIAL |BE BOLD| BE ALL IN |

Woodbine Entertainment is growing, and we are currently looking for a Horse Ambulance Driver who is customer-focused and committed to providing our guests with winning experiences!
This position will be responsible for loading injured horses onto the Horse Ambulance and transporting injured horses to the backstretch or hospital, or to preferred destination, using skill and caution in driving to avoid sudden motions detrimental to horses.

Our ideal candidate is going to have a strong passion to wow our guests, great communication skills, a friendly and outgoing attitude, be able to work in a fast-paced environment and be willing to maximize their potential. At Woodbine, the opportunities are endless, so come join a company that makes work awesome!


Key Success Factors

  • Experience handling horses
  • Ability to deal with problems involving a few concrete variables in standardized situations
  • Have a minimum “G” class driver’s license
  • Possess or be able to obtain an AGCO License
  • Must be able to lift and/or move more than 100 pounds
Guided by our Values and Beliefs, Woodbine Entertainment commits to providing an authentic and empowering work experience! Please reach out if you're ready to embrace change and be part of a new breed of experience while working for one of Canada’s certified Great Places to Work!
Show more
