title: Primary Care Paramedic
description:
We are seeking Primary Care Paramedics (EMT/PCP) to join our team as occupational paramedics for upcoming camp based positions in the Northwest Territories.

As an EMT/PCP your main role on site will be to provide emergency response to crews in the event of injury, illness, or emergency situation.

General Responsibilities:

Determine the nature and extent of illness or injury to establish care procedures

Administer pre-hospital first-aid treatment and emergency care at site of emergency, or in specially equipped vehicle.

Establish and maintain IV treatment, apply adjunctive equipment for ventilation and circulation complications, administer medications.

Collect and maintain pertinent and confidential patient medical information and maintain detailed records of the nature of injuries/illnesses and treatment provided.

Communicate with medical personnel at emergency treatment facilities and assist medevac personnel with provision of medical treatment as necessary.

Maintain ambulances and emergency care equipment and supplies

Perform nasopharyngeal swabs for covid-19 testing

Qualifications:

Valid, unrestricted EMT/PCP certificate with current CPR certificate

Previous experience as an EMT/PCP (industrial experience an asset but not required)

Effective communication, problem-solving, and decision-making skills

Ability to stay calm and collected in stressful and emergency situations

Ability to maintain positive, professional relations with a wide range of individuals

Be comfortable working long hours for many consecutive days

Be extremely safety conscious

Possess a reasonable level of fitness Valid Class 4 or 5 driver's license.

62 Degrees North is an equal opportunity employer. We provide competitive salaries and a supportive work environment. Depending on the work location transportation to and from site, meals, and accommodations could be provided.

Are you an experienced medical professional seeking rewarding work? Apply today.

Job Type: Contract

Job Types: Full-time, Fly-In/Fly-Out

Additional pay:

  • Overtime pay

Schedule:

  • 12 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Night shift

Application question(s):

  • Are you legally entitled to work in Canada?

Work remotely:

  • No

title: Primary Care Paramedic, Special Teams
description:
Position Title: Paramedicine Practitioner (formerly Primary Care Paramedic), Fire Ranger Emergency Medical Team

Location: Ontario-wide, deploys out of Barrie and Thunder Bay

Reports To: Superintendent

Employment Type: Temporary contract

Posting Date: 01-May-2022

Closing Date: 14-May-2022, 17:00 EDT

Schedule: Rotating weekly on-call schedule, with potential deployment to anywhere in Ontario to a maximum of 14 days, plus pick-up opportunities

Pay scale: On-call: $100-150/week; when on deployment: $475-$600/day

Qualifications

1. Required to apply:

Must meet all qualifications as outlined in O. Reg. 257/00 PART III including, but not limited to:

1.1. Possess a diploma in Paramedicine.

1.2. A-EMCA certified by the Ministry of Health.

1.3. Current BLS level CPR (formerly HCP)

2. Achieve by start date:

2.1. Incident Management System – IMS 100 certificate of completion (https://training.emergencymanagementontario.ca/TPOnline/TPOnline.dll/EMO_Public_Course/COURSENO=COUR2011070415145004500149)

2.2. Possess Ornge Aeromedical Theory certificate, or anticipated certification (https://www.ornge.ca/about-us/programs/aeromedical-theory)

2.3. Possess Aeromedical Theory certificate from Ministry of health, or proof of registration for examination within 210 days of start of employment.

3. Ability to achieve certification under FRO’s controlled medical acts delegation program.

4. Possess physical abilities certificate from OPPAT, Ability Work, Sibley’s, or equivalent issued within last six months.

5. Ability to exert heavy physical effort required to treat and move patients, sometimes over rugged terrain, deliver medical equipment or sort inventory at health centre, station, and in a vehicle.

6. Good knowledge and application of BLS/ALS Patient Care Standards, related Acts and Regulations, policies and procedures.

7. Ability to effectively communicate with team members, allied agencies, and make justifiable decisions in an emergency.

8. Ability to work independently under stressful situations and exercise sound judgement in an emergency environment.

9. Ability to identify patient treatment needs through adequate assessment and provide appropriate care in accordance with the Basic Life Support Standards and medical delegation policies.

10. Demonstrate competency when using basic computer software such as reporting systems, inventory, email, and word processing.

11. Excellent use of verbal and written English.

12. Satisfactory health, attendance, and former employment history.

13. Criminal Record check free of crimes of moral turpitude.

14. Must possess fully functional smartphone with active data plan.

15. May require the use of a personal or company vehicle while FRO business. Must be physically capable of operating a vehicle safely for long periods of time, must hold and maintain a driver's licence that authorizes the person to drive an ambulance, have an acceptable driving record, and personal insurance coverage. Prior commercial driving experience an asset.

Duties

1. While on-call, be ready to respond in FRO Emergency Response Vehicle to any area of the province of Ontario within 48 hours and remain deployed in potentially remote camp environment for up to 14 days. Travel, accommodation, and meals provided.

2. Provide emergency medical care to ill/injured people while ensuring the safe, timely, and appropriate extrication of ill/injured persons via emergency response vehicle or rotor-wing aircraft to land/air ambulance rendezvous sites or medical treatment facilities where circumstances dictate.

3. Perform emergency medical care and controlled acts under the direction of the Medical Director, and in accordance with the patient care standards and procedures set out by FRO, Ministry of Health, Ministry of Natural Resources and Forestry, legislation, and regulations.

4. Respond to emergencies in all weather conditions, in a safe and secure manner, in accordance with the Highway Traffic Act and the applicable policies and procedures.

5. Maintain contact and comply with direction from Superintendent and/or Incident Command at all times regarding vehicle movements, status of equipment, call assignments and the transportation of patients to medical facilities or required destination.

6. Complete, in a timely manner, all required patient and administrative documentation specified in the Ambulance Act, Regulations, standards, company and client policies and practices, including Paramedic Call Report forms. Ensure safekeeping of patient records.

7. Liaise with CACC, families, client staff, police, fire and other health professionals/agencies to ensure relevant patient information is collected.

8. Inspect all equipment at the start and throughout the shift to ensure they are in proper working order, and in a clean and sanitary condition. Carry out housekeeping duties within the medical centre and paramedic vehicles, ensuring the areas are maintained in a clean, sanitary condition.

9. Participate in mandatory training programs, continuing medical education programs, quality assurance programs and company training programs, as required.

10. Perform other related duties as may be required.

Recruitment Process

Candidates selected to proceed will be contacted by email.

Recruitment phase two,

· Selected candidates will be invited to book a video interview on a date to be determined. Successful candidates will be invited to phase three.

Recruitment phase three,

· Selected candidates will be invited to participate in practical skills assessments conducted on a date to be determined in western GTA.

· A $60.00 skills assessment fee payable to an independent third party will apply.

Recruitment phase four,

· Selected candidates to attend on-boarding on a date to be determined.

Qualified candidates should submit their résumé and covering letter with their email address prominently displayed on the letterhead by the indicated closing date by applying online at www.indeed.com/

Any application received after the deadline will not be considered for this competition.

Accessibility accommodations are available for all parts of the recruitment process and applicants must make their needs known in advance. First Response Ontario values a diverse workforce and the unique differences that each individual brings. We are dedicated to maintaining a fair and equitable work environment and welcome submissions from all qualified applicants.

Personal information submitted will be used for the purpose of determining suitability for this competition only. All applicants are thanked for their interest in this position, only those selected to advance will be contacted. If contacted, and you require a disability related accommodation to participate in the recruitment process you must notify the Recruiting Officer.

Job Types: Full-time, Fixed term contract
Contract length: 5 months

Salary: $475.00-$600.00 per day

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay

Benefits:

  • Discounted or free food

Schedule:

  • 12 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Holidays
  • On call

COVID-19 considerations:
The Ontario Government requires all Paramedics to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19, meaning minimum two doses of an approved vaccine.

Experience:

  • Paramedic employment or completed preceptorship: 1 year (required)

Licence/Certification:

  • Advanced Emergency Medical Care Attendant certificate (preferred)
  • Ontario F class Driver's Licence (preferred)
  • Ornge Aeromedical Theory certificate (preferred)

Application deadline: 2022-05-14

title: Driver
description:
Company Description


Our drivers have important missions everyday

Whatever division you join, you are a crucial part of our team. When we deliver parts, we are helping a parent be on time at the daycare, an ambulance get back on the road quickly or a truck deliver produce to a Canadian community on time. That is why we say we keep Canadians moving forward.

The impact our Drivers make is undeniable!

Join a special kind of workplace. We have the experience and strength of our 100-year legacy and the desire to always do better for our team members and clients. Our 5000 colleagues proudly serve thousands of customers every day across Canada.

Get to work with great people, use the company car, have a stable schedule, and foremost help your community.

If the hat fits, we’d be proud to have you wear it! Send us your resume and join a people-centric company with a reputation of excellence.


Job Description


NAPA/CMAX is looking for a full time Driver for its Ottawa East location.

Are you a car enthusiast looking for an exciting career opportunity? Get behind the wheel and deliver vehicle parts to our customers! Take pride in wearing our uniform and driving our vehicles as you work in a dynamic and stimulating environment.

Our drivers are courteous, efficient, safe, and organized. We insist that all our drivers be careful on the road. At NAPA your safety is our priority!

We offer a range of attractive benefits and corporate discounts, as well as training throughout your career to support and guide your professional development. Visit our Career website for the complete list of our benefits and perks!


#UAPOPERATIONS


Qualifications


To join our team, you need:

  • Valid driver’s license · One year of related work experience in automotive or heavy vehicle parts
  • Able to lift up to 50lbs.
  • Priority management
  • Communication and listening skills
  • Teamwork and excellent customer service skills

Additional Information


Your benefits along the way:

  • Flexible group insurance program: health, drug, dental and life
  • Pension plan
  • Corporate discounts at fitness centers, car dealerships, and on the purchase of parts
  • Tuition reimbursement under certain conditions
  • Payroll savings program
  • Access to the online training center
  • Work with great teammates who have the same passion as you

UAP is a diverse community that promotes inclusion and respect. The sum of our individual differences, experiences, knowledge, self-expression, unique capabilities, and talents, represents the richness of our culture. During the selection process, let us know if you need any accommodations. This information will be kept entirely confidential and will only be used to ensure you have a fair and pleasant experience with us

We will contact you as soon as possible if we think we have the hat for you!

title: Patient Transfer Driver
description:
Patient Transfer Driver


We are seeking Drivers for our Patient Transfer Service to assist members of our communities transfer between medical facilities.


If you are looking for a career that you feel you could make a difference in, please read below!


Compensation Package:

A basic job, attracts basic pay – we believe that our crews should have the ability to increase their earnings if they wish - unlike many other employers, who ban / avoid higher paid overtime. Our compensation package includes hourly wage, an annual Bonus, the opportunity for overtime, and a Group Benefits and RRSP Program eligibility. There is a CPI pay review each year in January.

We are happy to show you the amounts our current crews ACTUALLY receive [ T4 Amount ] and the hours they spend on the job [anonymously of course].


Required:

  • Class 4 BC's Driver's License, with 5 years total driving experience
  • A Driver's Abstract with no more than 3 points
  • A current valid WSBC recognized First Aid qualification - Preferably OFA-III
  • Pass a Criminal Record Check to work with children and vulnerable adults
  • Vaccinations in accordance with the Immunization Policy for Health Care Workers
  • Both doses of the Covid vaccination

About Us:

We are the leading provider of non-emergency, patient transfers for medically stable patients throughout the Lower Mainland. Using our specially equipped fleet of Ambulances and Accessible vehicles, and ensuring they are transferred in a safe, compassionate and efficient manner.


Skills and Abilities:

  • Physically fit, ability to lift, push or pull 250+ lbs using a wheelchair, stretcher or stair chair with a partner.
  • Ability to effectively communicate - in English - verbally, non-verbally and in writing
  • A positive, can-do attitude, strong work ethic, and participation in what we do.
  • Demonstrated and relevant customer service experience, or experience working with patients.

What our patients / customers say about our crews :


  • Professional, courteous and really genuine people is all I have met during the 15 trips with this company over the last 2-1/2 months. ……. From the very first encounter with with Rob driving, and taking exceptional care of me & my wife......... I am so very impressed with the number of staff – Robin, Janet and so many others, who have been with you for many years. What shines through is that they really love what they are doing each day.”

All applicants will be required to complete a job application and participate in pre-employment testing.


We thank all those who apply, but only those selected for a prescreen interview will be contacted.

title: Emergency Medical Responder
description:
Your Opportunity:

As an Emergency Medical Responder (EMR), you will be a patient advocate who will effectively communicate and interact with community partners and allied healthcare professionals to ensure safe and proficient patient care and transportation. To fulfill your responsibilities, you will safely operate emergency vehicles, respond to medical and traumatic emergencies and inter-facility transport requests while adhering to professional standards, medical control protocols, standard operating procedures, polices and directives. This position is expected to work in all Edmonton Zone assignments which includes core flex work. This requisition will be used to fill multiple vacancies.

Description:

As an Emergency Medical Responder (EMR), you will transport ill or injured patients from scenes of emergency and/or between facilities. This includes operating ambulances or other modes of transportation; assessing emergency scenes and patients; providing simple treatments and completing required documentation including patient care reports. Alberta Health Services EMS requires the proof of the successful completion of the Functional Abilities Recruitment Evaluation (F.A.R.E.) test via the certificate provided by the Lifemark organization for all applicants external to AHS or internal to AHS, who do not already hold a clinical position within AHS EMS (VESST, Clinical Educator, EMR, PCP, ACP and Community Paramedic). Your F.A.R.E. test must be completed six (6) prior to the date of your application. Alberta Health Services EMS may verify results with Lifemark to ensure the candidate has successfully completed the test. Please contact Lifemark at www.lifemark.ca/alberta-health-services to find more information on the F.A.R.E. test and how to book your evaluation. You will assist with ensuring that ambulances or other Emergency Medical Services (EMS) vehicles, such as transfer vans, are properly stocked and equipped.

  • Classification: Emergency Medical Respond 2088
  • Union: HSAA Facility PROF/TECH
  • Department: Interfacility Srv Recipient Tr
  • Primary Location: InterFacility Transport EMS ED
  • Multi-Site: Not Applicable
  • FTE: 1.00
  • Posting End Date: 09-MAY-2022
  • Employee Class: Regular Full Time
  • Date Available: 23-MAY-2022
  • Hours per Shift: 8
  • Length of Shift in weeks: 8
  • Shifts per cycle: 40
  • Shift Pattern: Days, Evenings, Nights, Weekends
  • Days Off: As Per Rotation
  • Minimum Salary: $20.25
  • Maximum Salary: $23.67
  • Vehicle Requirement: Driver's License, Vehicle Provided
Required Qualifications:

Completion of an accredited Emergency Medical Responder or Primary Care Paramedic program. Active registration with Alberta College of Paramedics (ACP) as an Emergency Medical Responder. Current Basic Cardiac Life Support - Healthcare Provider (BCLS-HCP). Must hold a valid Class 4 Alberta Operator's Licence with no more than six (6) demerits. Completion of the Functional Abilities Recruitment Evaluation (F.A.R.E.) test taken no more than six (6) months prior to the application date.

Additional Required Qualifications:

Applications may be shared with AHS EMS recruitment teams from communities other than the one listed on this posting. Successful candidate must work collaboratively with a patient, their family and members of the patient’s healthcare team, consulting with other healthcare providers when necessary. Must act respectfully in a manner that upholds the patient, coworker and employers dignity, safety, privacy, confidentiality and decision-making; taking into account the patient, coworker and employers rights, needs, culture and environmental context. Must be available for orientation and mentorship. Must be available for short notice work opportunities.

Preferred Qualifications:

High school diploma or equivalent.

title: Horse Ambulance Driver
description:
Our rich history is a big part of who we are. With historic roots dating back over 135 years, Woodbine is steeped in tradition. We have been the engine that drives the Ontario horse racing industry. From King’s and Queen’s trips to Canada, anniversaries and unforgettable horse races, we have been creating winning experiences for all our guests.

We are currently on an amazing 20-year journey to ‘build a city within a city’ and transform the largest privately held land in Toronto into one of Canada’s premiere entertainment destinations. This journey will unlock the value of approximately 700 acres of land, leading to job creation and the revitalization of our communities, while enhancing our ability to share the thrill of horse-racing and cementing our place as an entertainment powerhouse.
We need dedicated people to join our cause. Be part of Woodbine Entertainment and get inspired to make work awesome!

Our Values & Beliefs
| WOW EVERY GUEST | OWN IT! | LISTEN & CONNECT – PEOPLE MATTER | FUEL THE FUN & PASS IT ON | TRUST IN OUR TEAM | #WE CARE | PURSUE YOUR POTENTIAL |BE BOLD| BE ALL IN |

Woodbine Entertainment is growing, and we are currently looking for a Horse Ambulance Driver who is customer-focused and committed to providing our guests with winning experiences!
This position will be responsible for loading injured horses onto the Horse Ambulance and transporting injured horses to the backstretch or hospital, or to preferred destination, using skill and caution in driving to avoid sudden motions detrimental to horses.

Our ideal candidate is going to have a strong passion to wow our guests, great communication skills, a friendly and outgoing attitude, be able to work in a fast-paced environment and be willing to maximize their potential. At Woodbine, the opportunities are endless, so come join a company that makes work awesome!


Key Success Factors

  • Experience handling horses
  • Ability to deal with problems involving a few concrete variables in standardized situations
  • Have a minimum “G” class driver’s license
  • Possess or be able to obtain an AGCO License
  • Must be able to lift and/or move more than 100 pounds
Guided by our Values and Beliefs, Woodbine Entertainment commits to providing an authentic and empowering work experience! Please reach out if you're ready to embrace change and be part of a new breed of experience while working for one of Canada’s certified Great Places to Work!

#UAPCentral

title: Primary Care Paramedic
description:
We are seeking Primary Care Paramedics (EMT/PCP) to join our team as occupational paramedics for upcoming camp based positions in the Northwest Territories.

As an EMT/PCP your main role on site will be to provide emergency response to crews in the event of injury, illness, or emergency situation.

General Responsibilities:

Determine the nature and extent of illness or injury to establish care procedures

Administer pre-hospital first-aid treatment and emergency care at site of emergency, or in specially equipped vehicle.

Establish and maintain IV treatment, apply adjunctive equipment for ventilation and circulation complications, administer medications.

Collect and maintain pertinent and confidential patient medical information and maintain detailed records of the nature of injuries/illnesses and treatment provided.

Communicate with medical personnel at emergency treatment facilities and assist medevac personnel with provision of medical treatment as necessary.

Maintain ambulances and emergency care equipment and supplies

Perform nasopharyngeal swabs for covid-19 testing

Qualifications:

Valid, unrestricted EMT/PCP certificate with current CPR certificate

Previous experience as an EMT/PCP (industrial experience an asset but not required)

Effective communication, problem-solving, and decision-making skills

Ability to stay calm and collected in stressful and emergency situations

Ability to maintain positive, professional relations with a wide range of individuals

Be comfortable working long hours for many consecutive days

Be extremely safety conscious

Possess a reasonable level of fitness Valid Class 4 or 5 driver's license.

62 Degrees North is an equal opportunity employer. We provide competitive salaries and a supportive work environment. Depending on the work location transportation to and from site, meals, and accommodations could be provided.

Are you an experienced medical professional seeking rewarding work? Apply today.

Job Type: Contract

Job Types: Full-time, Fly-In/Fly-Out

Additional pay:

  • Overtime pay

Schedule:

  • 12 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Night shift

Application question(s):

  • Are you legally entitled to work in Canada?

Work remotely:

  • No

title: EMT / Site Administrator
description:
The Nuna Group of Companies is now accepting resumes for an Emergency Medical Professional to work at our fly-in, fly-out, site based in Nunavut. This role will also be responsible with assisting with site administrative duties. At a minimum EMT designation is required, but a PCP (Primary Care Paramedic) designation or higher is preferred. Nuna is the largest Inuit-owned heavy civil construction, earthworks, and mine construction contractor in Canada.
Requirements:
  • Current EMT-A or PCP registration,
  • Minimum of 3 years of previous camp experience in a remote mining/construction setting,
  • Physical ability to lift > 50lbs for short durations,
  • Capable of working independently in a fast-paced environment with good safety awareness,
  • Strong team player, with experience in cross cultural work environments,
  • Ability to effectively communicate through speech,
  • Good organization and problem-solving skills,
  • Experience with trucking dispatch an asset,
  • Experience with radio communications and protocols,
  • Advanced computer skills,
  • Accurate data entry skills.
Medical Responsibilities include, but not limited to:
  • Administering first-aid treatment and life-support care to sick or injured persons in a remote camp setting,
  • Operating equipment such as external defibrillators and bag-valve mask resuscitators in advanced life-support environments,
  • Assessing the nature and extent of illness or injury to establish and prioritize medical procedures,
  • Observing, recording, and reporting to the physician the patient's condition or injury, the treatment provided, and reactions to drugs and treatment,
  • Administering drugs, orally or by injection, and performing intravenous procedures under a physician's direction,
  • Immobilizing patient for transportation on stretcher for ambulance/aircraft/marine transport, using backboard or other spinal immobilization device,
  • Coordinating with local treatment centers and providing patients' vital statistics and medical history, to determine the circumstances of the emergency, and to administer emergency treatment,
  • Comforting and reassuring patients,
  • Maintaining medical vehicle and medical and communication equipment, and replenishing first-aid equipment and supplies.
Site Administrative Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
  • Compiling accurate and timely daily/weekly reports,
  • Collecting and reviewing employee timesheets on a daily basis ensuring all fields are completed correctly,
  • Informing the Project Manager/Superintendent of any discrepancies found upon daily review of employee timesheets,
  • Accurately entering data from employee timesheets,
  • Monitoring and entering material chargebacks into the database from invoices,
  • Compiling reports produced from entries into the database for signed approval from the Superintendent and designated client representative,
  • Maintaining any required filing to support the database,
  • Maintaining cross shift notes to keep cross shift informed and up to date of work activities that have transpired with the cross shift has been on days off,
  • Reviewing on a timely basis with Operations Office – any work activities transpiring on site affecting invoicing/billing (ex. change to client work codes, labour and equipment rates, equipment movement, new subcontractors onsite,
  • Managing confidential employee information and keep information locked in a secure area,
  • Providing administrative assistance with regards to employee forms, documents, and benefits,
  • Assisting with travel arrangements for personal from point of hire to work location and return,
  • Management of rotation schedules and assessment of personal requirements,
  • Other administrative duties as required.



Work will be primarily outdoors in various weather conditions.
Pre-access clearances are required
All successful candidates must:
  • Be proficient in English, both verbally and written
  • Have a valid Class 5 Driver's License
  • Have experience as requested in the job description above.
Nuna is committed to the principle of employment equity. We welcome diversity and encourage all who are qualified to express their interest.
Interested applicants are asked to apply online at: http://nunalogistics.com/jobs.html
Or by email: hr@nunalogistics.com
We thank all who apply but only those selected for interviews will be contacted.
Nuna is a highly regarded civil construction company with hundreds of employees working across the Arctic and Northern Canada. Working often in remote locations, Nuna offers unique on-the-job experience and opportunity to build an exciting career. Our multi-disciplined teams provide a comprehensive array of services and innovative solutions to the most challenging and remote sites in northern Canada. Nuna's core values of: Safety - Integrity - Teamwork - Respect for Cultural Diversity and for Community & Environment; reflect our reputation as a safe, cost-effective, and innovative operator in the north.
Show more

title: Patient Transfer Driver
description:
Patient Transfer Driver


We are seeking Drivers for our Patient Transfer Service to assist members of our communities transfer between medical facilities.


If you are looking for a career that you feel you could make a difference in, please read below!


Compensation Package:

A basic job, attracts basic pay – we believe that our crews should have the ability to increase their earnings if they wish - unlike many other employers, who ban / avoid higher paid overtime. Our compensation package includes hourly wage, an annual Bonus, the opportunity for overtime, and a Group Benefits and RRSP Program eligibility. There is a CPI pay review each year in January.

We are happy to show you the amounts our current crews ACTUALLY receive [ T4 Amount ] and the hours they spend on the job [anonymously of course].


Required:

  • Class 4 BC's Driver's License, with 5 years total driving experience
  • A Driver's Abstract with no more than 3 points
  • A current valid WSBC recognized First Aid qualification - Preferably OFA-III
  • Pass a Criminal Record Check to work with children and vulnerable adults
  • Vaccinations in accordance with the Immunization Policy for Health Care Workers
  • Both doses of the Covid vaccination

About Us:

We are the leading provider of non-emergency, patient transfers for medically stable patients throughout the Lower Mainland. Using our specially equipped fleet of Ambulances and Accessible vehicles, and ensuring they are transferred in a safe, compassionate and efficient manner.


Skills and Abilities:

  • Physically fit, ability to lift, push or pull 250+ lbs using a wheelchair, stretcher or stair chair with a partner.
  • Ability to effectively communicate - in English - verbally, non-verbally and in writing
  • A positive, can-do attitude, strong work ethic, and participation in what we do.
  • Demonstrated and relevant customer service experience, or experience working with patients.

What our patients / customers say about our crews :


  • Professional, courteous and really genuine people is all I have met during the 15 trips with this company over the last 2-1/2 months. ……. From the very first encounter with with Rob driving, and taking exceptional care of me & my wife......... I am so very impressed with the number of staff – Robin, Janet and so many others, who have been with you for many years. What shines through is that they really love what they are doing each day.”

All applicants will be required to complete a job application and participate in pre-employment testing.


We thank all those who apply, but only those selected for a prescreen interview will be contacted.

title: Emergency Medical Responder
description:
Your Opportunity:

As an Emergency Medical Responder (EMR), you will be a patient advocate who will effectively communicate and interact with community partners and allied healthcare professionals to ensure safe and proficient patient care and transportation. To fulfill your responsibilities, you will safely operate emergency vehicles, respond to medical and traumatic emergencies and inter-facility transport requests while adhering to professional standards, medical control protocols, standard operating procedures, polices and directives. This position is expected to work in all Edmonton Zone assignments which includes core flex work. This requisition will be used to fill multiple vacancies.

Description:

As an Emergency Medical Responder (EMR), you will transport ill or injured patients from scenes of emergency and/or between facilities. This includes operating ambulances or other modes of transportation; assessing emergency scenes and patients; providing simple treatments and completing required documentation including patient care reports. Alberta Health Services EMS requires the proof of the successful completion of the Functional Abilities Recruitment Evaluation (F.A.R.E.) test via the certificate provided by the Lifemark organization for all applicants external to AHS or internal to AHS, who do not already hold a clinical position within AHS EMS (VESST, Clinical Educator, EMR, PCP, ACP and Community Paramedic). Your F.A.R.E. test must be completed six (6) prior to the date of your application. Alberta Health Services EMS may verify results with Lifemark to ensure the candidate has successfully completed the test. Please contact Lifemark at www.lifemark.ca/alberta-health-services to find more information on the F.A.R.E. test and how to book your evaluation. You will assist with ensuring that ambulances or other Emergency Medical Services (EMS) vehicles, such as transfer vans, are properly stocked and equipped.

  • Classification: Emergency Medical Respond 2088
  • Union: HSAA Facility PROF/TECH
  • Department: Interfacility Srv Recipient Tr
  • Primary Location: InterFacility Transport EMS ED
  • Multi-Site: Not Applicable
  • FTE: 1.00
  • Posting End Date: 09-MAY-2022
  • Employee Class: Regular Full Time
  • Date Available: 23-MAY-2022
  • Hours per Shift: 8
  • Length of Shift in weeks: 8
  • Shifts per cycle: 40
  • Shift Pattern: Days, Evenings, Nights, Weekends
  • Days Off: As Per Rotation
  • Minimum Salary: $20.25
  • Maximum Salary: $23.67
  • Vehicle Requirement: Driver's License, Vehicle Provided
Required Qualifications:

Completion of an accredited Emergency Medical Responder or Primary Care Paramedic program. Active registration with Alberta College of Paramedics (ACP) as an Emergency Medical Responder. Current Basic Cardiac Life Support - Healthcare Provider (BCLS-HCP). Must hold a valid Class 4 Alberta Operator's Licence with no more than six (6) demerits. Completion of the Functional Abilities Recruitment Evaluation (F.A.R.E.) test taken no more than six (6) months prior to the application date.

Additional Required Qualifications:

Applications may be shared with AHS EMS recruitment teams from communities other than the one listed on this posting. Successful candidate must work collaboratively with a patient, their family and members of the patient’s healthcare team, consulting with other healthcare providers when necessary. Must act respectfully in a manner that upholds the patient, coworker and employers dignity, safety, privacy, confidentiality and decision-making; taking into account the patient, coworker and employers rights, needs, culture and environmental context. Must be available for orientation and mentorship. Must be available for short notice work opportunities.

Preferred Qualifications:

High school diploma or equivalent.

title: Driver
description:
Company Description

Our drivers have important missions everyday

Whatever division you join, you are a crucial part of our team. When we deliver parts, we are helping a parent be on time at the daycare, an ambulance get back on the road quickly or a truck deliver produce to a Canadian community on time. That is why we say we keep Canadians moving forward.

The impact our Drivers make is undeniable!

Join a special kind of workplace. We have the experience and strength of our 100-year legacy and the desire to always do better for our team members and clients. Our 5000 colleagues proudly serve thousands of customers every day across Canada.

Get to work with great people, use the company car, have a stable schedule, and foremost help your community.

If the hat fits, we’d be proud to have you wear it! Send us your resume and join a people-centric company with a reputation of excellence.

Job Description

NAPA Torbay is looking for a full time Driver

Are you a car enthusiast looking for an exciting career opportunity? Get behind the wheel and deliver vehicle parts to our customers! Take pride in wearing our uniform and driving our vehicles as you work in a dynamic and stimulating environment.  

Our drivers are courteous, efficient, safe, and organized. We insist that all our drivers be careful on the road. At NAPA, your safety is our priority! 

We offer a range of attractive benefits and corporate discounts, as well as training throughout your career to support and guide your professional development. Visit our Career website for the complete list of our benefits and perks! 

Qualifications

To join our team, you need: 

  • Valid driver’s license · One year of related work experience in automotive or heavy vehicle parts 
  • Able to lift up to 50lbs. 
  • Priority management  
  • Communication and listening skills 
  • Teamwork and excellent customer service skills 


Additional Information

Your benefits along the way:

  • Flexible group insurance program: health, drug, dental and life
  • Pension plan
  • Corporate discounts on the purchase of parts, car dealerships and at fitness centers
  • Tuition reimbursement under certain conditions
  • Payroll savings program
  • Access to the online training center
  • Work with great teammates who have the same passion as you

UAP is a diverse community that promotes inclusion and respect. The sum of our individual differences, experiences, knowledge, self-expression, unique capabilities, and talents, represents the richness of our culture. During the selection process, let us know if you need any accommodations. This information will be kept entirely confidential and will only be used to ensure you have a fair and pleasant experience with us

We will contact you as soon as possible if we think we have the hat for you!

title: Driver (Part-Time)
description:
1-800-GOT-JUNK? is hiring immediately for Truck Team Members. We are proud to be the leaders of our industry and to offer great people employment opportunities that help them grow and develop.

Truck Team Member - General Labour, Driver & Customer Service
Part-time or Casual at our Nanaimo office!
  • Flexible Hours: Various shifts are available. We operate Mon-Sun from 7 am - 6 pm and offer compressed workweeks (F/T hours in 4 days).
  • Starting pay: $18-$22/hr (base wage, profit share, tips, all in)
With 1-800-GOT-JUNK?, each day is different from the next. You’ll be matched up with team members and travel around to different areas of the city in our awesome shiny blue trucks! You'll visit our customers’ homes or businesses to provide "No Contact Junk Removal Services" and take away their unwanted items. We are committed to being environmentally friendly by recycling, donating and other options for keeping as much out of landfills as possible.

Plus fun perks like free breakfasts every morning! Plus dinners and work events!

Qualifications:
  • 21+ years of age (for insurance purposes)
  • A valid standard driver's license and clean driving record (past 3 years)
  • Available 1 day over the weekends
  • Reliable, hard-working, and a great attitude!
  • Previous customer service, labor, or sales experience an asset (but not required)
  • Able to lift 50lbs repeatedly
We have positions available immediately. We contact all qualified applicants within 2-business days for an interview. Successful candidates are offered employment within 24-hours of the interview and can start this or next week (or a future date if that’s more convenient). Apply today and look to hear from us - we move fast!
Backgrounds we look for:
  • Delivery Driver
  • Truck Driver
  • Delivery Driver
  • Construction
  • Moving
  • Demolition
  • General Labor
  • Warehouse worker
  • Service Industry: Grocery stores, Retail, Restaurants, Hotels

title: Driver
description:
Overview:

Whatâ€™s the difference between a job and a meaningful, rewarding career? The people you serve. When you work at Atria, you have a front-row seat to the amazing life stories of the wisest people on earth. Whatâ€™s more, you are part of an extraordinary company â€“ one thatâ€™s investing in the future of senior living by investing in you. Donâ€™t just do a job. Be part of an extraordinary life.

 

Atria is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing equal employment opportunities without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, age, national origin, disability, genetic information, veteran status, or any other classification protected by applicable law.  Atria will not tolerate harassment or discrimination based on any of these protected classifications.

Responsibilities:

Responsible for providing safe, courteous transportation service and serve as support staff for the Engage Life Director or Maintenance Director. Coordinates vehicle pre-maintenance, maintenance, and repair to ensure vehicle longevity.

  • Drive vehicle from community to social and other various destinations according to assigned schedule.
  • Assist residents into and out of vehicle in a safe manner.
  • Secure passengers' wheelchairs to restraining devices to stabilize wheelchairs during trip.
  • Practice safe driving techniques at all times.
  • Clean and service vehicle with fuel, lubricants, and accessories and report and coordinate vehicle maintenance repairs.
  • Establish and monitor daily and weekly trip inspection and preventative maintenance programs, as well as maintain records regarding the maintenance of all vehicles.
  • Deliver groceries and other belongings to residentâ€™s apartments.
  • Assist the Engage Life Department in activities and programs as needed.
  • Ensure charges are submitted to the business office daily for community travel expenses.
  • Maintain a safe driving record according to Company guidelines.
  • Handle emergency situations and basic First Aid.
  • Report potentially unsafe conditions to the Executive Director.
  • May perform other duties as needed and/or assigned.
Qualifications:
  • High school diploma or general education degree (GED); or one (1) to three (3) months of related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
  • Five (5) or more years of driving experience and knowledge of vehicle preventative maintenance programs.
  • Commercial driver's license required to operate commercial size vehicles.
  • Able to operate a seven (7) to sixteen (16) passenger bus, unless otherwise required by Atria or state law. Able to operate a limousine or car, tire changing equipment, First Aid Kit, wheelchair lift, and dollies/hand trucks.
  • Experienced with vehicle emergency repairs, able to change automobile tires and handle minor on-road maintenance.
  • Knowledgeable of all streets within an 8-mile radius of the community.
  • Position requires driving responsibilities (may use Company provided vehicle and/or personal vehicle).
  • Must satisfactorily meet and be in compliance with Atriaâ€™s Motor Vehicle Record Policy standards.
  • Must have or be willing to get a COVID-19 vaccine, subject to legal requirements.

Driver, Transportation, Chauffeur, Motorist, Vehicle Operator, Automobilist, Drivers, Bus

title: Driver (Shredding/Recycling)
description:
ABOUT US:
Established in 1956, BEST is a Canadian janitorial company that aims to create a cleaner world by focusing on communities' social, environmental, and economic impact. We have been recognized by Deloitte as one of Canadaâ€™s Best Managed Companies and by Waterstone Human Capital as one of Canadaâ€™s 10 Most Admired Corporate Cultures.

When you join the BEST team, youâ€™ll enjoy:

  • Flexible and hybrid work schedules for head office positions
  • Competitive wages and benefits packages
  • An excellent company culture, with access to educational grants and regular team events and celebrations
  • Employee recognition and appreciation programs
  • Opportunities for career advancement, on-the-job training, and upskilling within a quickly growing company
  • Opportunities for career advancement through training and development 

JOB OVERVIEW: The STAR is a crucial component of the Best Shredding team and is responsible for the operation of the shredding truck and servicing Best Shreddingâ€™s customers on a day to day basis. The STAR is the public face of Best Shredding and as such must be able to perform his/her job duties in a safe and professional manner at all times, while maintaining a constant focus on achieving customer satisfaction. The STAR must also follow NAID procedures in order to supply confidential document destruction for Bestâ€™s customers.

DAYS/HOURS: Monday - Thursday ( 7:00 AM to 5:00 PM)
LOCATION: Coquitlam, BC

DRIVING AND OPERATING DUTIES:

  • Driving Bestâ€™s vehicles to service locations while obeying all signs and signals and adhering to the principles of defensive driving.
  • Being courteous to other drivers on the road, keeping in mind that the STARâ€™s driving reflects on the image of Best Service Pros.
  • Operating the truck in the safest and least obtrusive manner possible.
  • Operating the portable handheld computing device to access account information, input data, and print customer receipts.
  • Emptying consoles, as well as counting bins and tipping them into the truck mounted shredder.
  • Operating and troubleshooting the truck mounted shredder.
  • Bringing in and installing bins and consoles for our customers.
  • Offloading truck loads of shredded paper at pre-approved waste collection sites while following their rules and procedures.
  • Performing all routine maintenance checks as well as pre and post trip inspections in accordance with the maintenance schedule.
  • Shredding documents left in the service bay bins by drop and shred customers at the end of the day.
  • Keeping the service bay neat, clean, and organized.
  • Labeling consoles and bins with the appropriate stickers and maintaining an inventory of ready to go bins and consoles.
  • Fueling the trucks.
  • Filling out and submitting routine reports.
  • Customer Service Duties
  • Maintaining positive rapport and relationship with customer contacts.
  • Addressing and responding to customer inquiries, questions, comments, and concerns.
  • Communicating with the service manager and sales team in order to coordinate customer service efforts.
  • Complying with NAID procedures for supplying customers with secure, confidential document shredding.
  • Identifying and cold calling potential new clients.

SKILLS AND REQUIREMENTS:

  • High School Diploma
  • Class 5 driverâ€™s license with a good driving record is essential.
  • Air brake endorsement would be an asset.
  • Successful completion of a Defensive Driving Course would be an asset.
  • Good communication skills, both verbal and written
  • Strong mechanical aptitude with ability to perform routine vehicle maintenance
  • 1-2 years of previous face-to-face customer service experience, preferably in an industrial or service industry
  • Good organizational skills for task prioritization and effective time management
  • High level of personal integrity and strong work ethic
  • Professional/mature demeanor under stressful situations
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment
  • Must be able to work with little supervision
  • A clear criminal record
  • Computer Literate

WORKING CONDITIONS:

  • Will be required to work both indoors and outdoors
  • Manual dexterity required to use desktop computer and peripherals
  • Above average physical activity, such as lifting up to 75 lbs. on a consistent basis and bending as required.

BEST is an equal opportunity employer that values diversity and encourages applicants of all backgrounds.

title: AZ Driver
description:
Great company. Great people. Great opportunities.

As a Class A CDL Driver at United Rentals, your goal will be to deliver equipment to our customers in a safe, timely, efficient, and courteous manner. At the same time, you will have the opportunity to advance your career and contribute to our company's tremendous success and unparalleled growth. Frequently interacting with our customers, you will serve as a company ambassador and will provide exceptional customer service. And since we're local, you'll be home every night. 

Additional responsibilities include the following:
•    Drop off and pick up equipment for customers
•    Operate construction equipment, such as semi-trucks and trailers ("low boys") consistent with

DOT classification CDL-A
•    Adhere to all safety requirements particular to equipment including Federal Motor Carrier Safety

Regulations
•    Maintain driver’s logs and complete pre-trip inspections
•    Suggest additional equipment and supplies customers may need
•    Other duties assigned as needed


If you would enjoy the stability of working for the world's largest equipment rental provider, who provides ample opportunities for career growth, consider a future with United Rentals.  

Job Requirements:
•    Valid Class A CDL with acceptable driving record
•    High School Diploma or GED
•    Minimum of 2 years DOT regulated Commercial Driving Experience
•    Superior customer service, teamwork and verbal/written communication skills
•    Ability to frequently lift items up to 45 lbs.
•    Basic knowledge of construction equipment and safe driving procedures
•    Diligent attention to safety

At United Rentals, the largest equipment rental company, we believe that it takes great employees to build a great organization – and we’re passionate about helping our people grow professionally and embrace teamwork in everything they do. Our culture is based on our corporate values and centers on mutual respect, job satisfaction, diversity and a shared responsibility to build a better future.

What's in it for you?

U.S. Full Time roles:  Best in class benefits offering includes medical, dental, vision, flex spending and health savings accounts;  401(k) retirement with company match; life and disability insurance; and paid time off including sick, vacation, holidays, and paid parental leave.  Comprehensive training and development and career growth opportunities.

U.S. Part Time roles: Benefits offering includes 401(k) retirement with company match/RRSP; paid time off including sick, vacation and holidays; and comprehensive training and development and career growth opportunities.

Canada: Best in class benefits package which includes medical, dental & vision, RRSP/DPSP*, paid time off, comprehensive training and development, and career growth opportunities.

*Offered for full time roles, part time eligibility in select provinces

United Rentals, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer of women, minorities, protected veterans and individuals with disabilities.

title: Driver
description:
Why work for Lafarge?:

 

 

 

 

 

As the global leader in innovative and sustainable building materials, weâ€™re committed to shaping a greener, smarter and healthier world. At Lafarge Canada Inc., safety comes first, collaboration matters and diversity is celebrated with people who share our desire to continually make our materials better.  

 

Do you have the drive, the skills, and the passion to join us?

 

 

Overview:

 

 

Ready Mix Driver in the Hamilton, Ontario region. This is a full time position hiring asap!

 

Please send your resume to Andrew Macdonald at:

andrew.macdonald@lafargeholcim.com

 
 
Responsibilities:

 

Responsibilities include:

  • Delivering concrete to customers in a safe and timely manner.
  • Up keep of truck appearance, assist with light maintenance around the Concrete plant
  • Paperwork â€“ circle checks, delivery ticket information.

Key Competencies:

  • Valid Class AZ or DZ drivers license
  • Safety Mindset
  • Team player
  • Strong communicator
Qualifications:

 

Educational Background : Grade 12 diploma

 

Experience : 3 - 5 years of experience in the trucking industry with a clean driving record.   Training will be provided for operating the ready mix truck.

LafargeHolcim:

 

As we are reinventing the way the world builds, we need world-class talent to join our Lafarge Canada team: people who are passionate, driven by curiosity and keen to grow, learn, develop and thrive in our high-performance culture.

Whatever you do, you will make a difference here. Because we know that your passion and curiosity are the natural resources the world needs.  

 

We thank you for your interest.  Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.   Lafarge is committed to the principles of employment equity and encourages the applications from women, visible minorities, and persons with disabilities.

 

Lafarge Canada Inc. welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities.  In Ontario, our organization/business is committed to fulfilling our requirements under the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act.  Accommodations are available on request for  candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

 

Lafarge Canada is committed to providing a safe environment for employees, customers, contractors and vendors. As such, in keeping with the requirements of our industry associations, partners, and clients across Canada, Lafarge Canada has implemented a COVID-19 vaccination policy intended to reduce the spread of COVID-19. As of October 1st, 2021, all new employees joining Lafarge Canada, subject to any requirement to accommodate pursuant to applicable human rights legislation, must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19.

title: AZ Driver
description:
We are looking for talented dedicated drivers with exceptional customer service to join our delivery fleet. We pro vide an excellent training program, dedicated equipment and opportunities for growth

Position: AZ Driver
Location: Sudbury 
Status: Full time
Shifts: Monday-Friday (various start times)
 Details of the Position:
  • Start and Finish at customer location in Sudbury 
  • Driving a dry van, unloading tankers at various locations
  • Constant communication with the customer

General Requirements/Qualification:
  • Valid AZ License with no more than 3 demerit points
  • Exceptional customer service
  • Minimum 6 months AZ
  • Recent CVOR and Abstract and a criminal record search
  • Follow company rules and regulations with respect to safety and hours of service
  • Excellent customer service skills
  • Knowledge of load securement regulations
Why work for Canada Cartage
  • Industry leading benefits package including company-matching pension plan
  • Stability; Full Time, Steady Hours and consistent year round work
  • Safety-oriented company with a safety program in place
  • Opportunities for career advancements through training and development
  • Company perks such as company phone, uniform/safety boots allowance and discount programs for gym memberships, auto services, cell phone plans, etc.
  • Awarded as a Top Fleet Employer in 2017, 2018 and 2019
  • Work with a company named "Canada's Best Employer 2018 , 2019 & 2020" in Transportation & Logistics by Forbes
We would like to thank all those expressing an interest in this position; however only the candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.
Committed to employment equity, Canada Cartage Systems LP encourages applications from Aboriginal people, members of visible minority groups and women

title: Driver - Afternoon Shift (Inbound)
description:
The Driver - Inbound department for the Afternoon/ PM shift will be responsible to support the Forklift operational functions of the Brampton Distribution center and perform daily activities according to the quality procedures and established safe work standards of the facility.


Some of the key responsibilities for this role are as follows:


+ Operate all material handling equipment (MHE) safely and efficiently while meeting productivity and quality expectations/ standards

+ MHE includes the Order Picker, Reach, Single and Double-walkies and lift truck

+ Complete the pre-shift equipment inspection process and immediately report any issues or concerns to your Supervisor or Team Lead

+ Ensure all loads are properly secured to the pallet or within the gaylord before transporting goods throughout the DC

+ Place cartons onto mesh decks in the racking as per the standard operating procedures (SOPs)

+ Retrieve cartons from the racking and place onto a pallet as per the SOPs

+ Place pallets into the various drop zones and P&D locations and complete all systemic transactions

+ Retrieve empty pallets and full cardboard gaylords and transport as per the SOPs

+ Perform labeling, sorting, wrapping, packing and other miscellaneous tasks as needed

+ Communicate with Supervisor or Team Lead, as well as other Drivers, on the radio

+ Other duties as assigned


Other Job Requirements:


+ Must consistently adhere to all company policies and procedures as outlined in the VF Policy handbook

+ Be willing and able to work in other departments as needed (Picking, Processing, Shipping)

+ Perform housekeeping duties as required while contributing to maintaining a safe and clean work environment

+ Consistently follow all SOPs and work instructions

+ Meet or exceed all productivity standards/targets for each activity performed while meeting all quality standards

+ Must work well with minimal supervision in a team-based environment


Qualifications and Skills Required:


+ High School Diploma or equivalent preferred

+ Good verbal communication skills in English required

+ Ability to read pertinent information in English that is found on computer or RF device screens, vendor cartons, pick tickets or shipping labels required

+ Valid MHE certification/license (i.e. Order Picker, Reach, Walkie) an asset

+ Ability to pass written and practical driving test required

+ Demonstrated successful track record of working safely

+ Demonstrated record of excellent attendance and punctuality

+ Flexibility and team focus when asked to perform other duties required

+ Ability to walk/stand all day and bend, lift and push

+ Ability to work while standing on a platform up to 30 feet in the air

+ Must be able to lift and move up to 50 lbs repeatedly throughout his/her scheduled shift

+ Distribution/Warehouse experience preferred


R-20220505-0037


VF Diversity Vision Statement
VF is committed to creating an inclusive environment that welcomes and values the differences among all of our associates, customers, suppliers and the communities in which we live and conduct business. The continued success and growth of VF is enhanced through initiatives that promote diversity throughout VF around the world.VF is an equal employment opportunity/ affirmative action employer of minorities, females, protected veterans and the disabled. VF is committed to providing equal opportunities in employment, and treating our VF associates and VF applicants without discrimination on the basis of their race, color, gender, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, citizenship, disability, protected veteran status, HIV/AIDS status, or any other legally protected factor.

title: Driver Helper
description:
What does your dream company look like? If it's a fun, hyper-growth startup where people look forward to coming to work Monday mornings, keep reading...

 

RenoRun was born in 2016 with the insight that contractors spend too much time away from their job sites by going to the store to procure materials. Before building out the concept, the co-founders—three construction industry veterans—would sit in different hardware store parking lots around Montreal in the winter, with Tim Horton's coffees, and notebooks in hand. They kept count of anyone coming out in work boots, plus vans and pickup trucks, and compared notes at the end of the day. This was their "customer."

After noticing that there were roughly 2,000 contractors per hour circulating hardware stores in Montreal, they decided to set out on a crusade to better serve them, and to unleash them from the unpleasantries that had been normalized in the construction industry.

Fast forward to today and we're one of the hottest tech start-ups, opening in cities all over Canada and the US, on our mission to 'empower contractors to build the world around us'. Construction professionals don't just want, but deserve, to get time back.

So if you're looking for impact, look no further. Come join RenoRun!

Perks:

  • Permanent full time employment
  • Overtime paid at time and half
  • Group insurance (health, dental and vision)
  • Paid time off (vacation, sick and personal days)
  • ESOP (Employee Stock Option Plan)

Position Title:

Specialty Driver Assistant: (7:00am to 3:00pm, Monday to Friday) 

Position Description:

The Specialty Assistant reports to the Walk-In Logistics Manager of Toronto and is an integral part of our specialty order success. They are primarily responsible for assisting with loading the vehicle effectively with quality construction materials and delivering the orders in a timely manner. 

Your typical day could include:

  • Inspect vehicle, clean, replenish supplies and report damages
  • Operate vehicles in accordance with Occupational Health & Safety and Ministry of Transportation requirements as well as all local, municipal, provincial, and federal laws.
  • Receive customer orders through our smartphone app
  • Report to and communicate with the dispatcher at all times
  • Assist with loading material onto truck efficiently and secure it for transport
  • Drive to job sites around Toronto and unload materials
  • Assist Boom and Moffett operator with completing deliveries on site by spotting, traffic control, material placement

Requirements:

  • Experience in the construction or manual labor industry is strongly preferred
  • Excellent communicator and ability to articulate complex instructions into executional steps
  • CSA approved safety steel toe work boots
  • Physically capable of lifting and carrying 70+ lbs when necessary
  • Complete a criminal record check issued by RenoRun 
  • Experience working around heavy machinery (an asset)

Why You Should Work With Us:

We know building and renovation. We are industry leaders.

We make puns. We have fun.

We cut to the point because we value people's time.

We are culture-driven. We care a lot. And we say it.

Thank you for your interest in RenoRun!

For more information visit www.renorun.com

At RenoRun, we strive to build a workforce composed of individuals with diverse identities, backgrounds, abilities, and minds that will help us to grow, not only as a company, but also as individuals. RenoRun is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Full Time Driver - Edmonton South
description:
Before you apply to a job, select your language preference from the options available at the top right of this page.

Explore your next opportunity at a Fortune Global 500 organization. Envision innovative possibilities, experience our rewarding culture, and work with talented teams that help you become better every day. We know what it takes to lead UPS into tomorrow—people with a unique combination of skill + passion. If you have the qualities and drive to lead yourself or teams, there are roles ready to cultivate your skills and take you to the next level.

Job Description:

Job Description

What will you do? 

You are able to perform in a physical, fast-paced environment involving driving, continual lifting, lowering, and carrying packages. You practice safe transportation methods while traveling to and from destinations. You have the ability to be efficient and dedicated will ensure the absolute best customer service. If this sounds like your ideal opportunity, we want to hear from you!

Shifts: Available to work flexible shifts - Monday to Friday starting from around 8:30 AM

Hourly pay rate: Starting at $17 per hour + $2 bonus per hour (Top rate of $35.89 after 4 years)

Reasons you’ll love working at UPS:

  • Earn more: You can expect a competitive wage and reliable paycheck when you work for UPS. Compensation is paid out weekly!
  • Career development: Are you looking for an opportunity to grow in areas such as operations and other areas? Well, you’ve come to the right place. See where your UPS journey can take you!
  • Benefits: At UPS we offer a range of benefits that include employee discounts, health care, and many more! Find out which benefits you’ll get after you choose your role with us.

Qualifications/Skills:

  • Unloading and loading packages off and onto vehicles during commercial and residential drop-offs and pick-ups
  • Able to lift up to 70lbs
  • Comfortable working in a fast-paced customer facing and outside environment
  • Need to have a valid AB Class 5 non-GDL license
  • Should have no at-fault accidents or more than 5 demerit points in the past three years prior to applying
  • Should have no tickets or moving violations in the past 12-months prior to applying

UPS is the world’s largest package delivery company and a provider of supply chain management solutions. At UPS we discover how to combine endless opportunities innovation and rewards to create a truly unique career experience. With our unique promote-from-within culture you’ll always find new opportunities at every level of the organization. From training and education to growth and empowerment you have the freedom to forge a career path that can take you anywhere you want to go.

UPS is an equal opportunity employer. UPS does not discriminate on the basis of race/color/religion/sex/nationalorigin/veteran/disability/age/sexual orientation/gender identity or any other characteristic protected by law.

UPS Canada is a diverse and equal opportunity employer. Please advise our HR representatives if workplace accommodation is needed. Thank you for your interest in UPS Canada.

title: AZ Driver - All Shifts
description:
Company Description

ARE YOU CUT OUT FOR AIM RECYCLING?

Founded in 1936 in Montreal, Canada, AIM is a private company with multiple sites located in Canada, the United States, Mexico, Europe and Asia. Recognized as a world leader in metal recycling and solder manufacturing for a broad range of industries, we focus on creating high-quality products, setting AIM apart. Our continually expanding company offers many exciting career opportunities, a stimulating work environment, competitive salaries and an excellent employee benefits program.

Job Description

American Iron & Metal is a growth-oriented metal recycling and processing company located in Hamilton, Ontario. We are currently recruiting for experienced AZ Drivers for our Hamilton location. The successful candidate will be responsible for the pick-up and/or delivery of various metal products.

Responsibilities will include: 

  • $27-$30
  • Pick up and/or deliver to AIM’s commercial clients or another AIM site 
  • Load security, tarping if necessary 
  • Keep the equipment clean and in good working condition 
  • Perform a daily inspection 
  • Keep reports up-to-date 
  • Always work in a safe manner 
Qualifications

 

  • minimum 1-2 years’ experience is preferred
  • Experience operating a Roll Off/Lugger is preferred 
  • Must have a valid AZ driver’s license 
  • Must have a respectable CVOR 
  • Must have a clear criminal record 

 



Additional Information

*** Home Daily, Canada Only Runs ***  

  • Overtime paid after 44 hours 
  • RRSP and Benefits 
  • Newer Equipment 
  • Well serviced equipment with on-site shop for 24/7 maintenance 
  • Inbound and outbound trips booked in advanced for better time management 

If you feel that you are qualified for this ad please reply to this ad with a copy of your resume. 

Come and join one of North America’s most sophisticated metal recyclers !

title: Stretcher Attendant & Driver
description:
If you possess a love for people, attention to detail, outgoing attitude, and you want to make a difference please submit a resume! No experience needed! We will train the right people with the right attitude for this permanent full time position! Are you curious about what the role of Stretcher Attendant involves!?

It is a career focused on patient care, transporting those in need, and the opportunity to make a difference for those we care for. Our patients need to be transported with compassion, care, respect, and expertise. It is a privilege to be able to do what we do, and we are looking for similar minded individuals to help us provide care to our community.

Our Stretcher Attendants need to be team players as the role typically involves working in partners to move patients from destination to destination.

Being a Stretcher Attendant is a rewarding career with opportunities for advancements for individuals who commit to providing an excellent service. For many, it is also a great learning tool for those wanting to enter the healthcare field

What You Offer!
  • Enjoys working with people! Patient Transport Services puts a high priority on patient care and employee relations. Therefore, which our Stretcher Attendants must possess the following traits: compassionate, reliable, and outgoing.
  • Willing to learn! The chosen candidate is willing and able to obtain all the licenses listed below, and to complete the in-house training program. (please be aware that candidates are not required to have these qualifications before applying). At Patient Transport Services we believe it is our responsibility to provide our employees with as much support as possible. Therefore, we offer numerous tools for our employees to receive the proper training and credentials to perform their duties.
  • An affinity for safety! Our patient’s health and safety are our core objectives, and we require all employees to make patient safety their number one priority.
What We Offer!
  • Employee training! At Patient Transport Service’s we offer a comprehensive paid in-depth training program that is completed on site!
  • Advancement opportunities! Options for advancement to individuals who have exceptional work ethic & reliability.
  • Secure, long-term employment in a growing industry! We are currently offering full time permanent positions.
  • Benefits! We are offer health benefits, including life insurance, an employee assistant program, and dental that begins after probation.
  • PPE! We provide full PPE to protect our employees working in sensitive environments.
  • A Uniform! We provide a full Uniform Set (minus black belt, black ankle high boots, and black non printed T-shirt).
  • A competitive wage! We offer a starting wage of $14 an hour.
The following documents are required for employment but are NOT required for an interview. Furthermore, you are not required to have previous experience. We provide a comprehensive in-house training or assistance in acquiring all the following documents.
  • Child Abuse Registry Check (Max 60 days issued)
  • Adult Abuse Registry Check (Max 60 days issued)
  • Criminal Record Check- W/ Vulnerable Sector (Max 60 days issued)
  • Standard First Aid w/ CPR BLS
  • Class 4F Driver’s license (Must currently possess Class 5F)
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: From $14.00 per hour

COVID-19 considerations:
Please be aware that you will be required to wear personal protective equipment and follow our policies and procedures as it relates to COVID-19 throughout your shift

title: Driver/Helper
description:
Company Description

                                        NEW Competitive Hourly Rates and Great Benefits!!

At Sleep Country Canada/Dormez-vous?, we believe that a good night’s sleep is key to living healthier and happier lives.  Driven by our purpose to transform lives by awakening Canadians to the power of sleep, we’re focused on delivering exceptional customer service and providing safe, high quality and sustainable sleep solutions as an essential component of physical, mental and emotional wellbeing for all. 

A proud Canadian brand, we are Canada’s leading omnichannel sleep retailer committed to building a company culture that empowers equitable, diverse and inclusive teams, and where differences are embraced and valued. Working at Sleep Country Canada/Dormez-vous? is more than just a job, it is your opportunity to realize your full potential and be motivated every day to make a positive difference to your team and to the lives of our customers.

Our Delivery team plays a key role in our customers’ experience and making sure that each and every purchase ends with a smile! As a Driver/Helper, you will ensure our customers receive their order on time and with care.

    Job Description

    Can you?

    • Deliver our products to each and every customer's homes in a professional, friendly, and enthusiastic manner that has them screaming "WOW!"
    • Motivate yourself and others to provide a jaw dropping delivery experience
    • Work together as part of the Operations Team to achieve and exceed goals and expectations
    • Promise to leave work the way you came in!? This means following all required health and safety procedures! Safety always comes first!
    Qualifications

    Do you have?

    • A high school diploma
    • A clean Driver's Abstract? Don't worry, we will over look a few smudges- but we need to know you can handle a wheel!
    • A Valid Driver's License
    • Experience with driving a 5-ton vehicle...Give or take a few pounds!
    • Experience working within a warehouse or delivery capacity. This is considered an asset, so it's not mandatory!

    Are you able to?

    • Lift a minimum of 88 lbs (40 kg's)?
    • Think quickly and tackle problems on your own!
    • Love our customers as much as we love sleep!?!
    • Work a flexible shift, this includes evenings and weekends.


    Additional Information

    Employment Equity

    We recognize the importance of a diverse workforce and we therefore encourage applications from Aboriginal Peoples, women, members of a visible minority, and persons with a disability.

title: Driver
description:
Globally we deliver over 320,000 authentic, world-class meals every day, these meals are dished up by our portfolio of brands - dnata, Alpha Flight Group, Alpha LSG and En Route. Working to stringent deadlines and exacting standards, we take pride in every smile our dishes evoke - a trait recognized by numerous airlines around the world. Over the years we have been awarded best caterer by a wide number of airlines and are driven by a desire to deliver for our customers, and their customers, every day. We are excited to be opening our 64th dedicated catering unit in Vancouver, Canada. Our Vancouver start-up is a unique opportunity to be part of a new team that will help us write the next chapter of our success story!

Why join dnata?

  • Be part of a small start-up team, with great opportunity for growth
  • Be part of a global award winning group
  • Medical, Dental & Vision Cover
  • Additional co-contributions towards your retirement fund
  • Paid annual vacation
  • Over-time premiums
  • Free daily meal

The Role:

Drivers are responsible for the safe transport and delivery of temperature controlled food and related goods from the catering facility to the aircraft.

Responsibilities:

  • Work safely at all times, insuring your own safety and the safety of your colleagues. Drive safely on airport property and public roads, adhering to specified rules, regulations and specific customer guidelines
  • Deliver temperature controlled food and related goods to the aircraft via dnata vehicles.
  • Conducting periodic vehicle checks to ensure they are serviceable and safe to drive. Insuring that all company vehicles are clean and refueled when required
  • Reporting any faults / issues of the vehicles to the respective person
  • Monitor deliveries for accuracy and security, delivering and collecting of any written communications or any items from / to contacts outside of the Company
  • Manually load and unload galley equipment and goods onto and off of trucks and aircraft.
  • Professionally interact with and provide superior customer service to onboard airline representatives and customers
  • Assist in other non-drivingrelated tasks during down-time, as directed by management.
  • Maintain a valid drivers license and RAIC at all times, as well as abide by all road laws and safety operating procedures
Qualifications/ skills/ experience / knowledge:
  • Hold minimum of Class 5 license or Class 3 CDL
  • Be able to safely manually handle (lift) loads of up to 50 lbs
  • Have the right to work and reside in BC, Canada
  • Hold a current Restricted Area Identity Card (RAIC) OR be eligible for RAIC
  • Previous experience driving aircraft catering vehicles is highly advantageous
  • Previous experience driving in an airside / airport environment is highly advantageous

title: Driver - Part Time (NTD)
description:
.

National Tire Distributors is Canada's leading Tire Distribution Company. A key element of our success has always been our people. As part of our team philosophy, we coach, support and help develop all of our employees to become the best they can be! If you're looking for a career that will challenge you, a job that will offer growth, and a progressive employer, then National Tire Distributors Inc. (NTD) is the right place for you!

The main responsibility for the Driver position is the timely and safe delivery of tires, wheels and other products to our NTD customers. This role is a key component of a dynamic team focused on providing our customers with everything they require to succeed. The position will introduce the employee to multiple functions within NTD Delivery and Operations. Key to success in this role is the ability to adapt to and perform various processes efficiently and safely. As a main point of contact with our customer base maintaining a courteous and professional manner is critical. This position will provide the Driver with the knowledge and experience necessary for growth within NTD.

We offer:
- $16.80/hour
- Part Time Benefits from Day One
- Life Insurance
- Production Bonus
- Workperks - discounts on over 3000 vendors
- Growth opportunities

Apply online or in person. Same day, on-site interviews and offers.
We are located at:

2730 Swansea Cres
Ottawa, ON
K1G 6R8
Canada

   

   

Build a challenging and rewarding career with us!
