title: Driver
description:
CenterLine (Windsor) Limited is a recognized industry leader in manufacturing standard and custom designed resistance welding, spot welding, arc welding, and metal working equipment. We apply state of the art technology to the design and manufacture of robotic weld lines, configurable fastener welders, weld guns, cylinders, electrodes, and other welding accessories. Our people are our key competitive advantage in todayâ€™s global market. CenterLine (Windsor) Limited continues to evolve and diversify to remain a valued partner to its customers and a respected member of industry. Our success is built on the foundation of innovation, efficient design management, excellence, and the guarantee of quality service.

CenterLine (Windsor) Limited is looking for a self-motivated, reliable individual to fill the position of Driver responsible for the pick-up and delivery of products over established routes.  This position reports to the Transportation and Logistics Supervisor.

 

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Operate light trucks and cube vans to pick up and deliver various products over established routes (Route #1 between CenterLine facilities, Route #2 throughout Windsor/Essex County, and Route #3 Michigan within an hour radius from Windsor)
  • Operate vehicle in a safe manner, obeying all safety rules
  • Loading and unloading products in a safe manner, using appropriate aids (dollies, forklifts, etc.)
  • Perform timely inspections of loads during all phases of truck / travel operation
  • Verify all load related documentation for validity, accuracy and completeness
  • Log information on pick-ups and deliveries, vehicle mileage, and any problems encountered
  • Effective oral and written communication
  • Complete and file all necessary paperwork pertaining to daily travel logs

 

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE

  • High School Diploma
  • Class 'G' License required
  • Clean Driver's abstract required
  • Ability to lift up to 50lbs required
  • Ability to travel across the U.S. border required
  • Eligibility for bonding and transportation of dangerous goods (TGD) certification
  • Computer literate
  • Organized, with solid time management skills
  • Must be able to work with little supervision; must be self-directed
  • Forklift license and operational experience an asset
  • â€˜Fast Cardâ€™ an asset

 

 

EMPLOYEE BENEFITS

  • Air-conditioned manufacturing facility
  • Health, dental, vision care
  • Life insurance
  • Company pension plan
  • Tuition reimbursement
  • Employee Assistance Plan
  • Retirement benefits
  • Wellness committee

 

Interested candidates should apply no later than Friday, May 13, 2022.

In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians Act, 2005 and the Ontario Human Rights Code, Centerline Windsor Limited will provide accommodations throughout the recruitment, Selection, and/or assessment process to applicants with disabilities. If selected to participate in the recruitment, selection and/or assessment process, please inform the Human Resources staff of the nature of any accommodation(s) that you may require in respect of any materials or processes used to ensure your equal participation.

title: Specialized driver
description:
Groupe Robert is actually looking for a driver for specialized work at Joliette terminal.

Your responsibilities will be as follows:

• Drive a heavy weight vehicle from one location to another, with or without load, following a preset route and pre-determined schedule
• Be responsible for the vehicle, so to speak and of the load and the safety while driving for self and others
• Check general vehicle condition and report any fault or damage
• Check total and axial loads in order to predict the vehicle reaction
• Perform routine activities
• Perform the pick up, meet the customers and have all documents duly signed
• Notify the workshop about any abnormality of the vehicle and the mechanical repairs required

In order to join Groupe Robert's team, you must have:

• Minimum 2 years experience as class 1
• Excellent driver’s record
• Functional French and English
• Good communication skills and understanding of the safety policies
• Able to drive a truck in a safely manner, courteously and efficiently
• Excellent communication and customer service skills and able to respect and apply all the company’s politics and procedures
• Ability to carry out handling

Groupe Robert offers you:

• Job stability, work all year• Safe environment• Family environment• Salary and competitive rates mile• All deliveries and pickups paid• Interesting professional development opportunities• Group insurance and fringe benefits• Corporate discounts• Uniform provided• Environmental awareness• Systems and equipment on the cutting edge of technology• Company demonstrating agility, efficiency and innovation• Constant concern for safety (trainings, certifications, associations)

Schedules

Day

Experience

0-1 year

Groupe Robert is proud to support the diversity of its employees through its terminals in Quebec and Ontario. Women, visible and / or ethnic minorities or people with disabilities will always be welcome to apply, because at Groupe Robert, the diversity of our employees is the link in our logistics chain that makes us even stronger!

title: AZ Driver
description:
Company Description

Founded in 1936 in Montreal, Canada, AIM is a private company with multiple sites located in Canada, the United States, Mexico, Europe and Asia. Recognized as a world leader in metal recycling and solder manufacturing for a broad range of industries, we focus on creating high-quality products, setting AIM apart. Our continually expanding company offers many exciting career opportunities, a stimulating work environment, competitive salaries and an excellent employee benefits program.

We are currently recruiting for experienced AZ Drivers for our Kapuskasing location. The successful candidate will be responsible for the pick-up and/or delivery of various metal products. 

Job Description

 

  • Pick up and/or deliver to AIM’s commercial clients or another AIM site 
  • Load security, tarping if necessary 
  • Keep the equipment clean and in good working condition 
  • Perform a daily inspection 
  • Keep reports up-to-date 
  • Always work in a safe manner 
Qualifications

 

  • 2-3 years of AZ Driving experience 
  • Experience operating a Roll Off/Lugger is preferred 
  • Must have a valid AZ driver’s license 
  • Must have a respectable CVOR 
  • Must have a clear criminal record 

 



Additional Information

  • Extremely Competitive Pay Rates  
  • Overtime paid after 44 hours 
  • Weekend, Afternoon & Night shift premiums also offered 
  • RRSP and Benefits 
  • Company uniforms with dry cleaning services 
  • Well serviced equipment 
  • Inbound and outbound trips booked in advanced for better time management 

If you feel that you are qualified for this ad please reply to this ad with a copy of your resume. 

Come and join one of North America’s most sophisticated metal recyclers !

title: Driver – Baggage Cart Associate
description:
Company Description

WHO ARE WE?
We've been serving Canadian clients for over 75 years. The companies that began independently and now form Dexterra Group have an outstanding record of supporting the infrastructure and built assets that play a vital role in our society and helping our clients achieve higher performance and productivity. Powered by passionate people, we bring the right teams with the right skills together – offering both experience and regional expertise so companies can operate their day to day, confidently and successfully.

Job Description

Job Purpose:

A Driver for the Baggage Cart program is generally responsible for retrieving, collecting and delivering baggage carts to designated Terminal areas using a company provided truck and trailer.

Main Duties and Responsibilities:

• Collect and retrieve baggage carts throughout the Terminal buildings including all parking facilities

• Effectively communicate with supervisors, baggage cart associates, and other drivers to maintain operational efficiency

• Conduct routine checks of designated cart staging areas to ensure proper quantities of carts

• Completes a pre-check of truck and trailer condition prior to starting any work

• Coordinate with Leads and Supervisors for pick up routes and times as per daily operations • Maintain with care equipment assigned to you, ensure cleaned after using, and returned to management at shift end

• Ensure cleanliness of vehicles and maintenance of truck and trailer

• Must follow posted speed limits and proceed with caution on Airport property

• Follow written and verbal instruction given by all supervisors

• Ensures courtesy given when working around passengers and other vehicles when driving

• Continually keep an eye out for any litter or wet spills while working, picking up any litter or debris when possible; informing a supervisor immediately if you notice a wet spill or safety hazard related to Pearson

• Ensures the proper tools are used for the designated task

• Engages and assists passengers in the terminal as necessary & attends I Am Toronto Pearson Ambassador sessions, or any relevant training related to assisting passengers

• Attends all technical training for the role as required

• Maintain confidentiality at all times in respect of company related matters and to prevent disclosure of confidential information

Safety Responsibilities:

• Attend all required health & safety training

• Must have a valid driver’s license

• Follow safe work instructions and assists in prevention

• Complies with H&S regulations and company policies

• Ensure any accidents/incidents are reported to their Supervisor immediately

• Does not operate any equipment without prior training

• Use all required PPE (safety shoes & high-vis vests)

• Reports any unsafe conditions, hazards and all workplace injuries

• Participates in the early and safe return to work process as per our RTW policy

 

Qualifications

Knowledge & Skills:

• Able to speak and read english

• Must have a valid drivers license

• Must have a clean driver abstract

• Must be legally obligated to operate a motor vehicle

• Able to understand training and be familiar with emergency procedures for the building and role

• Strong organizational, time management skills; able to prioritize tasks • Adherence to standards and procedures

• Good interpersonal and communication skills

• Resilience, with the ability to work under pressure; GTAA properties are a 24/7 business environment.

• Able to obtain and maintain a valid RAIC at all time



Additional Information

Dexterra Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans’ status, Indigenous status, or any other legally protected factors. Disability-related accommodations during the hiring selection process are available upon request.

title: AZ Driver (Manual Transmission)
description:
Riverdale is Looking to add Talented AZ Drivers to our Kick Ass, Growing Team!!

Hard working Drivers earn MORE at Riverdale, we pay the BEST in the business.

Click Here Riverdale Pay Stubs to see current pay stubs from Riverdale Providers. 

Why Riverdale Poultry?

We are experiencing tremendous growth, because we are the leading live haul poultry transportation and catching service company in Canada. Our customers know us for being progressive, providing best-in-class service, and having amazing long-term employees.

We exist to â€œFEED THE COUNTRYâ€ â€“ a purpose we have been proud of for 65 years.

We deliver a critical service to major poultry processors, and we live by our core values:

Get it Done Right: We get the job done. The right way. 

Learn to Improve: We have always focused on perfecting our craft. Each day is an opportunity to learn and push the yardstick.

Accountability to All: We are accountable to all stakeholders â€“ our team, customers, growers, animals, industry partners, and our communities.

Kick Ass and Have Fun! We do whatever it takes to win, but never compromise safety, animal welfare, integrity, or our values.

 

Drive it! Earn it!

What we offer:

  • Stable working environment.
  • Weekly pay. Current Load Confirmation Sheet and Paystubs below!!
  • A Great team focused on Getting the job done right!!!
  • Paid on the job training. 
  • Short haul work - home after every shift!!!!!
  • Our drivers are assigned their own trucks.
  • The ability to Feed the Country!!!

Compensation information can be found by clicking the below link:

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1wl97cQE42izHJeiTfRK-RS_Xx9WS0hORNGyj2SZ2CqQ/edit?usp=sharing 

Candidates Must Have:

  • A valid AZ Drivers License
  • Clean commercial abstract and CVOR.
  • The ability to pass a road test.
  • Willingness to work flexible shifts.
  •  A minimum of 6 months experience as an AZ driver.
  • Minimum of 3 months experience driving a manual transmission in an AZ position.
  • A positive attitude, and willingness to be a part of a strong team focused on Getting the job done right, While Kicking Ass and Having Fun!!

 

What will your day look like:

  • Set up trailer at the farm for it to be loaded with poultry
  • Loading your trailer with catching crews or loaders 
  • Managing the load, following animal welfare requirements  
  • Tarping, chaining, and strapping of trailers
  • Accurate weighing of empty and loaded cargo for processing
  • Communication with dispatch, foreman and farmers daily
  • Completion of paperwork, including Electronic logs and bill of ladings
  • No border crossings or long-haul destinations

Benefits:

  • On-site parking
  • Health and dental benefits after 3-months
  • RSP matching program after 12 months
  • Annual Bonus program

Copy and paste Link into your browser to see the scorecard:

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1gUvYbIXHdFSxjtJEZgqIPwhw8SrBYMGD/edit?usp=sharing&ouid=112624261145494712251&rtpof=true&sd=true

 

FAQ Videos we created that answer many of your questions (please copy and paste the address in your browser to view the videos):

  • Meet Some Riverdale Drivers - https://youtu.be/bPHKOOfEn64
  • FAQ Earning Potential - https://youtu.be/JPW1jvRfBFU
  • General Faq - https://youtu.be/CrzvVJnVvEs
  • Meet the owners https://youtu.be/qa2H9ExpfYc
  • Our Equipment https://youtu.be/je6aLsJnzuw
  • Day in the life https://youtu.be/DVkn0Jt-AmI

Upon request, Riverdale Poultry will provide accommodation to a job applicant with a disability during its recruitment process.  If you require accommodation during this process please contact Human Resources at Tel: 519â€‘531â€‘0402 or Email: hr@riverdalepoultry.ca

#RPSJ

 

Thank you for your interest with Riverdale Poultry. Only selected applicants will be contacted.

title: Driver
description:
Overview:

Enterprise Holdings, operating the National, Enterprise, and Alamo car rental brands is looking for a driver to join our amazing team!  Enterprise Holdings is the largest and fastest growing privately owned automotive rental and leasing company in the  North America.    

 

The Driver delivers vehicles and in some instances, customers, employees or vendors safely and timely to the appropriate destination(s) while giving helpful, courteous and professional customer service.

 

This Position is Part Time and Pays $11.45 / hour

 

Branch Location: 1100 SCARTH ST REGINA, SK S4R 2E2

 

Schedules:

  • Sunday: 9:00am - 5:00pm
  • Monday: 1:00pm - 6:00pm
  • Friday: 1:00pm - 6:00pm
  • Saturday: 8:30am - 3:00pm  

 

Responsibilities:

The Part Time Driver is responsible for the transporting of fleet cars and vans to and from rental locations, as well as navigating written directions.

  • Drive and deliver vehicles locally or out of area as needed, following all rules of the road
  • Deliver customers and vehicles to appropriate destination in a safe and courteous manner
  • Ride with or follow another driver to drop off vehicle(s) or pick up multiple vehicles
  • Organize travel route and ensure vehicle paperwork is accurate and timely
  • May need to communicate via 2-way radio or cellular phone
  • May be asked to clean vehicle and/or keep bus clean during shift
  • May be asked to assist customer(s) with directions, car options and basic policy/procedures
  • May be asked to assist customer(s) load and unload luggage, enter and exit vehicle and miscellaneous customer needs
  • Perform miscellaneous job-related duties as assigned
Qualifications:
  • Must be at least 18 years of age
  • Must have a valid driver's license with no more than 2 moving violations and/or at-fault accidents on driving record in the past 3 years
  • No drug or alcohol related convictions on driving record (DWI/DUI) or criminal record within the last 5 years  
  • Must be able to lift 30 lb. in order to assist customers
  • Must be authorized to work in Canada and not require work authorization sponsorship by our company for this position now or in the future.
  • As per governement mandate, all employees on-site are required to be fully vaccinated per Vaccination Requirement, subject only to limited exceptions mandated by legislation.

title: Driver (Full time, Contract)
description:
Mission Statement: Understand the aspirations of seniors and respond with innovative supports.

Vision Statement: Building inclusive communities where all seniors are connected to living their best possible life

Position:             Driver
Hours of Work:   Full-Time Contract
Reports to:         Community Service Supervisor
Date posted:      April 13, 2022
Deadline:           Open till position filled

Position Summary
The Driver is responsible for providing safe and reliable transportation to clients of Senior Persons Living Connected for medical appointments, Day Programs, shopping, delivery of meals, and other essential purposes.

Responsibilities:
  • Provides driving services to clients attending early or evening medical appointments, Day programs and other activities
  • Assists clients to board and exit vehicles and ensure all passengers are safely seated and secure
  • Collects and secure service fees
  • Works with the service team to ensure services are delivered in timely, caring, and safe manner
  • Delivers meals to community clients in a timely manner, visit clients briefly, maintain friendly contacts, and encourage healthy eating and healthy living
  • Maintains service records and reports
  • Provides back up to department staff when absent
Education:
High School graduate with OSSD, or equivalent

Experience and Skills:
  • Work or volunteer experience in social services in multi-cultural communities is preferred
  • Experience with transporting older adults to appointments is preferred
  • Valid B or F Driver’s License with clear driving record
  • Knowledge of Ontario Highway Traffic Act
  • Knowledge and experience working with frail or cognitively impaired seniors
  • Ability to work both independently and as part of a team.
  • Good interpersonal and communication skills, both verbal and written
  • Good customer service manner and observation skills
  • Ability to lift and carry meals on wheels bags weighing up to 20 pounds
  • Fluent in written and verbal English
  • Ability to speak a second language considered an asset
Other:
  •  Vulnerable Sector screening required
  •  Clean driver’s abstract required
  • Proof of full vaccination required

Senior Persons Living Connected (SPLC) is a diverse work environment. We encourage applications from all persons, including persons with disabilities. Accommodation will be provided, if needed, in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and Accessibility for Ontarians with Disability Act.

Please submit your application by visiting our website at www.splc.ca/careers

title: Driver (Full Time) - Kamloops, BC - (Job Number: 22001283)
description:
Description

Linde is a leading global industrial gases and engineering company with 2020 sales of %2427 billion (euro;24 billion). We live our mission of making our world more productive every day by providing high-quality solutions, technologies and services which are making our customers more successful and helping to sustain and protect our planet.



The company serves a variety of end markets including chemicals refining, food beverage, electronics, healthcare, manufacturing and primary metals. Linde#39;s industrial gases are used in countless applications, from life-saving oxygen for hospitals to high-purity specialty gases for electronics manufacturing, hydrogen for clean fuels and much more. Linde also delivers state-of-the-art gas processing solutions to support customer expansion, efficiency improvements and emissions reductions.



For more information about the company and its products and services, please visit www.lindecanada.ca



Class 1 Driver ndash; Full Time



Major Responsibilities (Duties may include but are not limited to):

  • Deliver high pressure cylinders, liquid containers and hard goods to customer locations
  • Load and unload cylinders, count and record quantities and styles of product to ensure actual load complies with shipping documents
  • Check and placard vehicle according to Transportation of Dangerous Goods (TDG) regulations
  • Complete shipping orders and related paperwork
  • Complete trip reports, fuel tickets and other necessary reports
  • Conduct pre and post trip inspections noting and explaining defects or deficiencies to supervisor
  • Other duties as assigned by the manager



Linde Canada Inc. is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities. Applicants requiring accommodation during the recruitment and selection process are encouraged to make their needs known in advance if accommodation is required. We will work with you to meet your needs.


We are committed to employment equity for women, aboriginal people, visible minorities, and persons with disabilities. Interested candidates from these groups are encouraged to apply.


All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.



Qualifications


Qualifications:

  • Valid, incident free, applicable provincial Class 1 Driver#39;s License and a clean driverrsquo;s abstract
  • A minimum of 3 years related experience
  • Able to manipulate a variety of cylinder sizes and weights as required
  • Transportation of Dangerous Goods (TDG) and Workplace Hazardous Materials Information System (WHMIS) training
  • Ability to lift up to 60 lbs. repetitively
  • Knowledge of compressed gases and safe handling along with mechanical aptitude


Advantages of working for Linde!

  • Global stability and possible opportunities to work in various areas throughout Linde
  • Learning environment with an Education Assistance Program
  • Continuous learning opportunities provided
  • Competitive salaries, vacation and performance based salary increase
  • Comprehensive flexible benefits, including health and dental; pension plan; group RRSP
  • Employee Assistance Program, aiding in work/life challenges
  • Partnership discounted rates


Linde has an extensive background check process which may include but is not limited to, a criminal background review, pre-employment medical, driver#39;s license and abstract review, and may also include reference checks, employment, and education verification.


Primary Location British Columbia-Kamloops
Schedule Full-time

title: Part Time - AZ Driver
description:
Company Description

Chit Chats' vision is to help Canadians deliver their goods to the world with postage at unbelievable prices. We are a fast-growing entrepreneurial company making a huge impact on Canadian entrepreneurs and businesses. As e-commerce removes borders, we don’t want high Canadian postal rates to be a barrier to world commerce. We aim to remove these physical and financial restraints to create a seamless, borderless and boundless world of opportunity for Canadians.

We’re looking for you if you are Caring, Curious and Cheerful!

Job Description

As our AZ driver, you are responsible for transporting client shipments safely and in a timely manner while following MTO regulations and maintaining safety precautions for self and company vehicles.

Responsibilities

  • Safely transport client shipments on time
  • Safely operate company vehicles
  • Safely transport returned shipments from our US warehouse to our Burlington facility when required 
  • Conduct inspection of vehicles for mechanical operation and/or safety issues 
  • Perform required daily/weekly maintenance
  • Immediately report defects/safety issues/maintenance needs, accidents or violations
  • Document and log work/rest periods in accordance with regulatory requirements and/or company policies.
  • Comply with Provincial and US State laws/ regulations as well as with company policies and procedures
  • Load and unload vehicles as required
  • Collect and verify delivery instructions and shipment manifest 
  • Use the Chit Chats platform and other technology deemed necessary by the company to complete the trip.
  • Understand and abide by cross border compliance regulations
  • Locate individual shipments and complete compliance inspections as directed by US Customs officials.
  • Work with supporting departments, such as compliance, in order to successfully complete trips. 
Qualifications

  • Must be available two consistent days a week (minimum 16 hours), between the hours of 6:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. Monday to Sunday (days to be negotiated) 
  • 3 year previous commercial insured driving experience
  • Possess Valid AZ Driver's License and clean driving record (motor vehicle record will be required)
  • Currently residing in Canada and possess Valid Canadian Passport with the ability to travel to the United States regularly
  • Commercial Driver Medical Certification or Equivalent may be requested
  • Knowledge of the Greater Toronto area and outskirts
  • Knowledge and experience with commercial border crossings would be an asset
  • Strong organizational skills
  • Ability to multi-task with attention to detail


Additional Information

We thank you for your application, but only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Please note that the successful candidate will be subject to reference and criminal background checks prior to employment.

 As a federally regulated employer, Chit Chats Express fully supports the principles of employment equity and encourages all qualified members of the designated groups to apply.

Covid-19 update: Chit Chats is an essential service.  We have strict Covid safety protocols in place for both our clients and our staff.

title: Driver
description:
We currently have 2 openings for experienced Class 3 Drivers, who are looking for full-time work in Vernon, BC! Competitive Signing Bonus and Benefits that start on day 1! Serious Inquiries Only!

We have a couple of immediate openings left for individuals that want to expand their careers and join a long lasting, outstanding team of people who work in the recycling field! We are growing and are looking to expand and we offer great job stability, great pay compensation- followed by a lot of growth and internal training opportunities. In this role you will be hosting drop offs and curbside recycling collection of incoming and outgoing materials. . We ask that you have a valid Class 3 license for insurance purposes and have held this license for up to one year's worth of experience. This is a flexible job that allows you flexibility in your real life, and gives you an opportunity to learn and grow into more potential! If you are interested in being considered for this role, send us your application today! Immediate start opportunity!

Shift: Monday-Friday
Time: Between 6-6:30AM- End of Day (8 hr shifts)
Wage: $24.71 an hour to start and $25.71 after your probationary period (3 months)
Area: Vernon, BC
Looking for candidates who can start immediately
Full-Time/ Permanent position
Transit Accessible
*Plus boot allowance and a signing bonus of $3000*

If you would like to be interviewed for the Class 3 Driver position, then please send us your resume and we will contact you soon!

Advantages
-Competitive starting rate with training $24.71/hr + Bonuses upon start
-Immediate Benefits coverage (starts day 1)
-Flexible schedule allowing you to make it home for dinners
-Tuition reimbursement
-Job Security (long term opportunity)
-Boot Allowance
-Transit Accessible Location
-Signing Bonus of $3000
-Immediate start opportunity

Responsibilities
-At least 1 year of a Class 1 and / or 3 motor vehicle experience (with air brakes);
-Meet deadline requirements and assist team with completion of daily duties
-Perform curbside recycling collection and drop-offs as needed
-Direct your way through routes and operate a variety of different trucks.
-Conduct daily inspection of vehicles and accurately complete related documentation
-Communicate with supervisor regarding concerns or suggestions
-Keep track of your schedule and time management

Qualifications
-Class 1 and / or 3 with air brake endorsement needed in order to be considered
-Willingness to learn and work with a team is important in this role
-Minimum 1 year working experience driving with clean drivers abstract
-Ability to work overtime on an “as-needed” basis if required
-Experience in the waste and recycling industry or similar industry would be an asset
-Good communication and time management skills would be very helpful
-Live in the Vernon, BC area

Summary
If this sounds like the perfect job opportunity for you, look no further!
We are also accepting referrals and offer a bonus that will put extra cash into your pocket- ask us about it to learn more.

Just send your resume along to our team here at Randstad!
Lipika @ lipikaluthra.pahuja@randstad.ca
Nicole @ nicole.demers@randstad.ca

For more opportunities with us, please visit the link below
https://www.randstad.ca/job-seeker/explore-sectors/

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to

accessibility@randstad.ca

to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: Driver
description:
Overview:

Element has an opportunity for a Driver to be a part of the transportation department whose primary responsibility will be aiding in logistics and operation.

 

Responsibilities:

  • Deliver and collect samples, invoices reports to and from the respective entities
  • Travel to the various project sites and offices
  • Ensure that the vehicle is well maintained
  • Maintain logs and documents related to vehicle and its maintenance
Skills / Qualifications:
  • High school educated
  • Valid light vehicle driving license for the country of operation
  • Good English skills
  • Good in communication skills
  • Ability to work in teams under work under pressure

#LI-SN1

Company Overview:

Element is one of the fastest growing testing, inspection and certification businesses in the world. Globally we have more than 6,500 brilliant minds operating from 200 sites across 30 countries. Together we share an ambitious purpose to â€˜Make tomorrow safer than todayâ€™.

 

When failure in use is not an option, we help customers make certain that their products, materials, processes and services are safe, compliant and fit for purpose. From early R&D, through complex regulatory approvals and into production, our global laboratory network of scientists, engineers, and technologists support customers to achieve assurance over product quality, sustainable outcomes, and market access.

 

While we are proud of our global reach, working at Element feels like being part of a smaller company. We empower you to take charge of your career, and reward excellence and integrity with growth and development.

 

Industries across the world depend on our care, attention to detail and the absolute accuracy of our work. The role we have to play in creating a safer world is much bigger than our organization.

Diversity Statement:

At Element, we always take pride in putting our people first. We are an equal opportunity employer that recognizes diversity and inclusion as fundamental to our Vision of becoming â€œthe worldâ€™s most trusted testing partnerâ€.

 

All suitably qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment on the basis of objective work related criteria and without regard for the following: race, colour, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability, and/or protected veteran status, or other characteristics in accordance with the applicable governing laws.

title: AZ Long Haul Driver - Brampton, ON
description:
Overview:

Location:Brampton, ON, Ingersoll, ON (summer 2023)    Department:Dot Transportation Canada, Inc. Reports To:Director of Transportation

 

Pay Range - $0.64 per mile, plus $50/night Layover  

 

Your Role â€“ Operate commercial tractor trailer with a max GVWR of 80,000lbs, to and from set locations.

 

  • Safely and efficiently operate equipment
  • Comply with all company, legal and regulatory requirements
  • Meet established company goals
  • Read and understand driver load paperwork
  • Perform other duties as required

 

Role Specifics â€“ In this role, you will also:

  • Work in all weather conditions
  • Drive, sit, walk and stand as required by the job
  • Perform regular, physical activity including lifting up to 25 KG on a regular basis

What Can Dot Offer You?

As a family-owned and -operated company, we feel we have created a strong family culture within our business. As a vital part of that family unit, we want to ensure you feel included and respected. We appreciate the opinions of our employees. In addition to an inclusive working environment, we will provide you with:

  • RRSP with a company match and profit sharing
  • Paid time-off benefits and paid sick leave
  • Latest equipment, EDL and equipped tractors
  • Phone Allowance

Safety: This position assumes responsibility for the workplace safety of self and co-workers, and for the safety conditions of the work locations, exercise and promotes safe behaviors and show unyielding support of programs, rules and policies regarding safety.

 

EOE/AA Employer: Dot believes all persons are entitled to equal employment opportunities. Dot will not discriminate against its employees or applicants for employment because of sex, race, color, religion, national origin, age, sexual orientation, disability, or veteran status or other basic classes protected by applicable federal or state law provided they are qualified for employment or for existing positions.

Qualifications:

We Need You To Have:

  • AZ license with a clean abstract
  • A minimum of 12-months experience as an AZ driver
  • Medical examiner certificate
  • Haz-Mat certification
  • Ability to read, speak, and comprehend the English language

Weâ€™d Like You To Have:

  • Previous long haul driving experience in Canada and US

title: AZ Driver
description:
Responsibilities:

The incumbent is responsible for reviewing appropriate documentation to ensure delivery or pick up of goods is done accurately and in a timely manner. He/she maintains radio or telephone contact with a dispatcher to receive delivery or pick up instructions or to receive notice of changes in scheduled delivery or pick up. The Driver loads, secures and unloads cargo as required.

Requirements:

The incumbent must have a Class A with a Z endorsement license to operate a tractor trailer and have a clean driver abstract, with at least 2 years of driving experience.  The incumbent must maintain a clean CVOR Driver abstract.

Benefits:

  • Competitive base and bonus program
  • Full benefits coverage without paying premiums from day 1
  • Defined Benefit Pension Plan
  • Group RRSP program with company matching

Wellness:

  • Health & Fitness Subsidy
  • Opportunity to stay in Tremco’s beautiful Cottage without any cost to employees
  • Access to company EAP program

Tremco Canada is committed to the fundamental principle of equal employment opportunity. We are committed to treating people fairly, with respect and dignity, and to offer equal employment opportunities based on an individual's qualifications, performance and merit – free from discrimination on the basis of race, colour, sex, sexual orientation, religion, age, marital status, disability, or any other basis prohibited by law.

Accommodations for job applicants with disabilities are available on request.

title: Specialized Driver
description:
The Boom Truck Operator works as the leader of a two person crew responsible for the operation of Cando's boom trucks. The Boom Truck Operator ensures safety is a high priority at all times and procedures are respected and followed as per CROR and COR regulations. 

Roles and Responsibilities

  • Operates and maintains railway picker truck on track including cutting rail and loading product into rail gondola cars; when licensed, operates unit on main line track and on road
  • Builds relationships with the customer; interfaces with the customer via phone, radio, or in person
  • Maintains production quotas set by the customer
  • Loads the equipment and secures for transport
  • Purchases supplies necessary to maintain the equipment and the safety environment
  • Maintains necessary journals or maintenance documents as required by the Department; completes daily paperwork such as car loading, billing information, PO's, and transmission of all daily activities as pertinent to track daily costing
  • Transports the team to and from various locations
  • Trains and mentors other employees on the operation and maintenance requirements of the picker truck
  • Guides employees in the safe operations of equipment and the rules and regulations required to perform the operations of the Department

Skills, Knowledge, and Abilities

  • Holds and obtains a valid driver's license (car air brake endorsement an asset); holds or working toward a Class 1 driver's license; clean Driver's Abstract (last three years)
  • Demonstrated team building skills including interpersonal, communication, and problem solving as well as show strong leadership skills
  • Be able to demonstrate the ability to be safe on track and to comprehend oral direction
  • Ability to lift 50 pounds regularly
  • Ability to understand, record, and apply oral and written instructions; document work activities, and prepare required reports or work orders
  • Mechanical ability is preferred, with the capability of performing troubleshooting and maintenance in the field
  • A base knowledge of costing and computers is an asset
  • Willingness to adapt to new technological changes and improvements and participate in training and self-development programs
  • Ability to travel for extended periods of time (typically 10 days on, 4 days off) away from the home base of Brandon; work in remote locations in all weather conditions

Education & Experience

  • Minimum one year operating a Boom Truck required
  • Possess or able to secure CROR, eRailsafe, and First Aid/CPR certifications
  • Experience with boom truck, Brandt truck, hi-rail truck, low bedding, end dumps, or experience with equipment hauling,

Note: This description is not intended to limit the assignment of work or be construed as a complete list of the many duties to be performed by the incumbent. The qualifications are provided so interested candidates understand of the level of expertise required in this position.

title: Driver
description:
Company Description

WHO ARE WE?

We've been serving Canadian clients for over 75 years. The companies that began independently and now form Dexterra Group have an outstanding record of supporting the infrastructure and built assets that play a vital role in our society and helping our clients achieve higher performance and productivity. Powered by passionate people, we bring the right teams with the right skills together – offering both experience and regional expertise so companies can operate their day to day, confidently and successfully.

Job Description

WHO ARE WE?

We've been serving Canadian clients for over 75 years. The companies that began independently and now form Dexterra Group have an outstanding record of supporting the infrastructure and built assets that play a vital role in our society and helping our clients achieve higher performance and productivity. Powered by passionate people, we bring the right teams with the right skills together – offering both experience and regional expertise so companies can operate their day to day, confidently and successfully.

WHAT’S THE JOB?

The Driver provides rides for employees to and from site. They are also involved in delivering and shuffling materials to sites. The driver will be occasionally required to drive Covid-19 Positive cases.

The position involves a remote work lifestyle in a camp setting with the following amenities:

  • All meals and accommodation provided free of charge
  • Private room
  • Access to Wi-Fi
  • Cable TV in your room
  • Linens & towels provided
  • Access to laundry facilities

Key responsibilities include:

  • Bringing employees to and from site
  • Delivering/shuffling materials to and from sites
  • Other duties as assigned around the camp site
  • Time management – arranging pick up times
  • Focusing on safety and filling out required paperwork
  • Being personable and professional
Qualifications

WHO ARE WE LOOKING FOR?

  • Valid F or C Class Driver's License required
  • Must be double vaccinated and have proof of vaccination
  • High school diploma or general education degree (GED) and at least 2 years experience.
  • Current First Aid Level 1 certification is an asset.
  • Must have a clean driver’s abstract
  • Be able to handle the following physical demands:
    • Lift, carry, push, or pull up to 50 lbs
    • Climb ladders or stairs.
    • Stand, walk, squat, kneel or sit according to task for extended lengths of time.
    • Perform repetitive hand work requiring full use of both hands.
    • Perform work with arms at full length.
    • Work with arms above shoulder height.


Additional Information

WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU?

  • Ability to expand skills in a large camp atmosphere
  • Opportunity to move up in positions
  • Zero cost of living while working on site

 

Work Schedule and Remuneration:

Drivers will be required to do occasional driving or be required to work on a rotational schedule of 2 weeks on and 2 weeks off. 

Wages are paid as a day rate. Specific pay details are discussed at the interview phase.

#whatwedomatters

Dexterra  Group is  an  equal  opportunity  employer  committed  to  diversity  and  inclusion.  We  are  pleased  to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans’ status, Indigenous status, or any other legally protected factors. Disability-related accommodations during the application process are available upon request.

title: Driver - Local
description:
Overview:

This is a local driving position.   Drives tractor and trailer combination to transport cargo freight. May pick-up, load, unload, and deliver cargo freight.

Responsibilities:

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSBILITIES include the following.   Other duties may be assigned.

 

Drives vehicle to specified destination in accordance with company procedures and governmental regulations. Applies knowledge of commercial driving and skills in maneuvering vehicle at varying speeds and in difficult situations, such as heavy traffic, inclement weather or in tight loading/unloading dock areas. Maintains telephone or radio contact with dispatcher to receive pick-up or delivery instructions.

 

Loads and unloads trailer, either individually or with assistance of dock workers, with or without mechanical freight-handling equipment. Ensures that load is secure by using a variety of cargo straps, tarps, ropes, chains, lumber and other tools. May perform lifting, pushing, pulling and carrying of freight.

 

Hooks and unhooks trailers from tractor.

 

Inspects tractor or truck for defects before, during and after trips and submits reports indication truck or tractor condition. Notes condition of various equipment items such as tires, lights, brakes, fuel, oil and water. Install and remove tire chains as required by weather conditions.

 

Ensures that all shipping documents (manifest, bills of lading, delivery receipts, hazardous material placarding, etc.) required to move the shipment is available and complete.

 

Performs all duties in accordance with company policies and procedures; and complies with all Federal, Provincial, and local regulations for the safe operation of a commercial motor vehicle. Maintains records as required, including drivers logs, vehicle inspections, and other reports. Reports any and all safety hazards. Reports accidents (vehicular and/or cargo) or on-the-job injury immediately to the on-duty supervisor.

 

Dependable and consistent attendance required.

Qualifications:

QUALIFICATION REQUIREMENTS:

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

 

EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE:

Must have a high school diploma or general education degree (GED).

 

LANGUAGE SKILLS:

Ability to read and interpret documents such as hazardous materials shipping regulations, safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals. Ability to write routine reports and correspondence. Ability to present information and respond to questions from managers, customers and the general public.

Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out instructions in written, oral or diagram form. Ability

to deal with problems involving several concrete variables in standardized situations.

   

MATHEMATICAL SKILLS:

Ability to add, subtract, multiply, and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals. Must be able to conduct telephone communication.

 

REASONING ABILITY:

Ability to apply commonsense understanding to carry out instructions in written, oral or diagram form. Ability to deal with problems involving several concrete variables in standardized situations.

 

CERTIFICATES, LICENSES, REGISTRATIONS:

Must have current, valid Commercial Drivers License (class 1), air brake endorsement, with hazardous materials endorsement.

 

OTHER SKILLS AND ABILITIES:

Ability to work with others.

Applicant must be at least 21 years of age with a good driving record. Must be willing to work in the warehouse and yard with minimal driving time to start.

 

PHYSICAL DEMANDS:

Must be able to lift up to 75 lbs. Must be able to sit, stand or walk for extended periods. Must be able to reach overhead. Must be able to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools, or controls for extended periods. Must be able to stoop, kneel, crawl, crouch, or crawl to examine equipment and cargo. Must be able to install and remove 60 pound tire chains as required by weather conditions. Must be able to push or pull freight up to 4000 pounds with the use of a pallet jack. May be required to reposition (push or pull) a 3500 pound dolly on uneven surfaces while hooking a set of trailers.

 

WORK ENVIRONMENT:

While performing the duties of this job, the employee regularly works in outside weather conditions. The employee also may work near moving mechanical parts and may be exposed to fumes or airborne particles and vibration. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.

 

OTHER COMMENTS:

Position is located in a non-smoking facility.

Women and minorities are encouraged to apply.

Successful candidate must pass a pre-employment drug and background check.

title: Driver
description:
*Please submit all application documents in PDF format*

We know the importance of stability during these unprecedented times and as an essential service, we've been steadily growing our employee numbers since March 2020. With many large projects on the horizon, it's an exciting time to join our team and become part of our stable, growing organization and industry.

About Houle:

At Houle, we are passionate about building resilient communities. From airports, shipping terminals, and water treatment facilities, to hospitals, universities, and shopping centres, we deliver integrated electrical solutions for our industrial, commercial, institutional and residential customers.

While we are leaders in electrical construction, we also specialize in a wide range of in-house technology solutions, including audio visual, building automation, healthcare systems, network systems, and security and life-safety. As a certified Great Place to Work, and one of Canada's Best Managed Companies, we take pride in our talented people and collaborative culture that bring our client's vision to life.

About the position:

Currently, we are looking for an experienced Driver to join our Warehouse team in Burnaby, BC.

Reporting to the Warehouse Operations Manager, this position is responsible for ensuring materials are delivered to site safely and efficiently.

Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Safety First: Obey all traffic laws and drive defensively
  • Coordinate with Shipper / Receiver on deliveries for the following day
  • Safely and effectively arrive on site as scheduled
  • Plan each route based on best road and traffic conditions
  • Load and unload parcels from the vehicle to prevent damage
  • Rig and strap loads properly to minimize movement when driving
  • Communicate with sites (Customers) and Shipper / Receiver any changes / opportunities to improve the daily delivery plan
  • Organize regular cleaning and maintenance services for the vehicle (time will be allotted for this purpose)
  • Train a backup driver for time off coverage, and days when two drivers are needed

Experience and Skills:

  • Experience in a similar role where the primary responsibility is driving
  • Class 4 Drivers License and Clean Driving Record
  • Forklift License
  • Ability to drive a cube truck
  • Familiarity with the Lower Mainland region (roads, traffic, etc)
  • Understanding of the electrical industry an asset
  • Basic computer skills
  • Ability to communicate with all stakeholders

Culture is important at Houle. You must be collaborative in nature. You are a solution focused team player and always willing to learn. You are a bright, ambitious, honest, and a straight forward professional. Your personable nature will fit well within the friendly working environment.

The salary for this position will be commensurate with experience. Houle offers an exciting, enjoyable work environment, competitive benefits package as well as a competitive incentive plan and many company sponsored events.

To apply, please visit https://www.houle.ca/current-career-opportunities/ and click on the listing for "Driver". Opportunity will remain open until filled.

*Please submit all application documents in PDF format*

title: Driver, AZ - Canada
description:
Description



What we do: Rain for Rent moves water every day. We are the leading provider of temporary liquid handling solutions and are known for our systems engineering expertise, ability to tackle complex jobs cost effectively, and providing high value to organizations with critical liquid management issues. Our experienced teams, backed by skilled engineers, are continually working to redefine what is expected from a liquids handling provider by developing new equipment and harnessing technology for the most demanding environments. Our Rain for Rent solutions exceed customers’ expectations for service and quality for their water-handling, irrigation and temporary liquid-storage problems. We strive to effectively and efficiently complete projects safely, on time and the right the first time.



To learn more about us please check out our website here. (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IfacXlPz9a8)



Rain for Rent’s employees are proud to work for this family owned business which has been in business for more than 80 years. We are committed to providing consistent, quality products and services to customers across the U.S., Canada and the UK from more than 65 locations. Honesty and integrity are valued at Rain for Rent and employees are committed to exceeding expectations for service and quality to our customers.



As a Driver, you are the first line of customer service for our customers. We want you on our team if you enjoy working outside and delivering and installing systems for customers.



* C$5,000 Sign-On Bonus (paid out over 1 year) *



What we offer:• Advancing your career through company provided training and development • A competitive base salary paid on a weekly basis• Nine paid holidays and paid time off program• Tuition reimbursement• Employees also participate in excellent Benefits (http://www.rainforrent.com/) including: Medical, dental, vision and a matching 401k plan



When you join the Rain for Rent team, you will have the opportunity to make friends in the course of doing good business and can contribute positively to your community. The choice is easy. Join the Rain for Rent team today.



Rain for Rent is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, disability, veteran status, gender identity, and sexual orientation, and other statuses protected by law.

Qualifications


Education

Required


+ High School or GED or better




Experience

Required


+ Minimum 6 months working in safely in an industrial environment


+ Minimum 6 months work experience using mechanical/technical skills


+ Valid AZ license


+ 18 months truck driving experience

title: Driver
description:
Company Description

About Huawei

With 194,000 employees and operating in more than 170 countries and regions, Huawei is a leading global creator and provider of information and communications technology (ICT) infrastructure and smart devices. Integrated solutions span across four key domains – telecom networks, IT, smart devices, and cloud services. Huawei is committed to bringing digital to every person, home and organization for a fully connected, intelligent world.

About Huawei Canada

Huawei Canada focuses on fundamental research and development aimed at solving complex technical problems in emerging technologies like 5G, AI, Human Computer Interaction and Autonomous Driving. With ongoing research initiatives with 10 Universities across Canada and strategic collaboration agreements with several Universities, we support Canada’s rich research community.  In 2020, Huawei Canada ranked among the Top 20 corporate R&D investors in the country with a huge 40% increase in R&D investment year over year. Huawei Canada was established in 2008 and now has a total workforce of 1,200 in our six research centers across Canada.

“Huawei will continue to be an important contributor to Canada’s knowledge-based economy,” “Openness and diversity are Canada’s great strengths. They help attract global talent and business. Huawei Canada’s R&D spending creates jobs, trains talents, supports fundamental research, and accelerates knowledge-to-impact in Canada. We are proud of all of that.”

Changtian Cai, President, Huawei Canada R&D.

Why work with Huawei Canada?

You will have the opportunity to work on real-world problems that impact people across the globe.  Many of our researchers are actively involved in publishing conference and journal papers, inventing patents and solving challenging technical problems. With cutting edge tools, access to highly specialized leaders and researchers, and significant funding, you will be well supported to fulfil your potential and pursue your professional dreams.

Job Description

GENERAL SUMMARY:

We are currently seeking a shuttle driver to join our team .The successful candidate will process the following:

·        Must have a G license.

·        Must have a clean driver abstract.

·        Must be clean and presentable and well spoken.

·        Must be a team player with a positive attitude.

·        You must be able to communicate effectively with all parties.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

·        Manage company’s shuttle ( pick up and drop off )

·        Follow the eAdmin vehicle booking schedule

·        Maintain driver logs as applicable and complete pre-trip inspections

·        Maintain vehicle’s maintenance record

·        Adhere to all safety  requirements

·        Follow all Procedures and Quality Control Procedures

·        Perform any other duties as assigned by the coordinator

Qualifications

Education and/or Certifications/Licensures:

 Minimum:  High school diploma or GED.Required for Class G driver license with clean driving record
 

Relevant Work Experience:

Minimum:  5 years of driving experience in Canada

Preferred:  3 years truck/shuttle driving experience

 

Skills (Technical or General):

Ability to speak, read and write English. Chinese language can be considered as asset.

Be able to work flexible time and overtime

Be able to work under pressure and time limit



Additional Information

We thank all applicants for their interest, however only those candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.

title: AZ Driver US
description:
Job Description

Since our inception, XTL has strived to be the best we can be. Our commitment applies to our employees, our customers, our partners, our environment and our government. Through consistent hard work and an unwavering dedication, XTL is recognized as a leading service provider in our industry.

XTL is growing and hiring experienced AZ Drivers and Owner Operators based in Etobicoke, Ontario for our regular runs to the East Coast in US. We have regular customers and lanes along with consistent loads and amount of work.

Requirements:

  • Must have valid AZ driver License - mandatory
  • 1 year of commercial Cross Border driving experience - Mandatory
  • Clean Drive Abstract and CVOR - preferred
  • Clear Criminal search - mandatory
  • Fast Card is as an asset

XTL Offers:

  • Dedicated Truck
  • Single Runs
  • Fully Automatic New International trucks assigned from 2019-2021 and a fleet which is renewed every 3-4 years
  • Flexible Schedule
  • On-site parking
  • Dedicated Driver Manager
  • A friendly dispatch atmosphere
  • A professional work culture
  • Back home every week
  • Regular customers in States
  • No hand Bombing

Benefits:

  • 100% benefits by the company from Day 1 including Dental care, Extended health care, Life insurance, Vision care
  • LMIA Program Offered (T&C Applied)
  • RRSP Program
  • Direct deposit on a weekly basis
  • Fuel & Safety Bonus
  • Mentor program for 2 weeks
  • $23.50 â€“ $25.50 per hour

Responsibilities:

  • Operate and drive tractors and move freight in a safe and responsible manner assigned by XTL Transport Inc. , while in compliance with all laws and transportation regulations while maintaining a safe driving record.
  • Maintain compliance with XTL Transport policies and procedures, while working safely.
  • As an XTL Driver Ambassador, establish and maintain positive working relationships with the primary contacts at each account
  • Complete all necessary paperwork fully and accurately
  • In collaboration with the dispatch team, get the opportunity to drive dedicated routes
  • Able to keep an activities e-log and log hours efficiently
  • Maintain a positive attitude towards customers
  • Maneuver trucks into loading and unloading positions
  • Collect and verify delivery instructions

 

    Please call or Meet in Person for more details about the Owner Operator pay package and company driver pay package.

    Sakshi - Recruiter:

    1-866-985-7295 / 1-800-665-9318 / 647-463-0470/ 416-742-2345 ext. 4496

    www.xtl.com

    **We thank all candidates for their application however please note that only qualified candidates will be contacted and considered for potential employment**

    If you are inspired to be a Company AZ Driver then you are the Driving Force behind XTL

    Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

    Salary: $23.50-$25.50 per hour

     

    COVID-19 considerations:
    All XTL employees are supposed to wear masks all the time and the premises are professionally sanitized on regular basis. Everyone is strictly adhering to and following the 2m apart distancing.

    #ONTdriver

title: AZ Dedicated Driver -- Nights
description:
Company Description

For 60 years, Manitoulin Transport has been providing comprehensive transportation and logistics solutions for clients across North America. Our success lies in our innovation and safety, and our dedication to reliable, on-time delivery

Job Description

This will be a Monday - Friday nighttime position servicing one of our dedicated customers in South Western Ontario area.

You will be required to complete your deliveries in an assigned pre-loaded order in a safe and efficient manner.  Also, complete pickups as required. 

This Dedicated Run will Start and Finish in Cambridge, ON

Qualifications

  • Able to multi-task in a fast pace environment
  • Must be hardworking, customer orientated and have a good knowledge of South Western Ontario
  • Ability to lift over 50 lbs
  • Electric Pallet jack qualified (will train)
  • Comfortable with computers (ELD)
  • Comfortable with working alone with minimal direction or contact
  • Valid AZ Driver's Licence
  • Clean Criminal record
  • Clean Drivers Abstract
  • TDG Certification (will train)
  • Able to accept change mid-stream
  • Punctual, reliable, problem solver, driven, able to work independently


Additional Information

       What do we offer to you? 

  • The chance to gain valuable experience
  • Competitive Pay (Salary) & full benefits program
  • A Profit Sharing Program
  • Scholarship Program

title: Driver
description:
Company Overview:

Whether you are experienced in the green industry, a professional looking for a career change, or a new graduate or veteran transitioning into the workforce, we are confident you will find opportunity and reward with SiteOne.  

 

SiteOne Landscape Supply is the largest and only national wholesale distributor of landscaping products in the United States and Canada. With over 500 branches across the U.S. and Canada, we offer a comprehensive selection of products including:  irrigation supplies, fertilizer and control products, nursery goods, hardscapes, landscape lighting, drainage and erosion control products, tools, and other landscaping accessories and supplies.

 

Come grow with our associates who are customer obsessed, always safe, continuously improving, and having fun!

Position Overview:

As a part of our dedicated team, you will be operating one of our vehicles to deliver world class service and products to our customers. Drivers are responsible for loading and unloading trucks in addition to working with teammates to ensure the branch is operating successfully.

 

What youâ€™ll do:

  • Operate vehicle in accordance with local, state and federal transportation regulations
  • Ability to read and write to record and maintain daily records
  • Regular bending, lifting, stretching and reaching both below the waist and above the head
  • Ability to lift up to 65lbs in a warehouse environment
  • Perform job duties within our safety guidelines
Skills We Are Seeking::
  • High School or secondary diploma or equivalent preferred

Perks:

  • Medical, Dental and Vision plans
  • Paid Time Off, Paid Holidays
  • Competitive Compensation
  • Company paid life insurance, Short Term Disability and Long-Term Disability Insurance
  • Product Discounts
  • Tuition Reimbursement
  • Opportunity for Advancement

 

THE INFORMATION CONTAINED HEREIN IS NOT INTENDED TO BE AN EXHAUSTIVE LIST OF ALL RESPONSIBILITIES, DUTIES AND QUALIFICATIONS REQUIRED OF INDIVIDUALS PERFORMING THE JOB. THE QUALIFICATIONS DETAILED IN THIS JOB DESCRIPTION ARE NOT CONSIDERED THE MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS NECESSARY TO PERFORM THE JOB, BUT RATHER AS GUIDELINES. THEY MAY VARY FROM POSITION TO POSITION.

title: Driver - Local
description:
This is a local driving position.  Drives tractor and trailer combination to transport cargo freight. May pick-up, load, unload, and deliver cargo freight.


Responsibilities

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSBILITIES include the following.  Other duties may be assigned.

 

Drives vehicle to specified destination in accordance with company procedures and governmental regulations. Applies knowledge of commercial driving and skills in maneuvering vehicle at varying speeds and in difficult situations, such as heavy traffic, inclement weather or in tight loading/unloading dock areas. Maintains telephone or radio contact with dispatcher to receive pick-up or delivery instructions.

 

Loads and unloads trailer, either individually or with assistance of dock workers, with or without mechanical freight-handling equipment. Ensures that load is secure by using a variety of cargo straps, tarps, ropes, chains, lumber and other tools. May perform lifting, pushing, pulling and carrying of freight.

 

Hooks and unhooks trailers from tractor.

 

Inspects tractor or truck for defects before, during and after trips and submits reports indication truck or tractor condition. Notes condition of various equipment items such as tires, lights, brakes, fuel, oil and water. Install and remove tire chains as required by weather conditions.

 

Ensures that all shipping documents (manifest, bills of lading, delivery receipts, hazardous material placarding, etc.) required to move the shipment is available and complete.

 

Performs all duties in accordance with company policies and procedures; and complies with all Federal, Provincial, and local regulations for the safe operation of a commercial motor vehicle. Maintains records as required, including drivers logs, vehicle inspections, and other reports. Reports any and all safety hazards. Reports accidents (vehicular and/or cargo) or on-the-job injury immediately to the on-duty supervisor.

 

Dependable and consistent attendance required.


Qualifications

QUALIFICATION REQUIREMENTS:

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

 

EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE:

Must have a high school diploma or general education degree (GED).

 

LANGUAGE SKILLS:

Ability to read and interpret documents such as hazardous materials shipping regulations, safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals. Ability to write routine reports and correspondence. Ability to present information and respond to questions from managers, customers and the general public.

Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out instructions in written, oral or diagram form. Ability

to deal with problems involving several concrete variables in standardized situations.

  

MATHEMATICAL SKILLS:

Ability to add, subtract, multiply, and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals. Must be able to conduct telephone communication.

 

REASONING ABILITY:

Ability to apply commonsense understanding to carry out instructions in written, oral or diagram form. Ability to deal with problems involving several concrete variables in standardized situations.

 

CERTIFICATES, LICENSES, REGISTRATIONS:

Must have current, valid Commercial Drivers License (class 1), air brake endorsement, with hazardous materials endorsement.

 

OTHER SKILLS AND ABILITIES:

Ability to work with others.

Applicant must be at least 21 years of age with a good driving record. Must be willing to work in the warehouse and yard with minimal driving time to start.

 

PHYSICAL DEMANDS:

Must be able to lift up to 75 lbs. Must be able to sit, stand or walk for extended periods. Must be able to reach overhead. Must be able to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools, or controls for extended periods. Must be able to stoop, kneel, crawl, crouch, or crawl to examine equipment and cargo. Must be able to install and remove 60 pound tire chains as required by weather conditions. Must be able to push or pull freight up to 4000 pounds with the use of a pallet jack. May be required to reposition (push or pull) a 3500 pound dolly on uneven surfaces while hooking a set of trailers.

 

WORK ENVIRONMENT:

While performing the duties of this job, the employee regularly works in outside weather conditions. The employee also may work near moving mechanical parts and may be exposed to fumes or airborne particles and vibration. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.

 

OTHER COMMENTS:

Position is located in a non-smoking facility.

Women and minorities are encouraged to apply.

Successful candidate must pass a pre-employment drug and background check.

title: Driver
description:
We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.

What is a Store Driver?

Entry level store position capable of supporting delivery of parts to commercial customers. The role has the responsibility to deliver parts to our commercial customers and assist with task and inventory processes in the store. This position can be part time or full time and must be fleet safety certified.

Primary Responsibilities
• Safely deliver parts to customers as needed
• Pick and stage parts for customer orders
• Pick up returns and cores
• Drop off weekly / monthly sales flyer
• Daily collection of credit accounts

Secondary Responsibilities
• Store Cleanliness including floors, bathrooms, facing, dusting, parking lot
• General stocking including truck stocking and back stock

Success Factors
• Basic driving and navigation ability
• Ability to use delivery board system
• Friendly communication
• Ability to locate and stock parts
• Safety knowledge and skills
• Operating inventory systems (Back stock) and store equipment

Essential Job Skills Necessary for Success as a Driver
• Communicate effectively and build strong relationships with customers, peers and management
• Read and interpret documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, parts catalogs, and procedure manuals
• Use basic math accurately: add, subtract, multiply, and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals
• Ability to work an assortment of days, evenings, and weekends as needed

Prior Experience that Sets a Driver up for Success
Automotive parts experience is preferred

Certificates, Licenses, Registrations
Must have a valid driver's license and be fleet safety certified

Physical Demands
The physical demands and work environment described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job, with or without reasonable accommodation. While performing the duties of this job, the employee will predominantly be walking or standing. The employee is required to be able to talk and hear, and use hands and fingers to handle or feel; reach with hands and arms; climb or balance; and stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee must frequently lift and/or move up to 50 pounds and occasionally lift and/or move up to 100 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus.

Work Environment
The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job, with or without reasonable accommodation. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is usually working inside; however, they will occasionally be outside and exposed to various weather conditions while performing such tasks as installing batteries and wiper blades. The employee is also occasionally exposed to moving mechanical parts; high, precarious places; toxic or caustic chemicals; risk of electrical shock; explosives; and vibration. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.

title: AZ Company Driver - Afternoon Shift
description:
• Brantford, Start and Finish (546 Elgin Street)
  • Local, Home Every Night
  • Afternoon Shift - 3PM starts
    • Shift Premium of $1.00 for Afternoons 
  • Paid Direct Deposit, Weekly
  • Benefits and Defined Contribution Pension Plan (starting first of the month, following a full month of employment)

Job Responsibilities:

  • Delivery of finished product to the customer/pick-up of raw materials at the mills
  • Responsible for securing a safe & legal load
  • Perform related computer functions (scanning, billing, finalizing, etc.)
  • Complete daily trip sheet and/or electronic logs as applicable and ensure that all associated records are completed and submitted
  • Maintains logs, drivers trip reports, vehicle condition reports, related records, maintenance and repairs to vehicles
  • Maintains eligibility for commercial driver’s license and complies with applicable Department of Transportation regulations as well as local traffic laws governing operation of vehicle.
  • Responsible for the safe operation of vehicle on public roadways and customer & supplier locations
  • Conducts themselves with a professional demeanour at all times, to project an appropriate corporate image in all dealings with customers and the general public
  • On occasion may be responsible for picking up customer payments after delivery has been made
  • Performs all other duties as assigned

Qualifications:

  • AZ license
  • Knowledge of Load securement requirements (NSC Standard 10)
  • Knowledge of Hours of Service Regulations
  • Subject to completion of all pre-employment screenings

Years of Experience:

  • 2-3+ years of proven commercial driving experience (48’/53’ tractor-trailer combinations)
  • 6 months – 1+ year of Flatbed/Rolltite experience required
  • Multi axle steel flatbed hauling experience required

Skills:

  • Knowledgeable and experienced in load securement (strapping, chaining, tarping)

Physical Job Requirements:

  • Sit for long periods of time while driving for up to 75% of workday
  • Maintain visual awareness for up to 100% of the workday while driving, working on trailers and being at plants
  • Control and operation of a flatbed truck for up to 75% of the workday
  • Exposure to noise for up to 75% of the workday while driving
  • Perform static and dynamic lifting - occasionally lifting of chains, binders, bunks, dunnage, posts at shoulder height; moderate lifting of these at knuckle and bench height. Total weight is between 20 to 25 pounds.
  • Occasionally carrying 20 to 25 pounds of chain, for up to a 40 feet distance
  • Occasionally dragging or moving chains, binders and slider kits with weights up to 25 pounds
  • Occasionally climbing stairs and ladders at Samuel facilities and customers to get on and off trailers
  • Occasionally reaching forward, overhead and/or bent over for chains
  • Occasional bending forward and squatting

**Occasional refers to 0%-25% of a workday; Moderate refers to 26%-50%; Frequent refers to 51%to 75%; Constant refers to 76% to 100%.

title: Driver
description:
Job Responsibilities
We are a same-day delivery service helping local businesses deliver retail items to their customers. 

  • Reviewing orders before and after delivery to ensure that orders are complete, the charges are correct, and the customer is satisfied.

  • Assisting with loading and unloading items from vehicles.

  • Providing excellent customer service, answering questions, and handling complaints from clients.



Skills Required

  • Valid driver's license issued by the state where you intend to work.

  • Clean driving record.

  • Experience may be required or preferred.

  • Willingness to adhere to assigned routes, schedules, safety procedures, and transportation laws.

  • Strong time management and customer service skills.

  • Ability to walk, drive, and lift and carry heavy items for extended periods.

  • Attention to detail.


Let us know when you're available, and we'll send you deliveries via our app. It's a super flexible way to earn money on your own schedule.
